original: Namo tassa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa
analyzed: namaḥ tassa bhagavataḥ arahataḥ sammāsambuddhassa
translated: Homage to that Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened.

original: Abhidhammapiṭake
analyzed: abhidhamma piṭake
translated: In the Abhidhamma Piṭaka

original: Dhammasaṅgaṇī-mūlaṭīkā
translated: The Commentary on the Dhammasanganī

original: Vīsatigāthāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: vīsati gāthā vaṇṇanā
translated: The Commentary on the Twenty Stanzas

original: 1. Dhammasaṃvaṇṇanāyaṃ satthari paṇāmakaraṇaṃ dhammassa svākkhātabhāvena satthari
analyzed: dhamma saṃvaṇṇanāyam satthari paṇāma karaṇam dhammassa svākkhāta bhāvena satthari
translated: The paying of homage to the Teacher in the Introduction is for the purpose of arousing confidence in the teacher through the excellence of the Dhamma taught by him,

original: pasādajananatthaṃ, satthu ca avitathadesanabhāvappakāsanena dhamme pasādajananatthaṃ.
analyzed: pasāda janana attham satthu ca avitatha desana bhāva pakāsanena dhamme pasāda janana attham
translated: and for the purpose of arousing confidence in the Dhamma through the demonstration of the teacher’s untarnished teaching.

original: Tadubhayappasādā hi dhammasampaṭipatti mahato ca atthassa siddhi hotīti. Atha vā🔽ratanattayapaṇāmavacanaṃ attano ratanattayapasādassa viññāpanatthaṃ, taṃ pana viññūnaṃ
analyzed: tad ubhaya ppasādā hi dhamma sampaṭipatti mahataḥ ca atthassa siddhi hoti iti atha vā  ratana ttaya paṇāma vacanam attanaḥ ratana ttaya pasādassa viññāpana attham tam pana viññūnam
translated: For the practice of the Dhamma and the accomplishment of the great purpose depend on confidence in both of them. Or alternatively,

original: cittārādhanatthaṃ, taṃ aṭṭhakathāya gāhaṇatthaṃ, taṃ sabbasampattinipphādanatthanti.
analyzed: citta ārādhana attham tam aṭṭhakathāya gāhaṇa attham tam sabba sampatti nipphādana attham ti
translated: the paying of homage to the Three Jewels is for the purpose of announcing one’s own confidence in the Three Jewels; that is done for the purpose of pleasing the wise; that is done for the purpose of taking up the commentary; that is done for the purpose of producing all attainments.

original: Idaṃ pana ācariyena adhippetappayojanaṃ antarāyavisosanaṃ. Vakkhati hi “nipaccakārassetassa…pe…
analyzed: idam pana ācariyena adhippeta ppayojanam antarāya visosanam vakkhati hi
translated: But this is the purpose intended by the teacher: the dispelling of obstacles. For it is said: “The paying of homage to the Three Jewels is for the purpose of dispelling obstacles. For when people set out on a journey, they first make sure that their equipment is complete, and then they set out on their journey. In the same way, when people set out on the journey of the commentary, they first dispel obstacles and then set out on the journey of the commentary. And the paying of homage to the Three Jewels is the means for dispelling obstacles. For when people set out on a journey, they first make sure that their equipment is complete, and then they set out on their journey. In the same way, when people set out on the journey of the commentary, they first dispel obstacles and then set out on the journey of the commentary. And the paying of homage to the Three Jewels is the means for dispelling obstacles. For when people set out on a journey, they first make sure that their equipment is complete, and then they set out on their journey. In the same way, when people set out on the journey of the commentary, they first dispel obstacles and then set out on the journey of the commentary. And the paying of homage to the Three Jewels is the means for dispelling obstacles. For when people set out on a journey, they first make sure that their equipment is complete, and then they set out on their journey. In the same way, when people set out on the journey of the commentary, they first dispel obstacles and then set out on the journey of the commentary. And the

original: asesato”ti. Ratanattayapaṇāmakaraṇañhi antarāyakarāpuññavighātakarapuññavisesabhāvato🔽maṅgalabhāvato bhayādiupaddavanivāraṇato ca antarāyavisosane samatthaṃ hoti. Kathaṃ🔽panetassāpuññavighātakarādibhāvo vijānitabboti? “Yasmiṃ mahānāma samaye ariyasāvako
analyzed: asesataḥ ti  maṅgala bhāvataḥ bhaya ādi upaddava nivāraṇato ca antarāya visosane samattham hoti katham  pana itassa apuñña vighāta kara ādi bhāvaḥ vijānitabbaḥ ti yasmin mahā nāma samaye ariyasāvako
translated: for it is able to remove obstacles by the special nature of its merit which destroys the non-meritorious and by its auspiciousness and by its preventing the occurrence of fear and other calamities.🔽But how is it to be known that it has the nature of destroying the non-meritorious, etc.?

original: tathāgataṃ anussarati, nevassa tasmiṃ samaye rāgapariyuṭṭhitaṃ cittaṃ hotī”tiādivacanato,🔽“pūjā ca pūjaneyyānaṃ, etaṃ maṅgalamuttama”nti ca, “evaṃ buddhaṃ sarantānaṃ, dhammaṃ
analyzed: tathāgatam anussarati na iva assa tasmin samaye rāga pariyuṭṭhitam cittam hoti iti ādi vacanato  pūjā ca etam ca evam buddham sarantānam dhammaṃ
translated: From the words “On the occasion, Mahānāma, on which a noble disciple recollects the Tathāgata … his mind becomes placid, enters into and acquires confidence in him” ,

original: saṅghañca bhikkhavo. Bhayaṃ vā chambhitattaṃ vā, lomahaṃso na hessatī”ti ca vacanatoti.🔽Tattha yassa satthuno paṇāmaṃ kattukāmo, tassa guṇavisesadassanatthaṃ “karuṇā viyā”tiādimāha.
analyzed: saṅgham ca bhikkhavaḥ bhayam vā chambhi tattam vā lomahaṃsaḥ na hessati iti ca vacanataḥ ti  tattha yassa satthuno paṇāmam kattu kāmo tassa guṇa visesa dassana ttham karuṇā viya iti ādim āha
translated: and from the words “Honouring those who should be honoured Is the supreme blessing” , and from the words “For those who recollect the Buddha, the Dhamma, and the Saṅgha, The bhikkhu who practises in this way Will have no fear or trembling, Nor any hair to stand on end” .🔽Herein, he says “As with compassion” in order to show the special qualities of the Master whose salutation he is going to make.

original: Guṇavisesavā hi paṇāmāraho hoti, paṇāmārahe ca kato paṇāmo vuttappayojanasiddhikarova
analyzed: guṇa visesavā hi paṇāma ārahaḥ hoti paṇāma arahe ca kato paṇāmaḥ vutta payojana siddhi karo va
translated: For one who has special qualities is worthy of salutation, and a salutation made to one who is worthy of salutation accomplishes the purpose stated.

original: hotīti. Bhagavato ca desanā vinayapiṭake karuṇāppadhānā, suttantapiṭake paññākaruṇāppadhānā.
analyzed: hoti iti bhagavato ca desanā vinaya piṭake karuṇā ppadhānā suttanta piṭake paññā karuṇā ppadhānā
translated: and the Blessed One’s teaching is concerned with compassion in the Vinaya Piṭaka and with both understanding and compassion in the Suttanta Piṭaka.

original: Teneva ca kāraṇena vinayapiṭakassa saṃvaṇṇanaṃ karontena karuṇāppadhānā bhagavato
analyzed: tena iva ca kāraṇena vinaya piṭakassa saṃvaṇṇanam karontena karuṇā ppadhānā bhagavataḥ
translated: And that is why, when commenting on the Vinaya Piṭaka, he extols the Blessed One’s compassion,

original: thomanā katā, āgamasaṃvaṇṇanañca karontena ubhayappadhānā, abhidhammadesanā pana🔽paññāppadhānāti katvā paññāppadhānameva thomanaṃ karonto “karuṇā viya sattesū”ti
analyzed: thomanā katā āgama saṃvaṇṇanañca karontena ubhaya ppadhānā abhidhamma desanā pana  paññā appadhānā ti katvā paññā appadhānam eva thomanam karonto karuṇā viya sattesu iti
translated: and when commenting on the Āgamas he extols both, but when teaching the Abhidhamma he extols understanding,🔽taking it that the teaching of the Abhidhamma is concerned with understanding.

original: karuṇaṃ upamābhāvena gahetvā paññāya thometi.
analyzed: karuṇam upamā bhāvena gahetvā paññāya thoma iti
translated: So, taking compassion as a simile, he extols understanding in the words, “Like compassion for creatures.”

original: Tattha karuṇā viyāti nidassanavacanametaṃ, yassa yathā karuṇā sabbesu sattesu pavattittha,
analyzed: tattha karuṇā viyā ti nidassana vacanam etam yassa yathā karuṇā sabbesu sattesu
translated: Herein, “like compassion” is a term expressing a simile. The meaning is that just as his compassion occurred towards all creatures,

original: evaṃ sabbesu ñeyyadhammesu paññāpi pavattitthāti attho. Sattesūti visayanidassanametaṃ.
analyzed: evam sabbesu ñeyya dhammesu paññā api pavattittha ati attho sattesu iti visaya nidassanam etam
translated: so his understanding occurred towards all things that can be known. “For creatures” is a term expressing the domain.

original: Paññāti nidassetabbadhammanidassanaṃ. Yassāti tadadhiṭṭhānapuggalanidassanaṃ. Mahesinoti
analyzed: paññā iti nidassetabba dhamma nidassanam yassa ti tad adhiṭṭhāna puggala nidassanam mahesino ti
translated: “Understanding” is a term expressing the thing to be exemplified. “His” is a term expressing the person who is the basis for it. “The Great Sage’s” is a term expressing the person.

original: tabbisesanaṃ. Ñeyyadhammesūti paññāvisayanidassanaṃ. Sabbesūti tabbisesanaṃ. Pavattitthāti
analyzed: tad visesanam ñeyya dhammesu iti paññā visaya nidassanam sabbesu iti tad visesanam pavattittha ati
translated: and that is a specification. In the knowable states: this shows the domain of understanding. All: this is a specification. He knows:

original: kiriyānidassanaṃ. Yathārucīti vasībhāvanidassanaṃ.
analyzed: kiriyā nidassanam yathāruci iti vasībhāva nidassanam
translated: this shows the function. As he desires: this shows mastery.

original: Tattha kiratīti karuṇā, paradukkhaṃ vikkhipati apanetīti attho. Rūpādīsu sattā visattāti
analyzed: tattha kirati iti karuṇā para dukkham vikkhipati apaneti iti atthaḥ rūpa ādīsu sattā visattā ati
translated: Herein, he is compassionate : he is karuṇā , the meaning is, he scatters , dispels, the suffering of others. Beings : beings are those who are frightened by the fear of the kinds of suffering beginning with pain.

original: sattā. Tassā pana paññattiyā khandhasantāne niruḷhabhāvato nicchandarāgāpi “sattā”ti
analyzed: sattā tassā pana paññattiyā khandha santāne niruḷha bhāvataḥ nicchanda rāgā api sattā ati
translated: But because of the established usage of the term “being” in the aggregates’ continuity, those who are without desire and lust are also called “beings.”

original: vuccanti. Pajānātīti paññā, yathāsabhāvaṃ pakārehi paṭivijjhatīti attho. Yassāti🔽aniyamanaṃ. “Tassa pāde namassitvā”ti etena niyamanaṃ veditabbaṃ. Mahesīti mahante
analyzed: vuccanti pajānāti iti paññā yathā sabhāvam pakārehi paṭivijjhati iti atthaḥ yassa ati  aniyamanam tassa pāde namassitvā iti etena niyamanam veditabbam mahesī iti mahante
translated: He understands : he is paññā , the meaning is, he penetrates by means of the modes according to the specific nature. His:🔽this is not a specification. “Having paid homage at his feet” : this should be understood as a specification. Great Seer : he is mahesi because he seeks out , he seeks, the great seers , namely, the aggregates of virtue, etc.

original: sīlakkhandhādayo esi gavesīti mahesi. Ñātabbāti ñeyyā, sabhāvadhāraṇādinā atthena
analyzed: sīlakkhandha ādayaḥ esi gavesi iti mahesi ñātabbā ati ñeyyā sabhā avadhāraṇa ādinā atthena
translated: To be known : the knowable , dhammas , are so called because of the meaning of “bearing their own specific nature,” etc.

original: dhammā. Tattha “ñeyyā”ti vacanena dhammānaṃ añeyyattaṃ paṭikkhipati. “Dhammā”ti vacanena
analyzed: dhammā tattha ñeyyā ti vacanena dhammānam añeyya ttam paṭikkhipati dhammā ati vacanena
translated: Herein, by the word “knowable” he rejects the unknowableness of dhammas. By the word “dhammas” he rejects the view that the dhammas are non-existent.

original: ñeyyānaṃ sattajīvādibhāvaṃ paṭikkhipati. Ñeyyā ca te dhammā cāti ñeyyadhammā. Sabbesūti
analyzed: ñeyyānam satta jīva ādi bhāvam paṭikkhipati ñeyyā ca te dhammā ca ati ñeyya dhammā sabbesu iti
translated: He denies that they are the sevenfold life-principle, etc., that is cognizable. And they are cognizable and they are ideas, thus they are cognizable ideas. All:

original: anavasesapariyādānaṃ. Tena aññātābhāvaṃ dasseti. Pavattitthāti uppajjittha. Yathārucīti🔽yā yā ruci yathāruci, rucīti ca icchā, kattukāmatā sā. Yā yā pavattā tappabhedā,
analyzed: anavasesa pariyādānam tena aññāta abhāvam dasseti pavattittha ati uppajjittha yathāruci iti  yā yā ruci yathāruci ruci iti ca icchā kattu kāma tā sā yā yā pavattā tad pabhedā
translated: without exception. He shows that he knows them thus. He would arise: he would occur. As he wishes:🔽whichever wish, as he wishes, for wish is desire, will to act. As he wishes is as he wishes, according to the wish. Or alternatively, as he wishes is as he wishes, according to the wish.

original: yathā vā ruci tathā, rucianurūpaṃ pavattā “yathāruci pavattitthā”ti vuccati. Yathā🔽yathā vā ruci pavattā, tathā tathā pavattā paññā “yathāruci pavattitthā”ti vuccati.
analyzed: yathā vā ruci tathā ruci anurūpam pavattā yathāruci vuccati yathā  yathā vā ruci pavattā tathā tathā pavattā paññā yathāruci vuccati
translated: As he wishes is as he wishes, according to the wish.

original: Tattha bhagavati pavattāva karuṇā bhagavato paññāya nidassananti gahetabbā. Sā hi
analyzed: tattha bhagavati pavattā ava karuṇā bhagavataḥ paññāya nidassanan ti gahetabbā sā hi
translated: Herein, it should be understood that the Blessed One’s compassion is a demonstration of the Blessed One’s understanding.

original: asādhāraṇā mahākaruṇā, na aññā. Yassāti ca karuṇāpaññānaṃ ubhinnampi ādhārapuggalanidassanaṃ.
analyzed: asādhāraṇā mahākaruṇā na aññā yassa ati ca karuṇā paññānam ubhinnam pi ādhāra puggala nidassanam
translated: For that is the Great Compassion that is not shared by others. And as he wishes is a demonstration of the person who is the support for both compassion and understanding.

original: Na hi nirādhārā karuṇā atthīti “karuṇā”ti vutte tadādhārabhūto puggalo nidassetabbo
analyzed: na hi nirādhārā karuṇā atthi iti karuṇā ati vutte tad ādhāra bhūtaḥ puggalaḥ nidassetabbaḥ
translated: For there is no compassion without a support, so when it is said “compassion” the person who is the support for it should be demonstrated.

original: hoti, so ca idha añño vutto natthi, na ca āsannaṃ vajjetvā dūrassa gahaṇe payojanaṃ🔽atthīti “yassā”ti nidassitapuggalova karuṇāya ādhāro. Tena idaṃ vuttaṃ hoti “yassa
analyzed: hoti so ca idha aññaḥ vuttaḥ natthi na ca āsannam vajjetvā dūrassa gahaṇe payojanam  atthi iti yassa ati nidassita puggalaḥ uva karuṇāya ādhāro tena idam vuttam hoti yassa
translated: and there is no other person mentioned here apart from him, and there is no point in taking one far away after rejecting one near at hand.🔽So the person indicated by the words “Whose” is the basis of compassion. What is meant is this: “Whose understanding occurs in beings as compassion does.”

original: attano karuṇā viya paññāpi pavattitthā”ti. Kathaṃ pana karuṇā sattesu pavattittha🔽yathā paññāpi dhammesu pavattitthāti? Niravasesato yathāruci ca. Bhagavato hi karuṇā
analyzed: attano karuṇā viya paññā api pavattittha ati katham pana karuṇā sattesu pavattittha  yathā paññā api dhammesu pavattittha ati niravasesataḥ yathāruci ca bhagavataḥ hi karuṇā
translated: But how does compassion occur in beings?

original: kañci sattaṃ avajjetvā sabbesu sattesu niravasesesu pavattati, pavattamānā ca rucivasena🔽ekasmiṃ anekesu ca aññehi asādhāraṇā pavattati. Na hi aññesaṃ “mahoghapakkhandānaṃ
analyzed: kañci sattam avajjetvā sabbesu sattesu niravasesesu pavattati pavattamānā ca ruci vasena  ekasmin anekesu ca aññehi asādhāraṇā pavattati na hi aññesam mahā ogha pakkhandānam
translated: As understanding occurs in ideas? It occurs in all without exception and according to inclination. For the Blessed One’s compassion occurs in all beings without exception, and it occurs according to inclination,

original: sattānaṃ natthañño koci oghā uddhatā aññatra mayā”ti passantānaṃ karuṇokkamanaṃ hoti
analyzed: sattānam oghāḥ uddhatāḥ aññatra mayā ati passantānam karuṇā ukkamanam hoti
translated: that is to say, in one or in many, and it is not shared by others. For others do not have compassion that occurs thus: “There is no one else to rescue beings who have plunged into the flood and are being swept away except me.”

original: yathā bhagavatoti. Paññāpi bhagavato sabbesu dhammesu niravasesesu pavattati, pavattamānā
analyzed: yathā bhagavataḥ ti paññā api bhagavataḥ sabbesu dhammesu niravasesesu pavattati pavattamānā
translated: But the Blessed One has it. And his understanding occurs in all ideas without exception.

original: ca ekasmiṃ anekesu ca dhammesu sabhāvakiccādijānanena anāvaraṇā asādhāraṇā pavattati
analyzed: ca ekasmin anekesu ca dhammesu sabhāva kicca ādi jānanena anāvaraṇā asādhāraṇā pavattati
translated: and in one and in many ideas, it occurs unobstructed, uncommon, according to the wish, according to the way the Blessed One sees, in the knowing of the same individual essence, function, etc.,

original: yathāruci, yathā ca passantassa bhagavato karuṇā yathāruci pavattati. Taṃ sabbaṃ🔽paṭisambhidāmagge mahākaruṇāñāṇavibhaṅgavasena jānitabbaṃ, paññāya ca yathāruci pavatti
analyzed: yathāruci yathā ca passantassa bhagavataḥ karuṇā yathāruci pavattati tam sabbam  paṭisambhidā magge mahā karuṇā ñāṇa vibhaṅga vasena jānitabbam paññāya ca yathāruci pavatti
translated: and the Blessed One’s Great Compassion occurs according to the wish. All that

original: sesāsādhāraṇañāṇavibhaṅgādivasena. Paññāgahaṇena ca tīsu kālesu appaṭihatañāṇaṃ catusaccañāṇaṃ
analyzed: sesa asādhāraṇa ñāṇa vibhaṅga ādi vasena paññā gahaṇena ca tīsu kālesu appaṭihata ñāṇam catusacca ñāṇam
translated: can be known by the method of the Great Compassion in the Path of Discrimination. And by the word ‘understanding’ the knowledge unobstructed in the three times, the knowledge of the four Truths,

original: catupaṭisambhidāñāṇaṃ, karuṇāgahaṇena mahākaruṇāsamāpattiñāṇassa gahitattā taṃ vajjetvā
analyzed: catu paṭisambhidā ñāṇam karuṇā gahaṇena mahākaruṇā samāpatti ñāṇassa gahita ttā tam vajjetvā
translated: the knowledge of the four discriminations, and by the word ‘compassion’ the knowledge of the attainment of Great Compassion, are included, and so, leaving that aside,

original: aññāni asādhāraṇañāṇāni catuvesārajjañāṇaṃ dasabalāni cha abhiññā catucattālīsa ñāṇavatthūni
analyzed: aññāni asādhāraṇa ñāṇāni catu vesārajja ñāṇam dasa balāni cha abhiññā catucattālīsa ñāṇa vatthūni
translated: the other uncommon knowledges, namely the knowledge of the four confidences, the ten powers, the six kinds of direct-knowledge, the four kinds of analytical knowledge, the forty-four grounds of knowledge,

original: sattasattati ñāṇavatthūnīti evamādayo aneke paññāppabhedā saṅgayhanti, tasmā tassā
analyzed: satta sattati ñāṇa vatthūni iti evamādayaḥ aneke paññā appabhedā saṅgayhanti tasmā tassā
translated: the seventy-seven grounds of knowledge, and so on, are included, and so these many kinds of understanding are included, and therefore

original: tassā paññāya pavattivasena yathāruci pavatti veditabbā. Tenāha “karuṇā viya…pe… yathārucī”ti.
analyzed: tassā paññāya pavatti vasena yathāruci pavatti veditabbā tena āha karuṇā yathāruci iti
translated: The way in which it occurs should be understood according to inclination, as in the case of compassion, and so on. Hence he said: “As in the case of compassion, and so on, according to inclination” .

original: Tattha karuṇāgahaṇena mahābodhiyā mūlaṃ dasseti. Mahādukkhasambādhappaṭipannañhi
analyzed: tattha karuṇā gahaṇena mahā bodhiyāḥ mūlam dasseti mahā dukkha sambādha ppaṭipannam hi
translated: Herein, by the mention of compassion he shows the root of the Great Being’s aspiration. For the Great Being, seeing the multitude of beings in the prison of great suffering,

original: sattanikāyaṃ disvā “tassa natthañño koci saraṇaṃ, ahametaṃ mutto mocessāmī”ti karuṇāya
analyzed: satta nikāyam disvā tassa natthañño koci saraṇam aham etam muttaḥ mocessāmi iti karuṇāya
translated: thought: “There is no other refuge for them. I, being free, shall deliver them” .

original: sañcoditamānaso abhinīhāraṃ dīpaṅkarassa bhagavato pādamūle katvā bodhisambhāre samodhānetvā🔽anupubbena sambodhiṃ pattoti karuṇā mahābodhiyā mūlanti. Sattesūti etena mahābodhiyā
analyzed: sañcodita mānasaḥ abhinīhāram dīpaṅkarassa bhagavato pāda mūle katvā bodhi sambhāre samodhānetvā  anupubbena sambodhim patto ti karuṇā mahā bodhiyā mūlanti sattesu iti etena mahā bodhiyā
translated: His mind urged on by compassion, he made his aspiration at the feet of the Blessed One Dīpaṅkara, and after accumulating the requisites for enlightenment,

original: payojanaṃ dasseti. Sattā hi mahābodhiṃ payojenti. Sattasantāraṇatthañhi sabbaññutā
analyzed: payojanam dasseti sattāḥ hi mahā bodhim payojenti satta santāraṇa attham hi sabbaññu tā
translated: he eventually attained enlightenment. So compassion is the root of the Great Being’s aspiration. “For beings” : by this he shows the purpose of the Great Being’s aspiration. For beings are the purpose of the Great Being’s aspiration. For the aspiration for omniscience is undertaken for the purpose of delivering beings,

original: abhipatthitā. Yathāha –
analyzed: abhipatthitā yathā āha
translated: as it is said:🔽“What is the use of my being delivered alone,

original: “Kiṃ me ekena tiṇṇena, purisena thāmadassinā;
analyzed: kim me ekena tiṇṇena purisena thāma dassinā
translated: When I have seen the strength of a man?🔽Having attained omniscience,

original: Sabbaññutaṃ pāpuṇitvā, santāressaṃ sadevaka”nti. ;
analyzed: sabbaññu tam pāpuṇitvā santāressam sa devakam ti
translated: I shall deliver the world with its gods” .

original: Paññāgahaṇena mahābodhiṃ dasseti. Sabbaññutāya hi padaṭṭhānabhūtaṃ maggañāṇaṃ, maggañāṇapadaṭṭhānañca
analyzed: paññā gahaṇena mahā bodhim dasseti sabbaññu tāya hi padaṭṭhāna bhūtam magga ñāṇam magga ñāṇa padaṭṭhānañca
translated: By the word “wisdom” he shows the Great Awakening. For the knowledge of the path, which is the basis for omniscience, and the knowledge of omniscience, which is the basis for the knowledge of the path,

original: sabbaññutaññāṇaṃ “mahābodhī”ti vuccatīti. Ñeyyadhammesu sabbesūti etena santāretabbānaṃ
analyzed: sabbaññuta ññāṇam mahābodhī iti vuccati iti ñeyya dhammesu sabbesu iti etena santāretabbānam
translated: are called the “Great Awakening.” By the words “in all things to be known” he shows all things, which are to be known by direct-knowledge, to be fully understood, to be abandoned, to be developed, and to be realized,

original: sattānaṃ abhiññeyyapariññeyyapahātabbabhāvetabbasacchikātabbe khandhāyatanadhātusaccindriyapaṭiccasamuppādasatipaṭṭhānādibhede🔽kusalādibhede ca sabbadhamme dasseti. Pavattittha yathārucīti etena paṭivedhapaccavekkhaṇapubbaṅgamadesanāñāṇappavattidīpanena🔽payojanasampattiṃ dasseti. Sabbadhammānañhi paṭivedhañāṇaṃ bodhipallaṅke ahosi. Maggañāṇameva
analyzed: sattānam abhiññeyya pariññeyya pahātabba bhāvetabba sacchikātabbe khandha āyatana dhātu sacci indriya paṭiccasamuppāda sati paṭṭhāna ādi bhede  kusala ādi bhede ca sabba dhamme dasseti pavattittha yathāruci iti etena paṭivedha paccavekkhaṇa pubbaṅgama desanā ñāṇa ppavatti dīpanena  payojana sampattim dasseti sabba dhammānam hi paṭivedha ñāṇam bodhi pallaṅke ahosi magga ñāṇam eva
translated: and which are classified as aggregates, sense bases, elements, truths, faculties, dependent origination, foundations of mindfulness, etc., and as wholesome, etc.🔽By the words “in whatever way he wishes” he shows the perfection of purpose by showing the occurrence of the knowledge of teaching, which is preceded by penetration and reviewing.🔽For the knowledge of penetration occurred on the seat of awakening, and the knowledge of the path

original: hi tanti. Paccavekkhaṇañāṇañca visesena ratanagharasattāhe ahosi. Evaṃ paṭividdhapaccavekkhitānaṃ
analyzed: hi paccavekkhaṇa ñāṇam ca visesena rata naghara sattāhe ahosi evam paṭividdha paccavekkhitānam
translated: is itself the thread. And the knowledge of reviewing occurred especially during the seven weeks. Thus he shows the perfection of purpose by showing the occurrence of the knowledge of teaching, which is preceded by penetration and reviewing.

original: dhammānaṃ dhammacakkappavattanādīsu desanāñāṇaṃ ahosi, visesena ca paṇḍukambalasilāyaṃ
analyzed: dhammānam dhamma cakka ppavattana ādīsu desanā ñāṇam ahosi visesena ca paṇḍu kambala silāyam
translated: and in the case of the teaching of the Truths, etc., it was the knowledge of teaching. And in particular it was the teaching of the seven texts on the occasion of the Great Council of Elders at the time of King Dharmāśoka.

original: sattappakaraṇadesanāyanti. Desanāñāṇena ca desento bhagavā sattesu hitapaṭipattiṃ🔽paṭipajjatīti. Etena sabbena attahitapaṭipattiṃ parahitapaṭipattiñca dasseti. Mahābodhidassanena
analyzed: satta pakaraṇa desanāyanti desanā ñāṇena ca desentaḥ bhagavā sattesu hita paṭipattim  paṭipajjati iti etena sabbena atta hita paṭipattim para hita paṭipattim ca dasseti mahā bodhi dassanena
translated: And by the knowledge of teaching the Blessed One, while teaching, makes beings enter on the way to welfare.

original: hi attahitapaṭipatti, itarehipi parahitapaṭipatti dassitāti. Tena attahitapaṭipannādīsu🔽catūsu puggalesu bhagavato catutthapuggalabhāvaṃ dasseti, tena ca anuttaradakkhiṇeyyabhāvaṃ
analyzed: hi atta hita paṭipatti itarehi pi para hita paṭipatti dassitā ati tena atta hita paṭipanna ādīsu  catūsu puggalesu bhagavato catuttha puggala bhāvam dasseti tena ca anuttara dakkhiṇeyya bhāvam
translated: So by all this he shows the Blessed One’s practice of what is beneficial to himself and what is beneficial to others. For by showing the Great Awakening he shows the practice of what is beneficial to himself, and by showing the rest he shows the practice of what is beneficial to others.

original: niratisayapaṇāmārahabhāvañca attano ca kiriyāya khettaṅgatabhāvaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: niratisaya paṇāma āraha bhāvam ca attano ca kiriyāya khettaṅgata bhāvam dasseti
translated: So he shows the Blessed One to be the fourth kind of person among the four kinds beginning with the one who practices what is beneficial to himself. And he shows himself to be a field of merit unsurpassed and worthy of the highest veneration.

original: Ettha ca karuṇāgahaṇena lokiyesu mahaggatabhāvappattāsādhāraṇaguṇadīpanato sabbalokiyaguṇasampatti
analyzed: ettha ca karuṇā gahaṇena lokiyesu mahaggata bhāva ppatta asādhāraṇa guṇa dīpanato sabba lokiya guṇa sampatti
translated: And here the Blessed One’s taking of compassion shows his possession of the special qualities that are not common to the world, since it is the means for the acquisition of the exalted states in the world.

original: bhagavato dassitā hoti, paññāgahaṇenapi sabbaññutaññāṇapadaṭṭhānamaggañāṇadīpanato🔽sabbalokuttaraguṇasampatti. Karuṇāvacanena ca upagamanaṃ nirupakkilesaṃ, paññāvacanena
analyzed: bhagavataḥ dassitā hoti paññā gahaṇena api sabbaññuta ññāṇa padaṭṭhāna magga ñāṇa dīpanato  sabba lokuttara guṇa sampatti karuṇā vacanena ca upagamanam nirupakkilesam paññā vacanena
translated: And by the words “He saw with his compassion” he shows that his approach is free from defilements,🔽and by the words “He saw with his wisdom” he shows that his departure is free from defilements.🔽And in showing his approach he shows that he has arisen and grown in the world,

original: apagamanaṃ dasseti. Upagamanaṃ dassento ca loke sañjātasaṃvaḍḍhabhāvaṃ dasseti, apagamanaṃ
analyzed: apagamanam dasseti upagamanam dassento ca loke sañjāta saṃvaḍḍha bhāvam dasseti apagamanam
translated: and in showing his departure he shows that he is unattached to the world.

original: dassento lokena anupalittataṃ. “Karuṇā viya sattesū”ti ca lokasamaññānurūpaṃ bhagavato🔽pavattiṃ dasseti, “ñeyyadhammesu sabbesu yathāruci paññā pavattitthā”ti etena samaññāya
analyzed: dassentaḥ lokena karuṇā viya sattesu iti ca loka samaññā anurūpam bhagavato  pavattim dasseti ñeyya dhammesu sabbesu yathāruci paññā pavattittha ati etena samaññāya
translated: And by the words “As compassion towards beings” he shows that the Blessed One’s occurrence is in conformity with the world’s designation of him as “the Blessed One,”🔽and by the words “His wisdom occurred in all knowable things” he shows that he does not outrun the world’s designation of him.

original: anatidhāvanaṃ. Sabbadhammasabhāvānavabodhe hi sati samaññaṃ atidhāvitvā “satto jīvo🔽atthī”ti parāmasanaṃ hotīti. Sabbesañca buddhaguṇānaṃ karuṇā ādi tannidānabhāvato,
analyzed: an atidhāvanam sabba dhamma sabhāva an avabodhe hi sati samaññam atidhāvitvā sattaḥ jīvaḥ  atthi iti parāmasanam hoti iti sabbesam ca buddha guṇānam karuṇā ādi tad nidāna bhāvato
translated: For if he had not penetrated the true individual essences of all things, he would have outrun the world’s designation of him and would have been misapprehended as “a being,” “a soul,”🔽“a person.” And all the Enlightened One’s special qualities have compassion as their foundation and wisdom as their culmination,

original: paññā pariyosānaṃ tato uttarikaraṇīyābhāvato. Ādipariyosānadassanena ca sabbe buddhaguṇā
analyzed: paññā pariyosānam tatas uttari karaṇīya abhāvataḥ ādi pariyosāna dassanena ca sabbe buddha guṇā
translated: because they have that as their source and because there is nothing further than that to be done. And by showing the beginning and the culmination he shows that all the Enlightened One’s special qualities are included in the three special qualities of his approach, his departure, and his occurrence.

original: dassitāva honti. Karuṇāgahaṇena ca sīlakkhandhapubbaṅgamo samādhikkhandho dassito
analyzed: dassitā ava honti karuṇā gahaṇena ca sīla kkhandha pubbaṅgamaḥ samādhi kkhandhaḥ dassitaḥ
translated: and the virtue aggregate is shown by the word “compassion.”

original: hoti. Karuṇānidānañhi sīlaṃ tato pāṇātipātādiviratippavattito tassā ca jhānattayasampayogato.🔽Paññāvacanena paññākkhandho. Sīlañca sabbabuddhaguṇānaṃ ādi, samādhi majjhaṃ, paññā
analyzed: hoti karuṇā nidānam hi sīlam tatas pāṇa atipāta ādi virati pavattito tassā ca jhāna ttaya sampayogato  paññā vacanena paññā kkhandho sīlañca sabba buddha guṇānaṃ ādi samādhi majjham paññā
translated: For virtue has compassion as its source, since it occurs in the form of abstention from killing living beings, etc., and it is associated with the three jhānas.

original: pariyosānanti evampi ādimajjhapariyosānakalyāṇā sabbe buddhaguṇā dassitā honti.🔽2. Evaṃ saṅkhepena sabbabuddhaguṇehi bhagavantaṃ thometvā yassā saṃvaṇṇanaṃ kattukāmo,
analyzed: pariyosānam ti evam pi ādi majjha pariyosāna kalyāṇā sabbe buddha guṇā dassitāḥ honti  evam saṅkhepena sabba buddha guṇehi bhagavantam thometvā yassā saṃvaṇṇanam kattu kāmaḥ
translated: The wisdom aggregate is shown by the word “wisdom.” And since virtue is the beginning, concentration the middle, and wisdom the end of all the qualities of the Buddhas, in this way too all the qualities of the Buddhas are shown as being good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end.

original: tāya abhidhammadesanāya aññehi asādhāraṇāya thometuṃ “dayāya tāyā”tiādimāha. Tassā🔽pana desanāya nidānañca samuṭṭhānañca dassetuṃ “dayāya tāyā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Nidānañca
analyzed: tāya abhidhamma desanāya aññehi asādhāraṇāya thometum dayāya tāya ati ādim āha tassā  pana desanāya nidānam ca samuṭṭhānañca dassetum dayāya tāya atiādi vuttam nidānam ca
translated: Having thus extolled the Blessed One in brief by means of all the qualities of the Buddhas, he now says “By that truth may there be well-being,” etc., in order to extol him by means of that teaching of the Abhidhamma, which is not shared by disciples, and by means of which he wishes to extol him.

original: duvidhaṃ abbhantaraṃ bāhirañcāti. Abbhantaraṃ karuṇā, bāhiraṃ desakālādi. Samuṭṭhānaṃ
analyzed: duvidham abbhantaram bāhiram ca ati abbhantaram karuṇā bāhiram desa kāla ādi samuṭṭhānam
translated: But in order to show the source and origin of that teaching, he says “By that truth, etc.” The source is twofold, internal and external. The internal source is compassion, the external source is the country, the time, etc. The origin is twofold, proximate and ultimate. The proximate origin is the knowledge of omniscience, the ultimate origin is the perfection of wisdom.

original: desanāpaññā. Tattha abbhantaranidānaṃ dassento “dayāya tāya sattesu, samussāhitamānaso”ti
analyzed: desanā paññā tattha abbhantara nidānam dassento dayāya tāya sattesu samussāhita mānasaḥ ti
translated: and understanding as teaching. Herein, showing the internal cause, he said: “With that compassion for beings, his mind uplifted” .

original: āha. Tattha dayāti karuṇā adhippetā. Tāya hi samussāhito abhidhammakathāmaggaṃ sampavattayīti.
analyzed: āha tattha dayā iti karuṇā adhippetā tāya hi samussāhitaḥ abhidhamma kathā maggam sampavattayi iti
translated: Herein, “compassion” is intended as “mercy” . For it was by that that he was uplifted and he set out on the path of the Abhidhamma talk.

original: Tāyāti ayaṃ ta-saddo pubbe vuttassa paṭiniddeso hoti.
analyzed: tāya iti ayam ta saddo pubbe vuttassa paṭiniddesaḥ hoti
translated: “With that” : this demonstrative pronoun is a substitute for the word “mercy” in the first line.

original: Purimagāthāya ca padhānabhāvena paññā niddiṭṭhā, tabbisesanabhāvena karuṇā. Sā hi🔽tassā nidassanabhūtā appadhānā taṃ visesetvā vinivattā, tasmā “tāyā”ti paṭiniddesaṃ
analyzed: purima gāthāya ca padhāna bhāvena paññā niddiṭṭhā tad visesana bhāvena karuṇā sā hi  tassāḥ nidassana bhūtā appadhānā tam visesetvā vinivattā tasmā tāya ati paṭiniddesam
translated: And in the first line understanding is demonstrated as the principal factor, while compassion is demonstrated as its distinguishing characteristic. For🔽that is the revealing of it, and it is not the principal factor. It is a distinguishing characteristic that turns back on itself, and therefore it does not

original: nārahati. Yā ca padhānabhūtā paññā, sā desanāya samuṭṭhānaṃ, na samussāhinīti tassā🔽ca paṭiniddeso na yuttoti? Paññāya tāva paṭiniddeso na yuttoti suvuttametaṃ, karuṇāya
analyzed: na arahati yā ca padhāna bhūtā paññā sā desanāya samuṭṭhānam na samussāhinī iti tassā  ca paṭiniddeso na yutto ti paññāya tāva paṭiniddeso na yutto ti su vuttam etam karuṇāya
translated: deserve a substitute in the form of “that” . And the understanding that is the principal factor is the source of the teaching, and it is not the uplifter.🔽Therefore a substitute for it is not appropriate.

original: pana paṭiniddeso no na yutto “dayāya tāyā”ti dvinnaṃ padānaṃ samānādhikaraṇabhāvato.
analyzed: pana paṭiniddesaḥ no na yuttaḥ dayāya tāya ati dvinnam padānam samāna adhikaraṇa bhāvato
translated: And it is rightly said that a substitute for understanding is not appropriate, but a substitute for compassion is not inappropriate, because the two words “mercy” and “with that” have the same reference.

original: Samānādhikaraṇānañhi dvinnaṃ padānaṃ rūpakkhandhādīnaṃ viya visesanavisesitabbabhāvo
analyzed: samāna adhikaraṇānam hi dvinnam padānam rūpa kkhandha ādīnam viya visesana visesitabba bhāvaḥ
translated: For two words with the same case ending are related as that which specifies and that which is specified, like the words “materiality” and “aggregate.”

original: hoti. Rūpa-saddo hi aññakkhandhanivattanatthaṃ vuccamāno visesanaṃ hoti, khandha-saddo
analyzed: hoti rūpa saddaḥ hi añña kkhandha nivattana attham vuccamānaḥ visesanam hoti khandha saddo
translated: For the word “materiality” is that which specifies, since it is used to exclude the other aggregates;

original: ca nivattetabbagahetabbasādhāraṇavacanabhāvato visesitabbo, evamidhāpi “dayāya tāyā”ti
analyzed: ca nivattetabba gahetabba sādhāraṇa vacana bhāvataḥ visesitabbaḥ evam idhā api dayāya tāya ati
translated: and the word “aggregate” is that which is specified, since it is the common term for what is to be excluded and included. So too here, the words “compassion” and “that”

original: dvinnaṃ padānaṃ ekavibhattiyuttānaṃ samānādhikaraṇabhāvato visesanavisesitabbabhāvo
analyzed: dvinnam padānam eka vibhatti yuttānam samāna adhikaraṇa bhāvataḥ visesana visesitabba bhāvaḥ
translated: are related as that which specifies and that which is specified, since they have the same case ending and are in apposition.

original: hoti. Tattha dayā samussāhinīti padhānā, nivattetabbagahetabbasādhāraṇavacanañcidaṃ.🔽Tasmā “dayāyā”ti visesitabbavacanametaṃ, tassa ca yathā visesanaṃ hoti “tāyā”ti idaṃ
analyzed: hoti tattha dayā samussāhinī iti padhānā nivattetabba gahetabba sādhāraṇa vacanam ca idam  tasmā dayāya ati visesitabba vacanam etam tassa ca yathā visesanam hoti tāya ati idam
translated: Herein, the word “compassion” is that which is specified, since it is the common term for what is to be excluded and included.🔽Therefore the word “compassion” is that which is to be specified. And the word “that” is used in order that it may be specified in the way beginning,

original: vacanaṃ, tathā tassa paṭiniddesabhāvo yojetabbo. Na hi paññāpaṭiniddesabhāve dayāvisesanaṃ
analyzed: vacanam tathā tassa paṭiniddesa bhāvaḥ yojetabbaḥ na hi paññā paṭiniddesa bhāve dayā visesanam
translated: “That compassion of his” . For the word “that” is not used to specify “wisdom” or to specify “mercy.”

original: ta-saddo hoti, karuṇāpaṭiniddesabhāve ca hotīti. Padhānañca paññaṃ vajjetvā “dayāyā”ti
analyzed: ta saddaḥ hoti karuṇā paṭiniddesa bhāve ca hoti iti padhānam ca paññam vajjetvā dayāya ati
translated: But it is used to specify “compassion” after excluding “wisdom” and “mercy.”

original: etena sambajjhamāno “tāyā”ti ayaṃ ta-saddo appadhānāya karuṇāya paṭiniddeso bhavitumarahati.🔽Ayamettha attho – yāya dayāya samussāhito, na sā yā kāci, sabbaññutaññāṇassa pana
analyzed: etena sambajjhamānaḥ tāya iti ayam ta saddaḥ appadhānāya karuṇāya paṭiniddesaḥ bhavitum arahati  ayam ettha atthaḥ yāya dayāya samussāhitaḥ na sā yā kāci sabbaññuta ññāṇassa pana
translated: The word “thereby” is a synonym for compassion, which is not the chief thing here.🔽The meaning is this: the compassion by which he is urged is not just any compassion, but rather the great compassion which is the manifestation of

original: nidassanabhūtā mahākaruṇā, tāya samussāhitoti.🔽Kathaṃ pana karuṇā “dayā”ti ñātabbā, nanu vuttaṃ “dayāpanno”ti etassa aṭṭhakathāyaṃ
analyzed: nidassana bhūtā mahā karuṇā tāya samussāhitā iti  katham pana karuṇā dayā ati ñātabbā nanu vuttam dayā āpannaḥ ti etassa aṭṭhakathāyam
translated: the knowledge of the Omniscient One.🔽But how is it to be known that compassion is “mercy”? Has it not been said in the commentary to the above passage that “mercy” means “the state of having loving-kindness”?

original: “mettacittataṃ āpanno”ti, tasmā dayā mettāti yujjeyya, na karuṇāti? Yadi evaṃ “adayāpanno”ti🔽etassa aṭṭhakathāyaṃ “nikkaruṇataṃ āpanno”ti vuttanti dayā mettāti ca na yujjeyya,
analyzed: āpannoti tasmai dayā na karuṇāti yadi evam adayā āpannoti  etassa aṭṭhakathā ayam nikkaruṇa tam āpannaḥ ti vuttanti dayā mettā ati ca na yujjeyya
translated: Therefore it would be more appropriate to say that mercy is loving-kindness, not compassion.🔽If that is so, then it would be more appropriate to say that “lack of mercy” means “the state of having no loving-kindness,” since the commentary to the passage “lack of mercy” says that it means “the state of having no compassion.”

original: tasmā dayā-saddo yattha yattha pavattati, tattha tattha adhippāyavasena yojetabbo.
analyzed: tasmā dayā saddaḥ yattha yattha pavattati tattha tattha adhippāya vasena yojetabbo
translated: Therefore, wherever the word “mercy” occurs, it should be interpreted according to the context.

original: Dayā-saddo hi anurakkhaṇatthaṃ antonītaṃ katvā pavattamāno mettāya ca karuṇāya ca
analyzed: dayā saddaḥ hi anurakkhaṇa attham antonītam katvā pavattamānaḥ mettāya ca karuṇāya ca
translated: For the word “mercy” occurs when it is drawn in by the meaning of “protection” and then it is loving-kindness;

original: pavattatīti no na yujjati. Evañhi aṭṭhakathānaṃ avirodho hotīti. Karuṇā ca desanāya🔽nidānabhāvena vuttā, na mettā “accantameva hi taṃ samayaṃ bhagavā karuṇāvihārena
analyzed: pavattati iti no na yujjati evam hi aṭṭhakathānam avirodhaḥ hoti iti karuṇā ca desanāya  nidāna bhāvena vuttā na mettā accantam eva hi tam samayam bhagavā karuṇā vihārena
translated: and it is not proper to say that it does not occur. For in this way there is no contradiction with the commentaries.

original: vihāsī”ti evamādīsu, tasmā idha karuṇāva dayāvacanena gahitāti veditabbā. Sā hi samussāhinī,
analyzed: vihāsi iti evamādīsu tasmai dayā vacanena gahitā iti veditabbā sā hi samussāhinī
translated: And it is compassion that is mentioned as the reason for the teaching, not loving-kindness, since it is said, “At that time the Blessed One was dwelling in a dwelling of compassion” , and so on. So it should be understood that here it is compassion that is referred to by the word “pity” . For that is the one that is “incited”

original: na mettā, mettā pana paññāgatikapavattinī hotīti.
analyzed: na mettā mettā pana paññāgatika pavattinī hoti iti
translated: , not loving-kindness, which is “the way to the penetration of wisdom” .

original: “Sattesū”ti kasmā evaṃ vuttaṃ, nanu “tāyā”ti etena vacanena sattavisayā karuṇā gahitāti?🔽No na gahitā, purimagāthāya pana “sattesu karuṇā yathāruci pavattitthā”ti sappadesasattavisayā🔽nippadesasattavisayā ca sabbā vuttā, idha pana nippadesasattavisayataṃ gahetuṃ “sattesū”ti
analyzed: sattesu iti kasmai evam vuttam nanu tāya ati etena vacanena satta visayā karuṇā gahitā iti  no na gahitā purima gāthāya pana sattesu karuṇā yathāruci sappadesa satta visayā  nippadesa satta visayā ca sabbā vuttā idha pana nippadesa satta visaya tam gahetum sattesu iti
translated: Why is it said “among beings” ? Is not compassion that has beings for its object included by the words “with that” ?🔽It is not that it is not included, but in the first stanza all compassion that occurs among beings according to inclination, whether it has a particular being for its object or not, is mentioned, saying “compassion among beings.”🔽But here it is shown as having beings in general for its object in order to include compassion that has beings in general for its object, with the words “among beings.”

original: nippadesasattavisayabhūtā dassitā. Tena sabbasattavisayāya karuṇāya samussāhito abhidhammakathāmaggaṃ
analyzed: nippadesa satta visaya bhūtā dassitā tena sabba satta visayāya karuṇāya samussāhitaḥ abhidhamma kathā maggam
translated: So the teaching of the Abhidhamma is “incited” by compassion that has all beings for its object.

original: devānaṃ sampavattayi, na devavisayāya eva, tasmā sabbasattahitatthaṃ abhidhammakathāmaggaṃ
analyzed: devānam na deva visayāya eva tasmā sabba satta hita ttham abhidhamma kathā maggam
translated: and he expounded it for the purpose of the welfare of all beings, not for the purpose of a mere limited number of beings.

original: devānaṃ sampavattayi, na devānaṃyeva atthāyāti ayamattho dassitova hoti. Atha vā
analyzed: devānam na atthāya ati ayam atthaḥ dassitaḥ uva hoti atha vā
translated: He did not expound the path of the Abhidhamma for the sake of the gods alone. Therefore the meaning indicated is this: “He expounded the path of the Abhidhamma for the welfare of all beings, not for the sake of the gods alone.” Or else,

original: “sattesū”ti idaṃ na dayāya ālambananidassanaṃ, samussāhanavisayo pana etena dassito.🔽Abhidhammakathāmaggappavattanatthañhi bhagavā karuṇāya na devesuyeva samussāhito,
analyzed: sattesu iti idam na dayāya ālambana nidassanam samussāhana visayaḥ pana etena dassito  abhidhamma kathā magga ppavattana attham hi bhagavā karuṇāya na devesu yā iva samussāhitaḥ
translated: the words “among beings” do not indicate the object of his compassion, but rather the sphere of his exhortation.

original: sabbabodhaneyyesu pana sattesu samussāhito sabbesaṃ atthāya pavattattā, tasmā sattesu
analyzed: sabba bodhaneyyesu pana sattesu samussāhitaḥ sabbesam atthāya pavatta ttā tasmā sattesu
translated: For the Exalted One was exhorted by compassion not only among the gods but among all beings who are to be enlightened. He was exhorted among all beings for the welfare of all. Therefore,

original: samussāhitamānasoti sattesu visayabhūtesu nimittabhūtesu vā samussāhitamānaso uyyojitacittoti attho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: samussāhita mānasaḥ ti sattesu visaya bhūtesu nimitta bhūtesu vā samussāhita mānasaḥ uyyojita cittaḥ ti atthaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: “among beings” means that his mind was exhorted among beings who are the sphere of his compassion, or among beings who are the object of his compassion. The meaning should be understood thus: his mind was urged.

original: Evaṃ abbhantaranidānaṃ dassetvā bāhiranidānaṃ dassento “pāṭihīrāvasānamhī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: evam abbhantara nidānam dassetvā bāhira nidānam dassentaḥ āha
translated: Having thus shown the internal cause, he shows the external cause with the words “at the conclusion of the miracle of twin-miracle.”

original: Tattha yasmiṃ kāle bhagavatā abhidhammakathāmaggo pavattito, taṃ dassetuṃ “pāṭihīrāvasānamhi🔽vasanto”ti vuttaṃ. “Avasānamhi vasanto tidasālaye”ti vacanato yassāvasānamhi tidasālaye🔽vasi, taṃ kaṇḍambamūle kataṃ yamakapāṭihāriyaṃ idha “pāṭihīra”nti vuttaṃ, na bodhimūlādīsu
analyzed: tattha yasmin kāle bhagavatā abhidhamma kathā maggaḥ pavattitaḥ tam dassetum pāṭihīra avasānamhi  vasantoti vuttam avasānamhi vasanto tidasālaye iti vacanato yassa avasānamhi tidasālaye  tam kaṇḍamba mūle katam yamaka pāṭihāriyam idha vuttam na bodhi mūla ādīsu
translated: Herein, in order to show the time when the Blessed One set out on the way to the Abhidhamma, it is said, “At the end of the miracle.”🔽Since it is said, “at the end of the miracle in the Tavatimsa heaven,” it is the miracle performed at the foot of the Kaṇḍamba tree that is referred to here by the word “miracle,” not the miracle performed at the foot of the Bodhi tree or elsewhere,

original: kataṃ pāṭihāriyaṃ, nāpi ādesanānusāsaniyoti viññāyati, pākaṭattā ca āsannattā ca
analyzed: katam pāṭihāriyam na api ādesanā anusāsaniyā ti viññāyati pākaṭa ttā ca āsanna ttā ca
translated: nor the teaching of the Abhidhamma or the exhortation. It should be understood that the miracle at the foot of the Kaṇḍamba tree is referred to because it was the most recent and most obvious.

original: tadeva gahitanti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Pāṭihāriyapadassa vacanatthaṃ “paṭipakkhaharaṇato rāgādikilesāpanayanato
analyzed: tat eva gahitanti daṭṭhabbam pāṭihāriya padassa vacana attham paṭipakkha haraṇataḥ rāga ādi kilesa apanayanataḥ
translated: As for the meaning of the word “miracle,” they say that it is a miracle because it “removes opposition” , because it “removes the defilements” such as lust,

original: pāṭihāriya”nti vadanti, bhagavato pana paṭipakkhā rāgādayo na santi ye haritabbā.
analyzed: pāṭihāriyanti vadanti bhagavataḥ pana paṭipakkhāḥ rāga ādayaḥ na santi ye haritabbā
translated: but the Blessed One has no opposition in the form of lust, etc., to be removed.

original: Puthujjanānampi hi vigatupakkilese aṭṭhaṅgaguṇasamannāgate citte hatapaṭipakkhe iddhividhaṃ
analyzed: puthujjanānam pi hi vigata upakkilese aṭṭhaṅga guṇa samannāgate citte hata paṭipakkhe iddhi vidham
translated: For even in the minds of ordinary people, which are far removed from the eight-factored enlightenment and are not devoid of defilements, there is psychic power that has removed opposition.

original: pavattati, tasmā tattha pavattavohārena ca na sakkā idha “pāṭihāriya”nti vattuṃ.
analyzed: pavattati tasmā tattha pavatta vohārena ca na sakkā idha vattum
translated: and therefore it cannot be called a miracle in the sense of a wonder here.

original: Sace pana mahākāruṇikassa bhagavato veneyyagatā ca kilesā paṭipakkhā, tesaṃ haraṇato🔽“pāṭihāriya”nti vuttaṃ, evaṃ sati yuttametaṃ. Atha vā bhagavato ca sāsanassa ca paṭipakkhā🔽titthiyā, tesaṃ haraṇato pāṭihāriyaṃ. Te hi diṭṭhiharaṇavasena diṭṭhippakāsane asamatthabhāvena
analyzed: sace pana mahā kāruṇikassa bhagavataḥ veneyya gatā ca kilesā paṭipakkhā tesam haraṇato  pāṭihāriyanti vuttam evam sati yuttam etam atha vā bhagavataḥ ca sāsanassa ca paṭipakkhā  titthiyā tesam haraṇato pāṭihāriyam te hi diṭṭhi haraṇa vasena diṭṭhi ppakāsane asamattha bhāvena
translated: But if it is said that the Blessed One’s defilements and his disciples’ defilements are the opponents,🔽and that the miracle is the removal of those, then that is appropriate. Or else the opponents are the sectarians who are opposed to the Blessed One and his dispensation,

original: ca iddhiādesanānusāsanīhi haritā apanītā hontīti. Atha vā paṭīti ayaṃ saddo “pacchā”ti
analyzed: ca iddhi ādesana anusāsanīhi haritāḥ apanītāḥ honti iti atha vā ayam saddo pacchā ti
translated: and the miracle is the removal of them. For they are removed, they are got rid of, by the demonstration of the miracle of the Dhamma, which removes their false views, and by the miracles of the supernormal power, etc., which get rid of them by making them incapable of demonstrating any miracles.

original: etassa atthaṃ bodheti “tasmiṃ paṭipaviṭṭhamhi, añño āgañchi brāhmaṇo”tiādīsu viya,
analyzed: etassa attham bodheti tasmin paṭipaviṭṭhamhi aññaḥ āgañchi brāhmaṇa uti ādīsu viya
translated: Or else the word pāṭihāriya informs one of the meaning of the word pacchā , like the words “tasmiṃ paṭipaviṭṭhamhi, añño āgañchi brāhmaṇo” .

original: tasmā samāhite citte vigatupakkilese ca katakiccena pacchā haritabbaṃ pavattetabbanti
analyzed: tasmā samāhite citte vigata upakkilese ca kata kiccena pacchā haritabbam pavattetabbam ti
translated: So it is a miracle in the sense of something to be removed later , after the mind has become concentrated and the defilements have been dispersed, and the task has been done. Or it is a miracle in the sense of removal later ,

original: paṭihāriyaṃ, attano vā upakkilesesu catutthajjhānamaggehi haritesu pacchā haraṇaṃ
analyzed: paṭihāriyam attanaḥ vā upakkilesesu catuttha jhāna maggehi haritesu pacchā haraṇam
translated: after the defilements in oneself have been removed by the path of the fourth jhāna.

original: paṭihāriyaṃ, iddhiādesanānusāsaniyo ca vigatupakkilesena katakiccena ca sattahitatthaṃ
analyzed: paṭihāriyam iddhi ādesanā anusāsaniyo ca vigata upakkilesena kata kiccena ca satta hitattham
translated: the miracle, the teaching of psychic power, and the instruction, with the defilements gone, the task done, for the benefit of beings.

original: puna pavattetabbā, haritesu ca attano upakkilesesu parasattānaṃ upakkilesaharaṇāni🔽hontīti paṭihāriyāni bhavanti, paṭihāriyameva pāṭihāriyaṃ. Paṭihāriye vā iddhiādesanānusāsanisamudāye
analyzed: puna pavattetabbā haritesu ca attanaḥ upakkilesesu para sattānam upakkilesa haraṇāni  honti iti paṭihāriyāni bhavanti paṭihāriyam eva pāṭihāriyam paṭihāriye vā iddhi ādesanā anusāsani samudāye
translated: and the miracle, the demonstration of supernormal power, the teaching, and the exhortation, are to be repeated for the benefit of the seven kinds of persons, namely, those whose defilements have been removed, those who have done what had to be done, and those who are seeking the benefit of others.🔽And in the case of the green-gold ones, the removal of the defilements of others is a removal of their own defilements,🔽so they are called “miracles” . Or alternatively, the miracle is the demonstration of supernormal power, the teaching, and the exhortation,

original: bhavaṃ ekekaṃ pāṭihāriyanti vuccati. Paṭihāriyaṃ vā catutthajjhānaṃ maggo ca paṭipakkhaharaṇato,
analyzed: bhavam ekekam pāṭihāriyanti vuccati paṭihāriyam vā catuttha jhānam maggo ca paṭipakkha haraṇato
translated: and the miracle is the fourth jhāna and the path, since they remove opposition.

original: tattha jātaṃ, tasmiṃ vā nimittabhūte, tato vā āgatanti pāṭihāriyaṃ. Pāṭihāriyameva
analyzed: tattha jātam tasmin vā nimitta bhūte tatas vā pāṭihāriyam pāṭihāriyam eva
translated: It is born there, or it is the sign there, or it comes from there, thus it is a miracle .🔽The word “miracle” is used here in the sense of “miraculous power” .

original: idha “pāṭihīra”nti vuttaṃ. Avasānamhi vasantoti etehi kālaṃ nidasseti. Pāṭihīrakaraṇāvasānena
analyzed: idha pāṭihīranti vuttam avasānamhi vasanto ti etehi kālam nidasseti pāṭihīra karaṇa avasānena
translated: Dwelling in the end: he indicates the time by these words.

original: hi tidasālayavāsena ca paricchinno abhidhammakathāmaggappavattanassa kāloti. Tidasālayeti
analyzed: hi tidasa ālaya vāsena ca paricchinnaḥ abhidhamma kathā magga ppavattanassa kālaḥ ti dasa ālaya iti
translated: For the time for the setting in motion of the Thread-versed discourse is delimited by the end of the miracle and by the dwelling in the Three-thousandfold World.🔽In the Three-thousandfold World:

original: desaṃ nidasseti. So hi abhidhammakathāmaggappavattanassa deso tattha vasantena pavattitattāti.
analyzed: desam nidasseti saḥ hi abhidhamma kathā magga ppavattanassa desaḥ tattha vasantena pavattita ttā ti
translated: He indicates the place, for that is the place where the discussion of the Abhidhamma takes place, since it takes place there by one who resides there.

original: 3. Tatthāpi desavisesadassanatthaṃ “pāricchattakamūlamhī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Yugandhareti
analyzed: tattha api desa visesa dassana attham pāricchattaka mūlamhi itiādi vuttam yugandhara iti
translated: And here too, “at the root of the Pāricchattaka tree” is said in order to indicate a particular place. On Yugandhara:

original: sītapabbatesveko dvecattālīsayojanasahassubbedho, ādicco ca tadubbedhamaggacārī,
analyzed: sītapabbatesu ekaḥ dvecattālīsa yojana sahassa ubbedhaḥ ādiccaḥ ca tad ubbedha magga cārī
translated: on the Cool Mountain. The sun moves along at a height of two and a half leagues above the heads of the people on that mountain, which is forty-two thousand leagues high.

original: so sati sambhave yathā yugandhare sobheyya, evaṃ sobhamāno nisinnoti attho.
analyzed: saḥ sati sambhave yathā yugandhare sobheyya evam sobhamānaḥ nisinnaḥ iti attho
translated: The meaning is: he sits shining as he would if he were shining on Yugandhara if it were possible for him to do so.

original: 4-5. Idāni puggale dhammapaṭiggāhake apadisanto “cakkavāḷasahassehī”tiādimāha. Sabbasoti
analyzed: idāni puggale dhamma paṭiggāhake a padisantaḥ cakkavāḷa sahassehi itiādim āha sabbaso ti
translated: Now, in order to indicate the person who is the recipient of the Dhamma, he says “from a thousand world-spheres” . All:

original: samantato āgamma sabbehi disābhāgehi, sannivesavasena vā samantato sanniviṭṭhehi
analyzed: samantataḥ āgamma sabbehi disā bhāgehi sannivesa vasena vā samantataḥ sanniviṭṭhehi
translated: all the directions, coming from all around; or all those who are situated all around by way of their location.

original: dasahi cakkavāḷasahassehīti adhippāyo, na sabbaso cakkavāḷasahassehi dasahi dasahīti.
analyzed: dasahi cakkavāḷa sahassehi iti adhippāyaḥ na sabbaso cakkavāḷa sahassehi dasahi dasahi iti
translated: The meaning intended is: from ten thousand world-spheres. It is not the meaning that there are ten times ten thousand world-spheres.

original: Evaṃ sati cattālīsacakkavāḷasahassehi adhikehi vā āgamanaṃ vuttaṃ siyā, na cetaṃ
analyzed: evam sati cattālīsa cakkavāḷa sahassehi adhikehi vā āgamanam vuttam siyā na ca itam
translated: If that were the meaning, then it would have to be said that they came from more than forty thousand world-spheres. But that is not the meaning.

original: adhippetanti. Samantato sannisinnenāti vā yojetabbaṃ. Samaṃ, sammā vā nisinnena sannisinnena,
analyzed: adhippetam ti samantataḥ sannisinnena ati vā yojetabbam samam sammā vā nisinnena sannisinnena
translated: “Seated all around” should be construed with “in a circle.”

original: aññamaññaṃ abyābādhetvā bhagavati gāravaṃ katvā sotaṃ odahitvā nisajjadose vajjitabbe
analyzed: aññam aññam a byābādhetvā bhagavati gāravam katvā sotam odahitvā nisajja dose vajjitabbe
translated: “Seated in a circle” means seated in a circle, seated in a proper and correct manner, without oppressing each other, having directed their ears to the Blessed One, having removed the faults of sitting,🔽having removed the faults of sitting.

original: vajjetvā nisinnenāti attho. Mātaraṃ pamukhaṃ katvā sannisinnena devānaṃ gaṇena parivāritoti
analyzed: vajjetvā nisinnena ati attho mātaram pamukham katvā san nisinnena devānam gaṇena parivārito ti
translated: “Having made the mother of the gods foremost” means having made the mother of the gods foremost, seated in a circle, surrounded by a multitude of gods,

original: vā, mātaraṃ pamukhaṃ katvā abhidhammakathāmaggaṃ sampavattayīti vā yojanā kātabbā.
analyzed: vā mātaram pamukham katvā abhidhamma kathā maggam vā yojanā kātabbā
translated: or having made the mother of the gods foremost, having set out on the path of the discussion of the Abhidhamma.

original: Idāni desanāya samuṭṭhānaṃ dassento “tassā paññāya tejasā”ti āha. Yā sā ādimhi karuṇāya
analyzed: idāni desanāya samuṭṭhānam dassento tassā paññāya tejasā ti āha yā sā ādimhi karuṇāya
translated: Now, showing the origin of the teaching, he said, “By the splendor of that wisdom.” That wisdom which was compared to compassion at the beginning,

original: upamitā sabbañeyyadhammānaṃ yathāsabhāvajānanasamatthā, tesaṃ desetabbappakārajānanasamatthā,
analyzed: upamitā sabba ñeyya dhammānam yathā sabhāva jānana samatthā tesam desetabba ppakāra jānana samatthā
translated: which is able to know the specific natures of all knowable things, which is able to know the manner in which they should be taught,

original: bodhetabbapuggalānaṃ āsayādhimuttiyādivibhāvanasamatthā ca paññā, tassā ca yathāvuttabalayogatoti
analyzed: bodhetabba puggalānam āsaya adhimuttiyā ādi vibhāvana samatthā ca paññā tassā ca yathā vutta bala yogato ti
translated: and which is able to discern the inclinations, dispositions, etc., of the persons to be enlightened, and by the power of that wisdom as described above,

original: attho. Tena sabbaññutaññāṇameva abhidhammakathāya samuṭṭhānabhāve samatthaṃ, nāññanti
analyzed: atthaḥ tena sabbaññu ta ññāṇam eva abhidhammakathāya samuṭṭhāna bhāve samattham
translated: The meaning is this: only the knowledge of omniscience is able to be the source of the Abhidhamma talk, not any other.🔽By this he shows the uncommonness of the Abhidhamma talk. The “path” is the means.

original: imamatthaṃ dīpento abhidhammakathāya asādhāraṇabhāvaṃ dasseti. Maggoti upāyo. Khandhāyatanādīnaṃ
analyzed: imam attham dīpentaḥ abhidhamma kathāya asādhāraṇa bhāvam dasseti maggo ti upāyaḥ khandha āyatana ādīnam
translated: Because of the fact that it is the means for the understanding of the aggregates, bases, etc.,

original: kusalādīnañca dhammānaṃ avabodhassa, saccappaṭivedhasseva vā upāyabhāvato “abhidhammakathāmaggo”ti
analyzed: kusala ādīnam ca dhammānam avabodhassa sacca paṭivedhassa iva vā upāya bhāvataḥ abhidhamma kathā maggo ti
translated: and of the profitable, etc., states, or for the penetration of the truths, the Abhidhamma talk is called “the path.”

original: vutto. Pabandho vā “maggo”ti vuccati. So hi dīghattā maggo viyāti maggo, tasmā abhidhammakathāpabandho
analyzed: vuttaḥ pabandhaḥ vā maggo ti vuccati so hi dīgha ttā maggaḥ viyā ati maggo tasmai abhidhamma kathā pabandho
translated: Or the “path” is called “pabandho,” a series, because it is long like a path. Therefore the Abhidhamma talk is called “the path”🔽because it is a series of the Abhidhamma talk.

original: “abhidhammakathāmaggo”ti vutto. Devānaṃ gaṇena parivāritoti vatvā puna devānanti
analyzed: abhidhamma kathā maggaḥ ti vuttaḥ devānam gaṇena parivāritaḥ iti vatvā puna devānam ti
translated: After saying “surrounded by a multitude of gods,” he again says “gods”

original: vacanaṃ tesaṃ gahaṇasamatthataṃ dīpeti. Na hi asamatthānaṃ bhagavā desetīti.
analyzed: vacanam tesam gahaṇa samattha tam dīpeti na hi asamatthānam bhagavā deseti iti
translated: in order to show that they were able to receive the teaching. For the Exalted One does not teach those who are unable to receive the teaching.

original: 6. Evaṃ karuṇāpaññāmukhehi guṇehi bhagavato abhidhammakathāmaggappavattanena ca hitappaṭipattiyā
analyzed: evam karuṇā paññā mukhehi guṇehi bhagavataḥ abhidhamma kathā magga ppavattanena ca hita ppaṭipattiyā
translated: Thus, by the qualities of the doors of compassion and wisdom, and by the Exalted One’s setting in motion the path of the Abhidhamma talk, he shows the practice of benefit.

original: paramapaṇāmārahataṃ dassetvā idāni adhippetaṃ paṇāmaṃ karonto āha “tassa pāde namassitvā”ti.
analyzed: dassetvā idāni adhippetam paṇāmam karontaḥ āha tassa pāde namassitvā iti
translated: Having shown the worthiness of the highest homage, he now, in paying homage as intended, said, “Having paid homage at his feet.”

original: Bhagavato thomaneneva ca dhammassa svākkhātatā saṅghassa ca suppaṭipannatā dassitā
analyzed: bhagavato thomanena iva ca dhammassa su ākkhāta tā saṅghassa ca suppaṭipanna tā dassitā
translated: And by the praise of the Blessed One the well-proclaimedness of the Dhamma and the well-practisedness of the Sangha are shown too,

original: hoti tappabhavassa anaññathābhāvato, tasmā paṇāmārahaṃ tañca ratanadvayaṃ paṇamanto🔽“saddhammañcassa…pe… cañjali”nti āha. Tattha yasmā buddho “sadevake loke tathāgato🔽vandanīyo”ti, saṅgho ca “suppaṭipanno…pe… añjalikaraṇīyo”ti vutto, tasmā “tassa pāde
analyzed: hoti tad pabhavassa an aññathābhāvato tasmā paṇāma araham tat ca ratana dvayam  āha tattha yasmai buddhaḥ sa devake loke tathāgataḥ  vandanīyaḥ iti saṅghaḥ ca su paṭipanna upe añjali karaṇīyaḥ iti vutto tasmā tassa pāde
translated: for the state of being a Blessed One is not otherwise. Therefore, paying homage to that pair of Treasures worthy of homage,🔽he said, “Having paid homage to the True Idea” and so on. Herein, since the Enlightened One is “the One who is to be worshipped in the world with its deities” and the Sangha is “the One who is to be worshipped with hands raised in reverential salutation” ,

original: namassitvā, katvā saṅghassa cañjali”nti vuttaṃ. Dhammo pana svākkhātatādiguṇayutto
analyzed: namassitvā katvā saṅghassa cañjalin ti vuttam dhammaḥ pana sva akkhāta tā ādi guṇa yuttaḥ
translated: therefore it is said “Having paid homage at his feet and having raised hands in reverential salutation to the Sangha.” But the True Idea, which possesses the special qualities of being well proclaimed, etc.,

original: tathānussaraṇena pūjetabbo hoti “tameva dhammaṃ sakkatvā garuṃkatvā upanissāya vihareyya”nti
analyzed: tathā anussaraṇena pūjetabbaḥ hoti tam eva dhammam sakkatvā garuṃkatvā upanissāya vihareyyanti
translated: is to be worshipped by recollecting it thus “One should live in dependence on that True Idea, honouring it, raising it up, regarding it as a master, regarding it as a treasure, regarding it as an island, regarding it as an asylum, regarding it as one’s kinsmen, regarding it as a refuge” .

original: vacanato, kāyavācācittehi sabbathā pūjetabbo, tasmā “saddhammañcassa pūjetvā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vacanataḥ kāya vācā cittehi sabbathā pūjetabbaḥ tasmā saddhammam ca ssa pūjetvā iti vuttam
translated: It is to be worshipped in every way by body, speech, and thought. Therefore it is said “Having worshipped the True Idea.”

original: Sirīmatoti ettha sirīti paññāpuññānaṃ adhivacananti vadanti. Atha vā puññanibbattā
analyzed: sirīmato ti ettha sirī iti paññā puññānam adhivacanan ti vadanti atha vā puñña nibbattā
translated: “Glorious” : here “glory” is a term for wisdom and merit, they say. Or else it is the glory that is the result of merit.

original: sarīrasobhaggādisampatti katapuññe nissayati, katapuññehi vā nissīyatīti “sirī”ti
analyzed: sarīra sobhagga ādi sampatti kata puññe nissayati kata puññehi vā nissīyati iti
translated: “Glorious” : here “glory” is a term for wisdom and merit. Or alternatively, the excellence of beauty, etc., of the physical frame is generated by merit; it is dependent on merit, or it is dependent on one who has merit, thus it is “glory” .

original: vuccati, sā ca atisayavatī bhagavato atthīti sirīmā, bhagavā, tassa sirīmato.
analyzed: vuccati sā ca atisayavatī bhagavataḥ atthi iti sirīmā bhagavā tassa sirīmataḥ
translated: And that glory is in excess in the Blessed One, thus he is “glorious” .

original: 7. Nipaccakārassāti paṇāmakiriyāya. Ānubhāvenāti balena. Sosetvāti sukkhāpetvā antaradhāpetvā
analyzed: nipaccakārassa ati paṇāma kiriyāya ānubhāvena ati balena sosetvā ati sukkhāpetvā antaradhāpetvā
translated: “With a humble attitude” : with an attitude of bowing down. “By his power” : by his strength. “Having dried up” : having dried up and caused to disappear.

original: atthaṃ pakāsayissāmīti sambandho. Antarāyeti atthappakāsanassa upaghātake. Asesatoti nissese sakale.🔽8. Idāni abhidhammassa gambhīratthattā atthappakāsanassa dukkarabhāvaṃ dīpetuṃ “visuddhācārasīlenā”tiādinā
analyzed: attham pakāsayissāmi iti sambandhaḥ antarāye iti attha ppakāsanassa upaghātake asesato ti nissese sakale  idāni abhidhammassa gambhīra attha ttā attha ppakāsanassa dukkara bhāvam dīpetum visuddha ācāra sīlena ati ādinā
translated: The construction is: “I shall expound the meaning.” “In the interval” : in the interval of the expounding of the meaning. “Without remainder” : without exception, in its entirety.🔽Now, in order to point out the request in order to show the difficulty of expounding the meaning because of the profound meaning of the Abhidhamma, he says “With pure virtue and conduct” , etc.

original: abhiyācanaṃ dasseti. Thullaccayādivisuddhiyā visuddhācāro, pārājikasaṅghādisesavisuddhiyā
analyzed: abhiyācanam dasseti thullaccaya ādi visuddhiyā visuddha ācāraḥ pārājika saṅgha ādi sesa visuddhiyā
translated: One who is pure in virtue is pure in the minor and major offenses. One who is pure in conduct is pure in the offenses entailing expulsion and in the serious offenses.

original: visuddhasīlo. Cārittavārittavisuddhiyā vā visuddhācārasīlo, tena. Sakkaccanti cittiṃ
analyzed: visuddha sīlo vā visuddha ācāra sīlo tena cittim
translated: “Attentively”: having made his mind ready.

original: katvā. Abhiyācitoti abhimukhaṃ yācito. Tena anādariyaṃ atthappakāsane kātuṃ asakkuṇeyyaṃ dasseti.
analyzed: katvā abhiyācito ti abhimukham yācito tena anādariyam attha pakāsane kātum a sakkuṇeyyam dasseti
translated: “Requested”: requested face to face. By this he shows that he is incapable of teaching the meaning without respect.

original: 9. Idāni yassa atthaṃ pakāsetukāmo, taṃ dassetuṃ “yaṃ devadevo”tiādimāha. Tattha🔽yanti abhidhammaṃ. Devadevoti visuddhisammutiupapattidevānaṃ devo. Loke hi ye “saraṇaṃ
analyzed: idāni yassa attham pakāsetu kāmo tam dassetum yam devadeva iti ādim āha tattha  yanti abhidhammam devadevaḥ iti visuddhi sammuti upapatti devānam devaḥ loke hi ye saraṇam
translated: Now, in order to show the one for whose sake he wishes to teach the meaning, he says, “What the God of gods.” Herein🔽“What”: the Abhidhamma.

original: parāyaṇa”nti gantabbā gatibhūtā, te “devā”ti vuccanti, bhagavā ca sabbadevānaṃ gatibhūtoti.
analyzed: parāyaṇanti gantabbāḥ gati bhūtā te devā ati vuccanti bhagavā ca sabba devānam gati bhūto ti
translated: “God of gods”: a god of the gods of purification, of the gods of tradition, and of the gods of rebirth. For in the world those who are the refuge and the ultimate resort are called “gods.” And the Exalted One is the ultimate resort of all gods.🔽“In brief”: in brief.

original: Nayatoti saṅkhepato. Samācikkhīti sammā ācikkhi yathā thero bujjhati. Veneyyasatte
analyzed: nayataḥ ti saṅkhepataḥ samācikkhi iti sammā ācikkhi yathā theraḥ bujjhati veneyya satte
translated: “Taught”: he taught in such a way that the Elder could understand.

original: vinetīti vināyako, nāyakavirahito vā, sayambhūti attho.🔽10-12. Yañcāti yañca abhidhammaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ payirudāhāsīti sambandho. Payirudāhāsīti
analyzed: vinā iti iti vināyakaḥ nāyaka virahitaḥ vā attho 🔽yañca ati yañca abhidhammam bhikkhūnam payirudāhāsi iti sambandho payirudāhāsi iti
translated: “The trainer of trainees”: a trainer because he trains trainees, or because he is without a trainer, i.e., self-taught.

original: kathesi. Itīti iminā anukkamena. “Yo dhārito”ti yanti upayogavasena vutto yaṃ-saddo🔽dhāritoti paccattena sambajjhamāno paccattavasena pariṇamati, tasmā yo dhārito, yo
analyzed: kathesi iti iti iminā anukkamena yaḥ dhāritaḥ ti yan ti upayoga vasena vuttaḥ yaṃsaddaḥ  dhāritaḥ iti paccattena sambajjhamānaḥ paccatta vasena pariṇamati tasmai yaḥ dhāritaḥ yaḥ
translated: He spoke. It is by this sequence. “What was recited” is the word yaṃ which is used in the sense of utilization.

original: ca saṅgīto, tassa atthaṃ pakāsayissāmīti yojanā kātabbā. Vedena paññāya īhati pavattatīti
analyzed: ca saṅgītaḥ tassa attham pakāsayissāmi iti yojanā kātabbā vedena paññāya īhati pavattati iti
translated: Recited is the word dhārita which, when combined with the word paccatta, is transformed into the sense of individual. Therefore the construction should be made thus: “I will make known the meaning of what was recited, what was recited by the individual, what was recited by the community.”🔽The Muni is one who moves with knowledge and understanding.

original: vedeho, tena muninā. Abhiṇhasoti bahuso. Abhidhammassāti etaṃ “atthaṃ pakāsayissāmī”ti
analyzed: vedehaḥ tena muninā bahusaḥ abhidhammassa ati etam attham pakāsayissāmi iti
translated: Abhiṇha is many times. Abhidhamma is to be connected with the words “I will make known this meaning.”

original: etena yojetabbaṃ. Idāni yo atthappakāsanassa nissayo, taṃ dassetuṃ “ādito”tiādimāha.
analyzed: etena yojetabbam idāni yaḥ attha ppakāsanassa nissayaḥ tam dassetum āditas ti ādim āha
translated: Now, in order to show the basis for the making known of the meaning, he says “at the beginning,” etc.

original: Tattha āditoti ādimhi paṭhamasaṅgītiyaṃ.
analyzed: tattha āditas ti ādimhi paṭhama saṅgītiyam
translated: Herein, at the beginning means at the beginning, at the first recitation.

original: 13. Yā aṭṭhakathā saṅgītā, kassa pana sā aṭṭhakathāti? Aññassa vuttassa abhāvā “yassa
analyzed: yā aṭṭhakathā saṅgītā kassa pana sā aṭṭhakathā ati aññassa vuttassa abhāvā yassa
translated: The commentary that was recited, but whose commentary was recited? Since there is no mention of anyone else, it is said “what was recited by the individual, what was recited by the community.”

original: atthaṃ pakāsayissāmī”ti vuttaṃ, adhikāravasena “tassa abhidhammassā”ti viññāyati.
analyzed: attham pakāsayissāmi iti vuttam adhikāra vasena tassa abhidhammassa ati viññāyati
translated: The construction is understood thus: “I will make known the meaning of what was recited by the individual, what was recited by the community.”

original: Saṅgītāti atthaṃ pakāsetuṃ yuttaṭṭhāne “ayaṃ etassa attho, ayaṃ etassa attho”ti saṅgahetvā
analyzed: saṅgītā ati attham pakāsetum yutta ṭṭhāne ayam etassa atthaḥ ayam etassa atthaḥ iti saṅgahetvā
translated: The “rehearsal” is the rehearsing of the meaning in the place where it should be demonstrated, namely, “This is the meaning of this, this is the meaning of that.”

original: vuttā, pacchāpi ca dutiyatatiyasaṅgītīsu anusaṅgītā.
analyzed: vuttā pacchā api ca dutiya tatiya saṅgītīsu anusaṅgītā
translated: And it was rehearsed later in the second and third rehearsals.

original: 14-16. Abhisaṅkhatāti racitā. Tatoti aṭṭhakathāto. Tantinayānuganti tantigatiṃ anugataṃ.
analyzed: racitā tatas ti aṭṭhakathātaḥ tanti gatim anugatam
translated: “Composed” : made. “From that” : from the commentary. “In conformity with the method of the text” : in conformity with the method of the text.

original: Bhāsanti māgadhabhāsaṃ. Nikāyantaraladdhīhīti antarantarā anuppavesitāhi. Asammissanti
analyzed: bhāsanti māgadha bhāsam nikāya antara laddhīhi iti antarantarā an uppavesitāhi a sammissanti
translated: “The language” : the Magadha language. “In the other collections” : in the other collections that have been inserted here and there. “Unmixed” :🔽unadulterated. “Unconfused” : unconfused even in the collections. “Unmixed and unconfused” :

original: avokiṇṇaṃ. Anākulanti sanikāyepi anāvilaṃ paricchinnaṃ. Asammisso anākulo ca yo mahāvihāravāsīnaṃ🔽atthavinicchayo, taṃ dīpayanto atthaṃ pakāsayissāmīti. Etena tipiṭakacūḷanāgattherādīhi
analyzed: avokiṇṇam an ākulanti an āvilam paricchinnam a sammissaḥ an ākulaḥ ca yaḥ mahāvihāra vāsīnam  attha vinicchayo tam dīpayantaḥ attham pakāsayissāmi iti etena tipiṭaka cūḷa nāga tthera ādīhi
translated: the interpretation of the meaning of the Abhidhamma by the residents of the Mahavihara.🔽“I shall demonstrate the meaning” : by this he shows that he is going to demonstrate the meaning of the Abhidhamma as it is unmixed and unconfused and as it is interpreted by the residents of the Mahavihara.🔽By this also the Theravada as expounded by the Elder Tipitaka Cula-Nagita and others is included.

original: vutto theravādopi saṅgahito hoti. Atha vā tambapaṇṇibhāsaṃ apanetvā māgadhabhāsañca
analyzed: vutto thera vādaḥ api saṅgahitaḥ hoti atha vā tamba paṇṇi bhāsam apanetvā māgadha bhāsam ca
translated: Or else, the meaning of the Abhidhamma that is demonstrated by removing the language of Tambapama and substituting the Magadha language

original: āropetvā pakāsiyamāno yo abhidhammassa attho asammisso anākuloyeva ca hoti mahāvihāravāsīnañca
analyzed: āropetvā pakāsiyamānaḥ yaḥ abhidhammassa attho a sammissaḥ ca hoti mahāvihāra vāsīnam ca
translated: is unmixed and unconfused and is that of the residents of the Mahavihara.

original: vinicchayabhūto, taṃ atthaṃ “eso mahāvihāravāsīnaṃ vinicchayo”ti dīpayanto pakāsayissāmi.
analyzed: vinicchaya bhūtaḥ tam attham esaḥ mahāvihāra vāsīnam dīpayantaḥ pakāsayissāmi
translated: The commentary will be a declaration of the meaning, showing that “this is the decision of the residents of the Great Monastery.”

original: Tappakāsaneneva hi so tathā dīpito hotīti.🔽17. Tosayanto vicakkhaṇeti vicakkhaṇe tosayanto gahetabbaṃ gahetvānāti evaṃ yojetvā
analyzed: tad pakāsanena iva hi saḥ tathā dīpitaḥ hoti iti  tosayantaḥ vicakkhaṇa iti vicakkhaṇe tosayantaḥ gahetabbam evam yojetvā
translated: For it is by the mere act of declaring that it is shown to be so.🔽“Gratifying the wise” : the meaning is that he will declare the meaning in such a way as to gratify the wise by taking what should be taken.

original: “gahetabbaṭṭhāneyeva gahitaṃ suṭṭhu kata”nti evaṃ tosayantoti atthaṃ vadanti. Evaṃ
analyzed: gahetabba ṭṭhāneyā iva gahitam suṭṭhu katam nti evam tosayanto ti attham vadanti evam
translated: “Having taken what should be taken” : the meaning is that he will declare the meaning in such a way as to gratify the wise by taking what should be taken.

original: sati gahetabbaggahaṇeneva tosanaṃ kataṃ, na aññena atthappakāsanenāti etaṃ āpajjeyya.🔽Tosayanto atthaṃ pakāsayissāmīti evaṃ pana yojanāya sati gahetabbaggahaṇaṃ aññañca
analyzed: sati gahetabba ggahaṇena iva tosanam katam na aññena attha ppakāsanena ati etam āpajjeyya  tosayantaḥ attham pakāsayissāmi iti evam pana yojanāya sati gahetabba ggahaṇam aññan ca
translated: If this were the meaning, then he would be committed to the assertion that gratification is effected by taking what should be taken and not by any other declaration of the meaning.🔽But if the construction is taken as “gratifying the wise, I will declare the meaning,” then taking what should be taken and all the other declarations of the meaning are included.

original: sabbaṃ atthappakāsanaṃ hotīti sabbena tena tosanaṃ kataṃ hoti, tasmā tosayanto atthaṃ🔽pakāsayissāmīti yuttarūpā.
analyzed: sabbam attha ppakāsanam hoti iti sabbena tena tosanam katam hoti tasmā tosayantaḥ attham  pakāsayissāmi iti yutta rūpā
translated: Therefore the construction “gratifying the wise, I will declare the meaning” is appropriate.

original: 18-20. Idāni yaṃ atthappakāsanaṃ kattukāmo, tassa mahattaṃ pariharituṃ “kammaṭṭhānānī”tiādimāha.
analyzed: idāni yam attha ppakāsanam kattu kāmaḥ tassa mahattam pariharitum kammaṭṭhānāni iti ādim āha
translated: Now, in order to avoid any depreciation of the value of the meaning he is about to declare, he says “meditation subjects” , etc.

original: Atthavaṇṇananti ettha vaṇṇanā nāma vivaritvā vitthāretvā vacanaṃ. Itīti “apanetvā
analyzed: attha vaṇṇanam ti ettha vaṇṇanā nāma vivaritvā vitthāretvā vacanam iti iti apanetvā
translated: Commentary: here, commentary is the act of expounding and expatiating. Thus: thus, in the way shown beginning with “having removed,

original: tato bhāsa”nti evamādinā yathādassitappakārena. Iti sotūnaṃ ussāhuppādanassa hetuṃ🔽dasseti. Abhidhammakathanti abhidhammaṭṭhakathaṃ. Nisāmethāti suṇātha. Idāni avassaṃ
analyzed: tatas bhāsanti evamādinā yathā dassita ppakārena iti sotūnam ussāha uppādanassa hetum  dasseti abhidhamma kathanti abhidhamma ṭṭhakatham nisāmetha ati suṇātha idāni avassam
translated: he spoke.” Thus he shows the reason for arousing the zeal of the listeners.

original: ayaṃ sotabbāyevāti daḷhaṃ ussāhento āha “dullabhā hi ayaṃ kathā”ti.
analyzed: ayam sotabbāya iva ati daḷham ussāhentaḥ āha dullabhā hi ayam kathā iti
translated: Abhidhamma-talk: a talk based on the Abhidhamma. Listen: he says this in order to arouse the listeners’ zeal firmly, thinking: “Now, this must certainly be listened to.”

original: Vīsatigāthāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: vīsati gāthā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the twenty verses is finished.

original: Nidānakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: nidāna kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: Commentary on the Nidana-kathā

original: Aṭṭhasāliniṃ tāva vaṇṇentehi ācariyehi tassā sanniveso vibhāvetabbo. Tasmā idaṃ vuccati –
analyzed: aṭṭhasālinim tāva vaṇṇentehi ācariyehi tassā sannivesaḥ vibhāvetabbo tasmai idam vuccati
translated: Now, those who expound the Aṭṭhasālinī should elucidate the arrangement of the Nidana-kathā. Therefore this is said:🔽The meaning of the words, the division,

original: “Vacanattho paricchedo, sanniveso ca pāḷiyā;🔽Sāgarehi tathā cintā, desanāhi gambhīratā.
analyzed: vacana ttho paricchedo sanniveso ca pāḷiyā  tathā cintā desanāhi gambhīra tā
translated: The arrangement of the text,🔽The profundity by the oceans, and the teaching.

original: “Desanāya sarīrassa, pavattiggahaṇaṃ tathā;🔽Therassa vācanāmagga-tappabhāvitatāpi ca.
analyzed: desanāya sarīrassa pavatti ggahaṇam tathā  therassa ca
translated: The body of the teaching, and likewise the grasping of the occurrence,🔽And the state of being developed by the recitation path of the Elder.

original: “Paṭivedhā tathā buddha-vacanādīhi ādito;
analyzed: paṭivedhā tathā buddha vacana ādīhi āditaḥ
translated: The penetration, and likewise from the beginning with the Buddha’s word, etc.

original: Ābhidhammikabhāvassa, sādhanaṃ sabbadassino.
analyzed: ābhidhammika bhāvassa sādhanam sabbadassinaḥ
translated: Was given by the All-Seeing One.

original: “Vinayenātha gosiṅga-suttena ca mahesinā;🔽Bhāsitattassa saṃsiddhi, nidānena ca dīpitā.
analyzed: vinayena atha gosiṅga suttena ca mahesinā  saṃsiddhi nidānena ca dīpitā
translated: “By the Vinaya and by the Great Discourse on the Lineage,🔽And by the story told to prove it,

original: “Pakāsetvā imaṃ sabbaṃ, paṭiññātakathā katā;
analyzed: pakāsetvā imam sabbam paṭiññāta kathā katā
translated: “Having thus expounded all this,🔽The discussion of the proposition is completed.🔽This is the arrangement

original: Aṭṭhasāliniyā etaṃ, sannivesaṃ vibhāvaye”ti.
analyzed: aṭṭhasāliniyāḥ etam sannivesam vibhāvaya iti
translated: In the Eightfold Method.”

original: Vacanatthavijānanena viditābhidhammasāmaññatthassa abhidhammakathā vuccamānā sobheyyāti🔽abhidhammaparijānanameva ādimhi yuttarūpanti tadatthaṃ pucchati “tattha kenaṭṭhena🔽abhidhammo”ti. Tattha tatthāti “abhidhammassa atthaṃ pakāsayissāmī”ti yadidaṃ vuttaṃ,
