translated: The words “kusalā dhammā” and “akusalā dhammā” and “abyākatā dhammā” are the three terms.

original: abyākatadhammapadāni dveti. Ekatthanānatthānīti visuṃ visuṃ dvinnaṃ dvinnaṃ aññamaññāpekkhaṃ🔽ekatthanānatthataṃ codeti, na channaṃ. Dosamettha vattukāmo codako pucchatīti ñatvā
analyzed: abyākata dhamma padāni dve iti eka attha nānatthāni iti visum visum dvinnam dvinnam aññamañña apekkham  ekattha nānatthatam codeti na channam dosam ettha vattu kāmo codako pucchati iti ñatvā
translated: The three terms are “different in meaning and different in phrasing,” that is, they are different in meaning and different in phrasing one from the other.🔽The accuser, it seems, wanted to find fault, so the teacher said, “What is there? ”

original: ācariyo āha “kiñcetthā”ti. Ettha ekatthanānatthatāyaṃ kiñci vattabbaṃ asamattā te🔽codanā, avasiṭṭhaṃ tāva brūhīti vuttaṃ hoti. Yadi ekatthāni indasakkasaddānaṃ viya🔽saddamatte eva bhedo, evaṃ kusaladhammasaddānaṃ, na attheti. Yathā “indo sakko”ti
analyzed: ācariyaḥ āha kiñca itthā iti ettha eka attha nānattha tā ayam kiñci vattabbam asamattā te  codanā avasiṭṭham tāva brūhi iti vuttam hoti yadi ekatthāni inda sakka saddānam viya  sadda matte eva bhedaḥ evam kusala dhamma saddānam na yathā indo sakkoti
translated: What is there in this case to be said about the difference in meaning and difference in phrasing? Your accusation is incomplete.🔽Tell me what remains. If the terms are different in meaning but the same in phrasing, like the terms “Inda” and “Sakka,”🔽then the terms “kusalā dhammā” and so on are different in meaning but the same in phrasing.

original: vutte “indo indo”ti vuttasadisaṃ hoti, evaṃ “kusalā dhammā”ti idaṃ vacanaṃ “kusalā
analyzed: vutte indo indo ti vutta sadisam hoti evam kusalāḥ dhammā ti idam vacanam kusalā
translated: “Inda” and “Sakka” are different in meaning but the same in phrasing.

original: kusalā”ti vuttasadisaṃ hoti. Evaṃ itaresupi “akusalā akusalā”ti vuttasadisatā “abyākatā
analyzed: kusalā ati vutta sadisam hoti evam itaresu pi akusalā akusalā iti vutta sadisa tā abyākatā
translated: and the meaning is similar to that of the words “wholesome” . Likewise in the case of the other two terms, “unwholesome” and “unwholesome” and “indeterminate” and “indeterminate” .

original: abyākatā”ti vuttasadisatā ca yojetabbā. Atha nānatthāni, indakuverasaddānaṃ viya🔽saddato atthato ca kusaladhammasaddānaṃ bhedo, tathā akusaladhammasaddādīnanti chahi
analyzed: abyākatā iti vutta sadisa tā ca yojetabbā atha nānatthāni inda kuvera saddānam viya  saddataḥ atthataḥ ca kusala dhamma saddānam bhedaḥ tathā akusala dhamma sadda ādīnam ti chahi
translated: But if the words are different in meaning, then just as the words “Indra” and “Kubera” are different in meaning,

original: padehi catūhi padehi ca cha cattāro ca atthā bhinnā vuttāti kusalattikādīnaṃ kusalachakkādibhāvo,
analyzed: padehi catūhi padehi ca cha cattāro ca atthāḥ bhinnā vuttā ati kusala ttika ādīnam kusala chakka ādi bhāvaḥ
translated: so too the words “wholesome states” and so on are different in meaning. Thus by the six terms and the four terms respectively the four meanings and the six meanings are stated as different. So the wholesome triad, etc., would have the nature of the wholesome dyad, etc.,

original: hetudukādīnañca hetucatukkādibhāvo āpajjatīti.
analyzed: hetu duka ādīnam ca hetu catukka ādi bhāvaḥ āpajjati iti
translated: and the cause dyad, etc., would have the nature of the cause triad, etc.

original: Nanu tiṇṇaṃ dhammasaddānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ indasaddānaṃ viya rūpābhedā atthābhedoti chakkabhāvo
analyzed: nanu tiṇṇam dhamma saddānam tiṇṇam inda saddānam viya rūpa abhedā attha abhedaḥ ti chakka bhāvaḥ
translated: But surely, since the three terms “states,” “wholesome,” and “wholesome states” are not different in meaning from the three terms “form,” “wholesome,” and “wholesome form,” the dyad nature

original: na bhavissati, tasmā evamidaṃ vattabbaṃ siyā “tikadukānaṃ catukkatikabhāvo āpajjatī”ti,
analyzed: na bhavissati tasmai evam idam vattabbam siyā tika dukānam catukkatika bhāvaḥ āpajjati iti
translated: will not exist. So this should be said: “The dyads and triads would have the triad and dyad nature.”

original: na vattabbaṃ, tiṇṇaṃ dhammasaddānaṃ ekatthānaṃ tiṇṇaṃ indasaddānaṃ viya vacane payojanābhāvā
analyzed: na vattabbam tiṇṇam dhamma saddānam eka atthānam tiṇṇam inda saddānam viya vacane payojana abhāvā
translated: This cannot be said, because there is no purpose in using the three terms “states,” “wholesome,” and “wholesome states” as there is in using the three terms “Indra,” “Kubera,” and “Indra and Kubera.”

original: vuttānaṃ tesaṃ māsasaddānaṃ viya abhinnarūpānañca atthabhedo upapajjatīti, evamapi🔽yathā eko māsasaddo abhinnarūpo kālaṃ aparaṇṇavisesaṃ suvaṇṇamāsañca vadati, evaṃ
analyzed: vuttānam tesam māsa saddānam viya abhinna rūpānam ca attha bhedaḥ upapajjati iti evam api  yathā ekaḥ māsa saddaḥ abhinna rūpaḥ kālam aparaṇṇa visesam suvaṇṇa māsam ca vadati evam
translated: And the difference in meaning of the words “month” is like the difference in meaning of the words “month” already mentioned.🔽And just as the single word “month” in its undifferentiated form refers to time and to a particular kind of gold, so too🔽the single word “state” can be used in the differentiated sense. So the alternative of non-differentiation is arrived at, like the alternative of differentiation in the case of the word “month,” which is the meaning of the words “time,” etc.,

original: dhammasaddopi eko bhinne atthe vattumarahatīti kālādīnaṃ māsapadatthatāya viya tabbacanīyabhinnatthānaṃ🔽dhammapadatthatāya abhedoti catukkatikabhāvo eva āpajjatīti, nāpajjati ekassa saddassa
analyzed: dhamma saddaḥ api ekaḥ bhinne atthe vattum arahati iti kāla ādīnam māsa pada ttha tāya viya tad bacanīya bhinna tthānam  dhamma pada ttha tāya abhedaḥ ti catukkatika bhāvaḥ eva āpajjati iti na āpajjati ekassa saddassa
translated: and the alternative of differentiation is arrived at, like the alternative of non-differentiation in the case of the words “that which is to be spoken,” which is the meaning of the words “state,” etc.

original: jātiguṇakiriyābhinnānaṃ anabhidhānato. Na hi māsa-saddo eko jātibhinnānaṃ kālādīnaṃ🔽antarena sarūpekasesaṃ vācako hoti. Idha ca yadi sarūpekaseso kato siyā, dutiyo tatiyo
analyzed: jāti guṇa kiriyā bhinnānam anabhidhānataḥ na hi māsa saddaḥ ekaḥ jāti bhinnānam kāla ādīnam  antarena sarūpa ikasesam vācakaḥ hoti idha ca yadi sarūpa ikasesaḥ kataḥ siyā dutiyaḥ tatiyaḥ
translated: But it is not so, because a single word does not express different kinds of states such as kinds of birth, qualities, and actions. For the single word “month” does not express time, etc., which are different kinds of states without a common substratum or a particular common to them all.🔽And if a common substratum or a particular common to them all were intended here, then a second and a third word “state” would not be required, but it is used, and so, like the words “wholesome,” etc.,

original: ca dhamma-saddo na vattabbo siyā, vutto ca so, tasmā kusalādi-saddā viya abhinnakusalādijātīsu
analyzed: ca dhamma saddaḥ na vattabbaḥ siyā vuttaḥ ca saḥ tasmā kusala ādi saddāḥ viya abhinna kusala ādi jātīsu
translated: it is a word for a single kind of state, namely, the wholesome, etc.,

original: rūpasāmaññepi māsa-saddā viya tayo vinivattaaññajātīsu vattamānā tayo dve ca dhamma-saddā
analyzed: rūpa sāmaññe pi māsa saddāḥ viya tayaḥ vinivatta añña jātīsu vattamānā tayaḥ dve ca dhamma saddā
translated: And the words “states” and “two” in the three and two kinds of profitable, etc.,

original: āpannāti tikadukānaṃ chakkacatukkabhāvo eva āpajjatīti.
analyzed: āpannā ati tika dukānam chakka catukka bhāvaḥ eva āpajjati iti
translated: are used in the same way as the words “month” and “year” in the three and two kinds of month and year.

original: Padānañca asambandhoti kusaladhammapadānaṃ aññamaññaṃ tathā akusaladhammapadānaṃ
analyzed: padānam ca asambandho ti kusala dhamma padānam aññam aññam tathā akusala dhamma padānam
translated: And there is no connection between the words: the meaning is that there is no connection between the words of the profitable-state triad and dyad, and between the words of the unprofitable-state triad and dyad,

original: abyākatadhammapadānañca asambandho āpajjatīti attho. Dvinnaṃ dvinnañhi icchito sambandho,
analyzed: abyākata dhamma padānam ca asambandhaḥ āpajjati iti atthaḥ dvinnam icchitaḥ sambandhaḥ
translated: and between the words of the indeterminate-state triad and dyad. For it is a connection between two at a time that is intended,🔽not between all six or all four together.

original: na sabbesaṃ channaṃ catunnaṃ vā aññamaññanti. Idaṃ pana kasmā codeti, nanu nānatthatte🔽sati atthantaradassanatthaṃ vuccamānesu dhamma-saddesu kusalākusalābyākata-saddānaṃ
analyzed: na sabbesam channam catunnam vā aññam aññanti idam pana kasmā codeti nanu nānatthatte  sati atthantara dassana attham vuccamānesu dhamma saddesu kusala akusala abyākata saddānam
translated: But why does he raise this objection? Surely when the words “states” are said for the purpose of showing a different meaning in the case of different meanings,🔽the words “profitable,” “unprofitable,” and “indeterminate” are rightly said to be unconnected, as in the case of the words “month” and “year” in the three and two kinds of month and year?

original: viya asambandho vutto yutto evāti? Saccametaṃ, asambandhaṃ pana siddhaṃ katvā purimacodanā🔽katā “tikadukānaṃ chakkacatukkabhāvo āpajjatī”ti, idha pana taṃ asambandhaṃ sādhetuṃ
analyzed: viya asambandhaḥ vuttaḥ yuttaḥ evā ati saccam etam asambandham pana siddham katvā purima codanā 🔽katā tika dukānam chakka catukka bhāvaḥ āpajjati iti idha pana tam asambandham sādhetum
translated: That is so, but the previous objection was stated after establishing the unconnectedness,🔽and here it is stated for the purpose of establishing that unconnectedness.

original: idaṃ coditanti veditabbaṃ. Atha vā evamettha yojanā kātabbā – yadi pana chakkacatukkabhāvaṃ🔽na icchasi, padānaṃ sambandhena bhavitabbaṃ yathāvuttanayena, so ca samānavibhattīnaṃ🔽dvinnaṃ dvinnaṃ sambandho ekatthatte sati yujjeyya, tvaṃ pana nānatthataṃ vadasīti🔽padānañca te asambandho āpajjati, neva nāpajjatīti. Avassañca sambandho icchitabbo pubbāparavirodhāpattitoti dassetuṃ “yāpi
analyzed: idam coditam ti veditabbam atha vā evam ettha yojanā kātabbā yadi pana chakka catukka bhāvam  na icchasi padānam sambandhena bhavitabbam yathā vutta nayena saḥ ca samāna vibhattīnam  dvinnam dvinnam sambandhaḥ ekatthatte sati yujjeyya tvam pana nānatthatam vadasi iti  padānam ca te asambandhaḥ āpajjati na iva na āpajjati iti niyamana atthaḥ ca saddo pubba apara pe  nippayojanāni nāma honti iti chakka catukka bhāvam an icchantassa nānatthatam pana icchantassa ati  adhippāyaḥ sambandho icchitabbo pubba apara virodha āpattito ti dassetum yā api
translated: This is how the passage should be understood. Or else the construction may be made in this way: “If you do not accept the fourfold and twofold method, there must be a connection between the terms in the way stated. And that connection would be proper if there were a single meaning, as in the case of the two terms ‘dhamma’ and ‘dhamma-knowledge,’ which have a dual relation of co-presence and co-absence. But you maintain a difference of meaning,

original: cesā”tiādimāha. Pucchā hi padavipallāsakaraṇena dhammā eva kusalāti kusaladhamma-saddānaṃ🔽idha uddiṭṭhānaṃ ekatthataṃ dīpeti, tava ca nānatthataṃ vadantassa neva hi dhammā
analyzed: ca isā ati ādim āha pucchā hi pada vipallāsa karaṇena dhammāḥ eva kusalā ti kusala dhamma saddānam 🔽idha ekattha tam dīpeti tava ca nānattha tam vadantassa na iva hi dhammā
