analyzed: attha anattha pariggaṇhanam sa atthaka sampajaññam sati ca atthe sappāya asappāya rūpa ādi pariggaṇhanam  sa pāya sampajaññam gocara gāma abhikkamana ādīsu kammaṭṭhāna a vijahanam gocara sampajaññam
translated: “Understanding of what is suitable”: the discerning of what is suitable and what is not suitable in the way of nutriment, etc., when there is a goal.🔽“Understanding of the sphere”: the not abandoning of the meditation subject in going to the village to collect alms, etc.

original: Abhikkamanādīnaṃ dhātuādivasena pavicayo asammohasampajaññaṃ. Sabbakammaṭṭhānabhāvanānuyuttānaṃ
analyzed: abhikkamana ādīnam dhātu ādi vasena pavicayaḥ asammoha sampajaññam sabba kammaṭṭhāna bhāvanā anuyuttānam
translated: “Understanding free from delusion”: the investigation of going forth, etc., by way of the elements, etc.

original: sabbayogīnaṃ sabbadā upakārakā ime dve dhammā pāripanthakaharaṇato bhāvanāvaḍḍhanato
analyzed: sabba yogīnam sabbadā upakārakāḥ ime dve dhammā pāripanthaka haraṇataḥ bhāvanā vaḍḍhanato
translated: These two things are helpful at all times to all meditators who are devoted to the development of the meditation subject. They are the abandoning of hindrances and the arousing of the enlightenment factors.

original: ca. Yathāha “dve dhammā bahukārā sati ca sampajaññañcā”ti. Yuge naddhā viyāti yuganaddhā,
analyzed: ca yathā āha dve dhammā bahu kārā sati ca sampajaññan ca ati yuge naddhā viyāti yuga naddhā
translated: “Yoked as a pair” : yuganaddhā.

original: aññamaññaṃ nimittabhāvena samaṃ pavattāti attho. “Puna caparaṃ, āvuso, bhikkhu samathavipassanaṃ
analyzed: aññam aññam nimitta bhāvena samam pavattā ati attho puna caparam āvuso bhikkhu samatha vipassanam
translated: The meaning is that they occur evenly as the object of each other. For in the sutta it is said of these two: “And further, friends, a bhikkhu develops serenity and insight yoked evenly together” .

original: yuganaddhaṃ bhāvetī”ti hi sutte etesaṃ yuganaddhatā vuttā. Sabbakusaladhammesu līnuddhaccābhāvo
analyzed: yuga naddham bhāveti iti hi sutte etesam yuga naddha tā vuttā sabba kusala dhammesu līn uddhacca abhāvaḥ
translated: The absence of both slackness and excitedness in all profitable states

original: etehi dvīhi samaṃ yuttehīti “vīriyasamādhiyojanatthāyā”ti āha, yogavacanatthāyāti attho.
analyzed: etehi dvīhi samam yuttehi iti vīriya samādhi yojana tthāya ati āha yogavacana tthāya ati attho
translated: is due to the yoking of these two evenly together. So he said “for the purpose of yoking energy and concentration” . The meaning is: for the purpose of the meaning of the word “yoked” .

original: Yevāpanakavaṇṇanā
analyzed: yevāpanaka vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the invariable🔽By the absence of change: by the absence of alteration.

original: Rūpābhāvenāti ruppanābhāvena. Dhammāti etassa attho sabhāvato upalabbhamānāti. Mettāpubbabhāgoti
analyzed: rūpa abhāvena ati ruppana abhāvena dhammā ati etassa attho sabhāvataḥ upalabbhamānā ati mettā pubbabhāgaḥ ti
translated: The meaning of the word dhamma is “that which has a specific nature of its own” .

original: appanāppattāya mettāya pubbabhāgo, parikammamettā etasmiṃ citte atthīti attho. Virativasenāti
analyzed: appanā appattāya mettāya pubbabhāgaḥ parikamma mettā etasmim citte atthi iti atthaḥ virati vasena ati
translated: The preliminary stage of loving-kindness: the preliminary work of absorption loving-kindness. The meaning is that this consciousness has loving-kindness as its object.

original: vacīpavattiyā na pūreti, kintu viratiyogenāti attho. Apaṇṇakaṅgānīti aviraddhaṅgāni.
analyzed: vacī pavattiyā na pūreti kintu virati yogena ati attho apaṇṇaka aṅgāni iti a viraddha aṅgāni
translated: By the mode of abstinence: he does not fulfil it by performance of speech, but by the mode of abstinence. The invariable factors: the unconflicting factors.

original: Yathā tathā vā ārammaṇe vinicchayanaṃ adhimuccanaṃ. Na hi anadhimuccanto pāṇātipātādīsu
analyzed: yathā tathā vā ārammaṇe vinicchayanam adhimuccanam na hi pāṇa atipāta ādīsu
translated: Deciding is the adverting to the object in whatever way it presents itself. For one who does not advert does not engage in killing breathing things, etc.,

original: dānādīsu vā pavattati, saddhā pana pasādanīyesu pasādādhimokkhoti ayametesaṃ viseso.🔽Dārakassa viya ito cito ca saṃsappanassa karissāmi na karissāmīti avinicchayassa
analyzed: dāna ādīsu vā pavattati saddhā pana pasādanīyesu pasāda adhimokkhaḥ ti ayam etesam viseso  dārakassa viya itas citas ca saṃsappanassa karissāmi na karissāmi iti a vinicchayassa
translated: or in giving, etc., either. But faith is the act of resolving upon the confidence that inspires. This is the difference between them.

original: paṭipakkhakiriyā asaṃsappanaṃ. Purimamanatoti bhavaṅgato. Visadisaṃ vīthijavanaṃ🔽manaṃ karotīti manasikārasāmaññena vīthijavanapaṭipādake dasseti. Tesu dhammesūti
analyzed: paṭipakkha kiriyā a saṃsappanam purima manataḥ ti bhavaṅgataḥ visadisam vīthi javanam  manam karoti iti manasikāra sāmaññena vīthi javana paṭipādake dasseti tesu dhammesu iti
translated: Non-distraction is the opposite of distraction, which is the indecision as to whether or not one will do this or that, like a child’s wriggling and squirming.🔽The mind that is purified is the mind that has emerged from the life-continuum. It is called “purified” because it is similar to the path mind-deliverance.

original: cittacetasikadhammesu. Atadārammaṇattepi hi tesu samappavattesu udāsīnabhāvato tatramajjhattatāti🔽vuccati. Alīnānuddhatappavattipaccayattā ūnādhikanivāraṇarasā. Kāyaduccaritādivatthūnanti
analyzed: citta cetasika dhammesu hi tesu sama ppavattesu udāsīna bhāvato tatram ajjhatta tā ti  vuccati alīna anuddhata ppavatti paccaya ttā ūna adhika nivāraṇa rasā
translated: It is called “directed” because it directs itself to the object. It is called “concentrated” because it is not distracted from the object.🔽It is called “purified” because it is not defiled by the hindrances. It is called “bright” because it is not obscured by the defilements and the results of kamma.

original: pāṇādīnaṃ. Amaddanā maddanapaṭipakkhabhāvova.
analyzed: pāṇa ādīnam amaddanā maddana paṭipakkha bhāvaḥ u
translated: It is called “malleable,” etc., because it is fit for use in developing the higher wisdom.

original: Taṃtaṃrāsikiccavasena vibhāgarahitā avibhattikā. Etthāti etesu savibhattikesu dutiyaṭṭhānādīsupi🔽bhājiyamānesu apubbaṃ natthīti attho. Padaṃ pūritanti jhānādipadaṃ pañcakādivasena
analyzed: taṃ taṃ rāsi kicca vasena vibhāga rahitāḥ avibhattikāḥ ettha ati etesu savibhattikesu dutiya ṭṭhāna ādīsu pi  bhājiyamānesu apubbam natthi iti attho padam pūritanti jhāna ādi padam pañcaka ādi vasena
translated: They are not divided by the division of the groups of five, etc., according to the work to be done in each case. ‘Here’ means in the second place, etc., where they are divided.🔽The meaning is that there is nothing new there. ‘The term is fulfilled’ means that the term ‘jhāna,’ etc., is fulfilled by the five factors, etc.,

original: pūritaṃ. Pañca hi aṅgāni jhānapadassa attho, tesu ekasmiñca ūne jhānapadaṃ ūnaṃ hotīti.
analyzed: pūritam pañca hi aṅgāni jhānapadassa attho tesu ekasmin ca ūne jhānapadam ūnam hoti iti
translated: for if one of them is missing, the term ‘jhāna,’ etc., is not fulfilled.

original: Padasamūho padakoṭṭhāso vā taṃ tameva vā padaṃ, avuttaṃ hāpitaṃ nāma hotīti vuttaṃ
analyzed: pada samūhaḥ pada koṭṭhāsaḥ vā tam tam eva vā padam avuttam hāpitam nāma hoti iti vuttam
translated: ‘The term’ is a collection of terms or a group of terms, or it is just the term itself. What is not stated is called ‘omitted.’

original: “pūrita”nti. Vuttasmiññeva vuccamāne anekesaṃ purisasaddānaṃ viya koci sambandho🔽natthīti maññamāno āha “ananusandhikā kathā”ti. Antarantarā vuttasmiññeva vuccamāne
analyzed: pūritam iti vuttasmin ñeva vuccamāne anekesam purisa saddānam viya koci sambandhaḥ  natthi iti maññamānaḥ āha ananusandhikā kathā iti antar antarā vuttasmin ñeva vuccamāne
translated: ‘Fulfilled’ is said because it is stated. When it is stated, it is as if there is no connection between the many words ‘man,’🔽thinking that there is no connection, he says ‘the talk is not continuous.’ When it is stated in the middle of what is being said,

original: anukkamena dhammā kathitā na hontīti āha “uppaṭipāṭiyā”ti. Phassapañcamakarāsi sabbacittuppādasādhāraṇavasena
analyzed: anukkamena dhammā kathitā na honti iti āha uppaṭi pāṭiyā ti phassa pañcamaka rāsi sabba cittuppāda sādhāraṇa vasena
translated: the things are not stated in due order, he says ‘not in due order.’ The group of five beginning with contact is common to all kinds of consciousness.

original: catukkhandhatappaccayasaṅgahavasena ca vutto. Yathāvuttesu pana rāsīsu ekarāsikiccassapi
analyzed: catu khandha tad paccaya saṅgaha vasena ca vuttaḥ yathā vuttesu pana rāsīsu eka rāsi kiccassa api
translated: But since there is no single function common to all the states in the above-mentioned groups,🔽desire, etc., are mentioned as the “pervaders” of the groups.

original: abhāvā chandādayo yevāpanakavasena vuttā. Vuttānampi ca dhammānaṃ yathā vedanādīnaṃ
analyzed: abhāvā chanda ādayaḥ vuttāḥ vuttānam pi ca dhammānam yathā vedanā ādīnam
translated: And although the states mentioned are included in the aggregates, etc.,

original: jhānaṅgādibhāvo vutto, na evaṃ sovacassatākalyāṇamittatādiviseso vuttoti tassa saṅgaṇhanatthaṃ🔽keci dhamme visuṃ ṭhapetvā te ca tañca visesaṃ “ye vā panā”ti āha. Veneyyajjhāsayavasena
analyzed: jhāna aṅga ādi bhāvaḥ vuttaḥ na evam tassa saṅgaṇhana attham  keci dhamme visum ṭhapetvā te ca tat ca visesam ye vā āha
translated: the special qualities of being a good friend, etc., are not mentioned as they are in the case of the jhāna factors, etc.,🔽so he mentions them separately as “or any other states” in order to include them.

original: vā sāvasese dhamme vatvā “ye vā panā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vā sa avasese dhamme vatvā ye vā pana ati vuttam
translated: Or alternatively, he mentions the states that remain after the above-mentioned states have been stated, as “or any other states” in order to include those that are suitable for disciples and those that are not.

original: Yevāpanakavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: yevāpanaka vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the “pervaders” is ended.

original: Dhammuddesavārakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dhamma uddesa vāra kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The explanation of the “exposition of ideas” is ended.

original: Kāmāvacarakusalaṃ
analyzed: kāmāvacara kusalam
translated: The profitable of the sense sphere

original: Niddesavārakathāvaṇṇanā🔽2. Phusanakavasenāti sante asantepi visaye āpāthagate cittassa sannipatanavasena
analyzed: niddesa vāra kathā vaṇṇanā  phusanaka vasena ati sante asante pi visaye āpātha gate cittassa sannipatana vasena
translated: The exposition of the “analysis”🔽By the “mode of contacting”: by the mode of the mind’s meeting with an object, whether it is present or not.

original: “cittaṃ mano”tiādīsu viya kiccavisesaṃ, “mānasa”ntiādīsu viya samāne atthe saddavisesaṃ,
analyzed: cittam manaḥ ti ādīsu viya kicca visesam mānasanti ādīsu viya samāne atthe sadda visesam
translated: Just as in the case of the words “mind” , “mentality” , etc., the difference is one of function, and in the case of the words “mental” , etc., the difference is one of name only,

original: “paṇḍara”ntiādīsu viya guṇavisesaṃ, “cetasikaṃ sāta”ntiādīsu viya nissayavisesaṃ,
analyzed: paṇḍaranti ādīsu viya guṇa visesam cetasikam sāta nti ādīsu viya nissaya visesam
translated: “Skill” is a special quality, as in “white” and so on. “Mental pleasure” is a special support, as in “mental pleasure” and so on.

original: “cittassa ṭhitī”tiādīsu viya aññassa avatthābhāvavisesaṃ, “alubbhanā”tiādīsu viya🔽aññassa kiriyābhāvavisesaṃ, “alubbhitatta”ntiādīsu viya aññassa kiriyābhāvabhūtatāvisesantiādikaṃ
analyzed: cittassa ṭhiti iti ādīsu viya aññassa avatthā bhāva visesam alubbhanā ti ādīsu viya  aññassa kiriyā abhāva visesam a lubbhita ttanti ādīsu viya aññassa kiriyā abhāva bhūta tā visesa nti ādikam
translated: “Stability of consciousness” is a special non-state of another, as in “stability of consciousness” and so on. “Non-wavering” is a special non-state of another’s action, as in “non-wavering” and so on.🔽“The state of being non-wavering” is a special state of another’s non-action, as in “the state of being non-wavering” and so on.

original: anapekkhitvā dhammamattadīpanaṃ sabhāvapadaṃ. Phusantassa hi cittassa phusanakiriyā
analyzed: an apekkhitvā dhamma matta dīpanam sabhāva padam phusantassa hi cittassa phusana kiriyā
translated: Without regard for such things, the word “nature” illuminates mere states. For the action of touching belongs to the consciousness that touches.

original: phusanākāro. Samphusanāti ārammaṇasamāgamaphusanā, na paṭilābhasamphusanā. Samphusitassa
analyzed: phusana ākāraḥ samphusanā ti ārammaṇa samāgama phusanā na paṭilābha samphusanā samphusitassa
translated: The mode of touching is the mode of touching. “Contact” is the touching of the meeting of the object, not the contact of acquisition. The state of having touched

original: ārammaṇena samāgatassa cittassa bhāvo samphusitattaṃ. Yasmiṃ sati cittaṃ samphusitanti
analyzed: ārammaṇena samāgatassa cittassa bhāvaḥ samphusitattam yasmin sati cittam samphusitanti
translated: is the state of the consciousness that has met the object by touching. When this exists, consciousness is said to have touched.

original: vuccati, so tassa bhāvo. Evaṃ aññesupi bhāvaniddesesu daṭṭhabbaṃ.
analyzed: vuccati saḥ tassa bhāvaḥ evam aññesu pi bhāva niddesesu daṭṭhabbam
translated: This is its state. This is how it should be seen in the other descriptions of states as well.

original: Aparassa vevacanassa, aparena vā purimatthassa dīpanā aparadīpanā. “Paṇḍiccaṃ kosalla”nti
analyzed: aparassa vevacanassa aparena vā purima atthassa dīpanā apara dīpanā paṇḍiccam kosallanti
translated: The description of another is the description of another word or of another meaning of the preceding word. “Skill” and “cleverness” are

original: evamādayo paññāvisesā nānākāle labbhamānāpi ekasmiṃ citte labbhanti. Ekasmiñca visese
analyzed: evamādayo paññā visesāḥ nānā kāle labbhamānā api ekasmin citte labbhanti ekasmin ca visese
translated: Such special knowledges, though obtainable at different times, are obtainable in a single consciousness. And in a single special knowledge

original: itarepi anugatā hontīti dassetuṃ tathā vibhatti atthato vibhatti hoti atthanānattena
analyzed: itare api anugatāḥ honti iti dassetum tathā vibhatti atthataḥ vibhatti hoti attha nānattena
translated: the others are included. To show this, the analysis is a verbal analysis in the sense of the difference in meaning,

original: katattā. Atha vā yathā “kodho kujjhanā kujjhitatta”nti sabhāvākārabhāvaniddesehi🔽kodhoti evamākārova attho vutto, na evamidha, idha pana paṇḍitādibhāvākārabhinno
analyzed: katattā atha vā yathā kodhaḥ sabhāva ākāra bhāva niddesehi  kodho ti evam ākāraḥ eva attho vuttaḥ na evam idha idha pana paṇḍita ādi bhāva ākāra bhinno
translated: because the meaning is stated. Or just as in the case of the statement, “Anger is the state of being angry, the act of being angry, the fact of being angry,”

original: attho vuttoti idaṃ vibhattigamanaṃ atthavasena hoti. Samphusitattanti etthāpi na
analyzed: atthaḥ vutto ti idam vibhatti gamanam attha vasena hoti ettha api na
translated: the meaning is stated by the mode of the state of being, the mode of the act, and the mode of the fact, but not so here. Here the meaning is stated by the mode of the state of being, which is different from the mode of the act of being wise, etc. So the analysis is a verbal analysis in the sense of the difference in meaning.🔽As regards the phrase “because of the state of contact,” the meaning is not stated by the mode of the act of contacting,

original: “phasso”ti evamākārova attho vutto. Samphassoti evamākāro pana vuttoti atthato vibhattigamananti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: phasso ti evam ākāraḥ eva atthaḥ vutto samphassaḥ ti evam ākāraḥ pana vuttaḥ ti atthataḥ vibhatti gamanam ti vuttam
translated: but by the mode of the state of contact. So the analysis is a verbal analysis in the sense of the difference in meaning.

original: Doso byāpādoti uddesepi nāmanānattena nānābhūto uddiṭṭho. Niddesepi teneva nānattena
analyzed: dosaḥ byāpādaḥ ti uddese pi nāma nānattena nānābhūtaḥ uddiṭṭhaḥ niddese pi tena iva nānattena
translated: “Ill will, enmity” is stated in the description of the heading by the difference in name. In the description it is stated by the same difference in name.

original: niddiṭṭho. Ekova khandho hotīti ekena khandhasaddena vattabbataṃ sandhāyāha. Cetanāti
analyzed: niddiṭṭhaḥ ekaḥ iva khandhaḥ hoti iti ekena khandha saddena vattabba tam sandhāya āha cetanā iti
translated: It is a single aggregate. He says this with reference to the fact that it should be stated by a single aggregate word.

original: saṅkhārakkhandhaṃ dasseti tappamukhattā. Asaddhammāti asataṃ, asanto vā dhammā, na
analyzed: saṅkhāra kkhandham dasseti tad pamukha ttā asat dhammā ti asatam asantaḥ vā dhammā na
translated: He shows the formations aggregate, since that is the chief of the three. ‘Bad things’ are things that are not good or things that are not good,

original: vā saddhammāti asaddhammāti asaddhammavacanīyabhāvena ekībhūtopi asaddhammo kodhagarutādivisiṭṭhena
analyzed: vā saddhammā ati asaddhammā ati asaddhamma vacanīya bhāvena ekībhūtaḥ api asaddhammaḥ kodha garuta ādi visiṭṭhena
translated: not good things. ‘Bad things’ are bad things in the sense of being classed as bad things. But though classed as bad things, they are various because of the difference of their individual essences, which are distinguished by such things as being dominated by hate.

original: saddhammagarutāpaṭikkhepanānattena nānattaṃ gatoti “cattāro”ti vuttaṃ. Na saddhammagarutāti🔽vuccamānā vā asaddhammagarutā asaddhammagarutābhāvena ekībhūtāpi kodhādivisiṭṭhapaṭikkhepanānattena🔽nānattaṃ gatā. Paṭipakkho vā paṭikkhipīyati tena, sayaṃ vā paṭikkhipatīti paṭikkhepoti
analyzed: saddhamma garu tā paṭikkhepa nānattena nānattam gataḥ ti cattāro ti vuttam na saddhamma garu tā ti  vuccamānā vā asat dhamma garutā asat dhamma garuta abhāvena ekībhūtā api kodha ādi visiṭṭha paṭikkhepa nānattena  nānattam gatā paṭipakkhaḥ vā paṭikkhipīyati tena sayam vā paṭikkhipati iti paṭikkhepaḥ uti
translated: ‘Four’ is said because of the difference of their individual essences, which are distinguished by such things as being dominated by hate.🔽When they are told, ‘Do not be dominated by bad things,’ being dominated by bad things is classed as not being dominated by bad things. But though classed as not being dominated by bad things, it is various because of the difference of its individual essences, which are distinguished by such things as being dominated by hate.🔽Or alternatively, it is said to be ‘opposed’ because it is opposed by its opposite or because it opposes its opposite.

original: vuccatīti saddhammagarutāpaṭikkhepanānattena asaddhammagarutā asaddhammā vā nānattaṃ
analyzed: vuccati iti saddhamma garutā paṭikkhepa nānattena asat dhamma garutā asat dhammāḥ vā nānattam
translated: So being dominated by bad things is various because of the difference of its individual essences, which are distinguished by such things as being dominated by hate, or bad things are various.

original: gatā. Alobhotiādīnaṃ phassādīhi nānattaṃ lobhādivisiṭṭhena paṭikkhepena lobhādipaṭipakkhena
analyzed: gatāḥ alobho ti ādīnam phassa ādīhi nānattam lobha ādi visiṭṭhena paṭikkhepena lobha ādi paṭipakkhena
translated: ‘Non-greed’ and the rest are various because of the difference of their individual essences, which are distinguished by such things as being opposed to greed, and because of the difference of their individual essences, which are distinguished by such things as being opposed to greed.

original: vā veditabbaṃ. Alobhādosāmohānaṃ aññamaññanānattaṃ yathāvuttena paṭikkhepanānattena
analyzed: vā veditabbam a lobha a dosa a mohānam aññamañña nānattam yathā vuttena paṭikkhepa nānattena
translated: and the difference of the three kinds of feeling should be understood in the same way. The difference of the three kinds of non-greed, non-hate, and non-delusion should be construed in the same way as the difference of the three kinds of greed, etc., stated in the way already given.🔽The “meaning of the word” is the meaning of the word in another place.

original: yojetabbaṃ. Padatthassa padantarena vibhāvanaṃ padatthuti. Tena hi taṃ padaṃ mahatthanti🔽dīpitaṃ hoti alaṅkatañcāti. Atthavisesābhāvepi ābharaṇavasena ca ādaravasena ca puna🔽vacanaṃ daḷhīkammaṃ.
analyzed: yojetabbam padatthassa pada antarena vibhāvanam tena hi tam padam mahattham ti  dīpitam hoti alaṅkatam ca ati attha visesa abhāve pi ābharaṇa vasena ca ādara vasena ca punar  vacanam daḷhīkammam
translated: So that word is shown to have great meaning and to be an ornament and a favor.🔽Even though there is no difference in meaning, the repetition is a favor and a mark of respect.

original: 3. Tajjanti tassa phalassa anucchavikaṃ. Na kevalaṃ niddisiyamānaṃ sātameva adhikataṃ,
analyzed: tajjanti tassa phalassa anucchavikam na kevalam niddisiyamānam sātam eva adhikatam
translated: “In conformity with that”: in conformity with that fruit.🔽Not only what is being demonstrated is superior, but also the objects of the kinds of feeling as demonstrated.

original: atha kho yathāniddiṭṭhāni ārammaṇānipīti “tehi vā”tiādi vuttaṃ. Tassa vā jātā kāraṇabhāvena
analyzed: atha kho yathā niddiṭṭhāni ārammaṇāni pi iti tehi vā atiādi vuttam tassa vā jātā kāraṇa bhāvena
translated: So “by those” is said.🔽Or it is “agreeable” because it occurs as a cause for the arising of that fruit.

original: phassatthaṃ pavattāti tajjā. Taṃsamaṅgīpuggalaṃ, sampayuttadhamme vā attani sādayatīti
analyzed: phassa attham pavattā ati tad jā tad samaṅgī puggalam sampayutta dhamme vā attani sādayati iti
translated: It is “agreeable” because it places in itself the person who possesses it or the associated states.

original: sātaṃ da-kārassa ta-kāraṃ katvā. Suṭṭhu khādati, khaṇati vā dukkhanti sukhaṃ.
analyzed: sātam dakārassa takāram katvā suṭṭhu khādati khaṇati vā dukkhanti sukham
translated: It eats well, or it cuts off suffering, thus it is “pleasant” .

original: 5. Pāsoti rāgapāso. So hi nirāvaraṇattā antalikkhacaro. Akusalampi paṇḍaranti vuttaṃ,
analyzed: pāso ti rāgapāso so hi nirāvaraṇa ttā antalikkha caraḥ akusalam pi paṇḍaran ti vuttam
translated: The meaning intended is that it is said to be white though unwholesome,

original: ko pana vādo kusalanti adhippāyo. Tañhi paṇḍarato nikkhantaṃ sayañca paṇḍaranti.
analyzed: kaḥ pana vādaḥ kusalanti adhippāyo tat hi paṇḍarataḥ nikkhantam sayam ca paṇḍaranti
translated: how much more so when it is wholesome. For that is white since it has come from the white and it is white in itself.

original: Atha vā sabbampi cittaṃ sabhāvato paṇḍarameva, āgantukopakkilesavodānehi pana sāvajjānavajjānaṃ🔽upakkiliṭṭhavisuddhataratā hontīti. Dāruppamāṇesu silādīsu khandhapaññattiyā abhāvā
analyzed: atha vā sabbam pi cittam sabhāvato paṇḍaram eva āgantu kopa kilesa vodānehi pana  honti iti dāru ppamāṇesu silā ādīsu khandha paññattiyāḥ abhāvā
translated: Or alternatively, all consciousness is white in its individual essence, but it is blameworthy or blameless according to the adventitious defilements or the purification that occur in association with it.🔽And it is more or less pure according to whether the defilements or the purification are strong or weak.🔽As regards the similes of the log and the rest, since there is no description of the aggregates in terms of the khandhas,

original: kiñci nimittaṃ anapekkhitvā dārumhi pavattā khandhapaññattīti “paṇṇattimattaṭṭhenā”ti
analyzed: kiñci nimittam an apekkhitvā dārumhi pavattā khandha paññatti iti paṇṇattimatta ṭṭhena ati
translated: the description of the log is given without any reference to a sign.

original: vuttaṃ. Taṃ-saddena manoviññāṇadhātuyeva vucceyya niddisitabbattāti na tassā tajjatā.
analyzed: vuttam tad saddena manaḥ viññāṇa dhātuyā iva vucceyya niddisitabba ttā ati na tassā tajja tā
translated: The word “that” refers only to the mind-consciousness element, which is what is demonstrated, so it is not the appropriate state of consciousness.

original: Tehi ārammaṇehi jātā tajjāti ca vuccamāne samphassajatā na vattabbā. Na hi so ārammaṇaṃ,
analyzed: tehi ārammaṇehi jātā tajjāti ca vuccamāne samphassa ja tā na vattabbā na hi saḥ ārammaṇam
translated: And if it were said that it is born of those objects, it would not be called born of contact. For that is not an object,

original: nāpi visesapaccayo. “Tiṇṇaṃ saṅgati phasso”ti viññāṇameva phassassa visesapaccayoti
analyzed: na api visesa paccayaḥ phasso ti viññāṇam eva phassassa visesa paccayaḥ ti
translated: nor is it a specific condition. For it is said, “Contact is the coming together of the three” . Consciousness is the specific condition for contact.

original: vuttoti tasmā na viññāṇaṃ visesapaccayabhūtaṃ samphassajatāya tajjāmanoviññāṇadhātusamphassajāpaññattiṃ
analyzed: vuttaḥ ti tasmā na viññāṇam visesa paccaya bhūtam samphassa ja tāya tad jā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu samphassa jā paññattim
translated: Therefore consciousness is not called “born of contact associated with the mind” because it is a condition for the feeling,

original: labhati, na ca tadeva tassa kāraṇabhāvena phalabhāvena ca vuccamānaṃ suviññeyyaṃ🔽hotīti. Kiṃ vā etena, yathā bhagavatā vuttā taṃsabhāvāyeva te dhammāti na evaṃvidhesu
analyzed: labhati na ca tat eva tassa kāraṇa bhāvena phala bhāvena ca vuccamānam su viññeyyam  hoti iti kim vā etena yathā bhagavatā vuttā taṃsa bhāvāya iva te dhammā ati na evaṃvidhesu
translated: and it is not easy to understand that it is both the cause and the fruit.

original: kāraṇaṃ maggitabbaṃ.
analyzed: kāraṇam maggitabbam
translated: Or what is the use of this? They should not seek a reason in the way that these things have been stated to have such and such a nature by the Blessed One.🔽This is the purport: “By the method of reasoning accepted in the world.”

original: 7. Evaṃ takkanavasena lokasiddhenāti adhippāyo. Evañcevañca bhavitabbanti vividhaṃ takkanaṃ kūpe viya udakassa ārammaṇassa ākaḍḍhanaṃ vitakkanaṃ.
analyzed: evam takkana vasena loka siddhena ati adhippāyaḥ evam ca ivam ca bhavitabban ti vividham takkanam kūpe viya udakassa ārammaṇassa ākaḍḍhanam vitakkanam
translated: “It should be thus and thus”: the various kinds of reasoning are called “applied thought” because they are the apprehending of the object, like water in a well.

original: 8. Samantato caraṇaṃ vicaraṇaṃ.
analyzed: samantataḥ caraṇam vicaraṇam
translated: “Sustained thought” is the continued occurrence of that.

original: 9. Attamanatāti ettha atta-saddena na cittaṃ vuttaṃ. Na hi cittassa mano atthīti.
analyzed: atta mana tā ati ettha atta saddena na cittam vuttam na hi cittassa manaḥ atthi iti
translated: “Gladness” : here the word atta is not used in the sense of citta . For there is no mano in citta .

original: Attamanassa pana puggalassa bhāvo attamanatāti vatvā puna puggaladiṭṭhinisedhanatthaṃ
analyzed: atta manassa pana puggalassa bhāvaḥ atta mana tā ti vatvā puna puggala diṭṭhi nisedhana attham
translated: But the state of one whose mind is glad is called attamanatā . Having said this, in order to refute the view of a person,

original: “cittassā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: cittassa iti vuttam
translated: he says “of consciousness” .

original: 11. Na balavatī, kasmā avaṭṭhiti vuttāti? Ekaggacittena pāṇavadhādikaraṇe tathā avaṭṭhānamattabhāvato.
analyzed: na balavatī kasmai avaṭṭhiti vuttā ati ekagga cittena pāṇa vadha ādi karaṇe tathā avaṭṭhāna matta bhāvato
translated: Why is it said that the non-occurrence of the thought of killing, etc., is not due to strength? Because there is no occurrence of such a thought in one whose mind is concentrated.

original: Virūpaṃ, vividhaṃ vā saṃharaṇaṃ vikiraṇaṃ visāhāro, saṃharaṇaṃ vā sampiṇḍanaṃ, tadabhāvo visāhāro.
analyzed: virūpam vividham vā saṃharaṇam vikiraṇam visāhāraḥ saṃharaṇam vā sampiṇḍanam tad abhāvaḥ visāhāraḥ
translated: “Dispersal” is the scattering or dispersing of what is collected or accumulated, or the non-collecting or accumulating of what is scattered or dispersed.

original: 12. Aññasmiṃ pariyāyeti aññasmiṃ kāraṇe. Samānādhikaraṇabhāvo dvinnaṃ bahūnaṃ vā padānaṃ ekasmiṃ atthe pavatti.
analyzed: aññasmin pariyāya iti aññasmin kāraṇe samāna adhikaraṇa bhāvaḥ dvinnam bahūnam vā padānam ekasmin atthe pavatti
translated: “In another way” means in another reason. The occurrence of two or more words in one meaning is called “co-reference.”

original: 13. Ārambhati cāti āpajjati ca. Uddhaṃ yamanaṃ uyyāmo. Dhuranti nipphādetuṃ āraddhaṃ kusalaṃ, paṭiññaṃ vā.
analyzed: ārambhati ca ati āpajjati ca uddham yamanam uyyāmaḥ dhuranti nipphādetum āraddham kusalam paṭiññam vā
translated: “He undertakes and begins” means he commits and commences. “Exertion” is the effort to produce. “The wholesome that is begun” is the wholesome that is commenced or the undertaking.

original: 14. Tiṇṇanti buddhādīnaṃ. Citte ārammaṇassa upaṭṭhānaṃ jotanañca satiyevāti tassā etaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: tiṇṇam ti buddha ādīnam citte ārammaṇassa upaṭṭhānam jotanam ca satiyā eva ati tassāḥ etam lakkhaṇaṃ
translated: “The three” are the Buddha, etc. The characteristic of mindfulness is the manifestation and illumination of the object in the mind.

original: 16. Pāsāṇasakkharavālikādirahitā bhūmi saṇhāti “saṇhaṭṭhenā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: pāsāṇa sakkhara vālikā ādi rahitā bhūmi saṇhā ti saṇha aṭṭhena ati vuttam
translated: “Smooth” is the ground that is free from stones, potsherds, sand, etc. “Smoothness” is said to be the smoothness of the ground.

original: 19. Ayantīti ekakammanibbattamanussādisantatiavicchedavasena pavattanti. Kusalākusalesupi
analyzed: ayanti iti eka kamma nibbatta manussa ādi santati aviccheda vasena pavattanti kusala akusalesu pi
translated: “Flowing” means occurring in an unbroken continuity of human beings, etc., produced by a single kamma.

original: hi jīvitaṃ indriyapaccayabhāvena sampayutte pavattayamānameva tadavicchedassa paccayo hoti.
analyzed: hi jīvitam indriya paccaya bhāvena sampayutte pavattayamānam eva tad avicchedassa paccayaḥ hoti
translated: for life is a condition for the faculties by conascence condition only while it is occurring.

original: 30. Yaṃ hirīyatīti hirīyati-saddena vutto bhāvo yaṃ-saddena vuccatīti yanti bhāvanapuṃsakaṃ vā etaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Hiriyitabbenāti ca hetuatthe karaṇavacanaṃ yujjati.
analyzed: yam hirīyati iti hirīyati saddena vuttaḥ bhāvaḥ yaṃsaddena vuccati iti yanti bhāva napuṃsakam vā etam daṭṭhabbam hiriyitabbena ati ca hetu atthe karaṇa vacanam yujjati
translated: The state spoken of by the word hirīyati is spoken of by the word yanti. Or the word yanti should be regarded as a neuter noun formed with the suffix -an. And it is proper to take the word hirīyati as a gerund in the sense of cause.

original: 32. Alubbhanakavasenāti ettha alubbhanameva alubbhanakanti bhāvaniddeso daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: alubbhanaka vasena āti ettha alubbhanam eva alubbhanakanti bhāva niddeso daṭṭhabbo
translated: By the word alubbhanakavasena, the word alubbhanaka should be regarded as a noun formed with the suffix -aka in the sense of cause.

original: 33. Abyāpajjoti byāpādena dukkhena domanassasaṅkhātena dosena viya na byāpādetabbotipi attho yujjati.🔽42-43. Thinamiddhādipaṭipakkhabhāvena kusaladhamme aniccādimanasikāre ca sīghaṃ sīghaṃ🔽parivattanasamatthatā lahupariṇāmatā, avijjānīvaraṇānañhi taṇhāsaṃyojanānaṃ sattānaṃ
analyzed: a byāpajjaḥ ti byāpādena dukkhena domanassa saṅkhātena dosena viya na byāpādetabbaḥ iti pi atthaḥ yujjati  thinam iddha ādi paṭipakkha bhāvena kusala dhamme anicca ādi manasikāre ca sīgham sīgham  parivattana samattha tā lahu pariṇāma tā avijjā nīvaraṇānam hi taṇhā saṃyojanānam sattānam
translated: The meaning “not to be oppressed by” is also proper, by which is meant: not to be oppressed by the hate called grief and sorrow which is called oppression by suffering.

original: akusalappavatti pakatibhūtāti na tattha lahupariṇāmatāya attho. Tesañca bhāvo garutāyevāti
analyzed: akusala ppavatti pakati bhūtā ati na tattha lahu pariṇāma tāya atthaḥ tesam ca bhāvaḥ garu tāya iva ati
translated: The state of being able to turn quickly to wholesome states and to the bringing to mind of impermanence, etc., by way of the opposite of stiffness and torpor, etc., is quick-wittedness. For the occurrence of unwholesome states is natural to beings whose ignorance and obscuration are fettered by craving. So there is no need for quick-wittedness there. And the state of being that is there is dullness.

original: tabbidhurasabhāvānaṃ lahutā daṭṭhabbā. Sā hi pavattamānā sīghaṃ bhavaṅgavuṭṭhānassa paccayo hoti.
analyzed: tad bidhu rasa bhāvānam lahu tā daṭṭhabbā sā hi pavattamānā sīgham bhavaṅga vuṭṭhānassa paccayaḥ hoti
translated: and lightness should be regarded as the state of being ready for the occurrence of the state of being light. For that, occurring, is a condition for the quick emergence from the life-continuum.

original: 44-45. Ye ca dhammā mohasampayuttā viya avipannalahutā, tesañca kusalakaraṇe appaṭighāto mudutā. Appaṭighātena mudutādirūpasadisatāya arūpadhammānampi mudutā maddavatātiādi vuttaṃ.
analyzed: ye ca dhammā moha sampayuttāḥ viya avipanna lahu tā tesam ca kusala karaṇe appaṭighātaḥ mudu tā appaṭighātena mudu tā ādi rūpa sadisa tāya arūpa dhammānam pi mudu tā maddava tā atiādi vuttaṃ
translated: And the non-resistance in the profitable should be regarded as malleability in the sense of the non-resistance of the states associated with delusion, which are as if they were not separated from malleability. And because of the non-resistance, malleability, etc., are said to be “like materiality” in the immaterial states.

original: 46-47. Sinehavasena kilinnaṃ atimudukaṃ cittaṃ akammaññaṃ hoti vilīnaṃ viya suvaṇṇaṃ,🔽mānādivasena atithaddhañca atāpitaṃ viya suvaṇṇaṃ, yaṃ panānurūpamudutāyuttaṃ, taṃ
analyzed: sineha vasena kilinnam ati mudukam cittam akammaññam hoti vilīnam viya suvaṇṇam  māna ādi vasena a tāpitam viya suvaṇṇam yam tam
translated: When the mind is slack through being sodden with attachment, it is unworkable, like gold that is overheated,🔽and when it is over-exerted through conceit, etc., it is unworkable, like gold that is over-cleansed. But when it is malleable in the right proportion,

original: kammaññaṃ hoti yuttamaddavaṃ viya suvaṇṇaṃ. Tasseva mudukassa yo kammaññākāro, sā
analyzed: kammaññam hoti yuttamaddavam viya suvaṇṇam tassa iva mudukassa yaḥ kammaññā ākāraḥ sā
translated: it is workable, like gold that is rightly malleable. And the workable state of that malleable mind is

original: kammaññatāti mudutāvisiṭṭhā kammaññatā veditabbā.
analyzed: kammañña tā ati mudu tā visiṭṭhā kammañña tā veditabbā
translated: workableness. Workableness should be understood as the workable state of malleability.

original: 50-51. Paccosakkanabhāvena pavattaṃ akusalameva paccosakkanaṃ. Ekavīsati anesanā
analyzed: paccosakkana bhāvena pavattam akusalam eva paccosakkanam ekavīsati anesanā
translated: The unprofitableness that occurs through the state of being intractable is unworkableness. The twenty-one kinds of unreasoned attention

original: nāma vejjakammaṃ karoti, dūtakammaṃ karoti, pahiṇakammaṃ karoti, gaṇḍaṃ phāleti,🔽arumakkhanaṃ deti, uddhaṃvirecanaṃ deti, adhovirecanaṃ deti, natthutelaṃ pacati,
analyzed: nāma vejja kammam karoti dūta kammam karoti pahiṇa kammam karoti gaṇḍam phāleti  arumakkhanam deti uddhaṃvirecanam deti adhovirecanam deti natthu telam pacati
translated: He acts as a doctor, he acts as a messenger, he acts as an intermediary, he opens up abscesses,🔽he gives oil for the nose, he gives an upper purgative, he gives a lower purgative, he cooks oil for the eyes,

original: cakkhutelaṃ pacati, veḷudānaṃ deti, paṇṇadānaṃ deti, pupphadānaṃ deti, phaladānaṃ🔽deti, sinānadānaṃ deti, dantakaṭṭhadānaṃ deti, mukhodakadānaṃ deti, cuṇṇadānaṃ deti,
analyzed: cakkhu telam pacati veḷu dānam deti paṇṇa dānam deti puppha dānam deti phala dānam  deti sināna dānam deti danta kaṭṭha dānam deti mukha udaka dānam deti cuṇṇa dānam deti
translated: he gives a gift of bamboo, he gives a gift of leaves, he gives a gift of flowers, he gives a gift of fruits,🔽he gives a gift of bathing, he gives a tooth cleaner, he gives water for the mouth, he gives a gift of powder,

original: mattikādānaṃ deti, cāṭukakammaṃ karoti, muggasūpiyaṃ, pāribhaṭyaṃ, jaṅghapesaniyaṃ
analyzed: mattikā dānam deti cāṭuka kammam karoti muggasūpiyam pāribhaṭyam jaṅghapesaniyam
translated: he gives a gift of clay, he acts as a go-between, he acts as a matchmaker, he acts as a middleman for a bride and bridegroom,

original: dvāvīsatimaṃ dūtakammena sadisaṃ, tasmā ekavīsati. Cha agocarā vesiyāgocaro, vidhavā,
analyzed: dvāvīsatimam dūta kammena sadisam tasmai ekavīsati cha agocarā vesiyā agocaraḥ vidhavā
translated: The twenty-second is similar to acting as a messenger. Therefore there are twenty-one. The six improper resorts: the resort of a prostitute, the resort of a widow,

original: thullakumārī, paṇḍaka, pānāgāra, bhikkhunīagocaroti. Saṅkhepatoti sarūpena anuddiṭṭhattā
analyzed: thulla kumārī paṇḍaka pānāgāra bhikkhunī agocaraḥ ti saṅkhepato ti sarūpena an uddiṭṭha ttā
translated: the resort of a stout young woman, the resort of a paṇḍaka, the resort of a liquor shop, the resort of a bhikkhunī. In brief: because it is not specified in the same way,

original: “tattha katamo chando”tiādi na sakkā vattunti “yo chando chandikatā”tiādiniddesaṃ
analyzed: tattha katamo chando tiādi na sakkā vattunti yo
translated: “What is will?” and so on cannot be said. Therefore the explanation

original: saṅkhipitvā “ye vā panā”ti niddeso katoti attho.
analyzed: saṅkhipitvā ye vā pana ati niddeso kato ti attho
translated: The words “or any other” are a brief indication.

original: Niddesavārakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: niddesa vāra kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section on the brief explanation is finished.

original: Koṭṭhāsavāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: koṭṭhāsa vāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The section on the detailed explanation

original: 58-120. Niddesavāre pucchādīnaṃ paccekaṃ anekattepi pucchādibhāvena ekattaṃ upanetvā🔽catuparicchedatā vuttā. Cattāro dveti evamādikaṃ saṅkhipitvā saha vā gahaṇaṃ saṅgaho.
analyzed: niddesa vāre puccha ādīnam paccekam anekatte pi puccha ādi bhāvena ekattam upanetvā  catu pariccheda tā vuttā cattāraḥ dve iti evam ādikam saṅkhipitvā saha vā gahaṇam saṅgahaḥ
translated: In the section on the brief explanation, although there are many different kinds of questions, etc., they are all included in the single category of questions, etc.

original: Ṭhapetvā yevāpanaketi saṅgahetabbe sandhāya vuttaṃ. Te hi visuṃ visuṃ uddiṭṭhattā
analyzed: ṭhapetvā yevāpanakā iti saṅgahetabbe sandhāya vuttam te hi visum visum uddiṭṭha ttā
translated: The fourfold division is stated by way of the fourfold division of questions, etc., and by way of the twofold division of questions, etc. The fourfold division of questions, etc., is stated by way of the fourfold division of questions, etc., as follows: “four, two,” etc. The twofold division of questions, etc., is stated by way of the twofold division of questions, etc., as follows: “together with inclusion, inclusion.”🔽The words “except for the exception” are said with reference to those that are to be included. For they are to be included because they are scattered, being mentioned separately

original: niddiṭṭhattā ca vippakiṇṇāti saṅgahetabbā honti, na yevāpanakā saṅgahagamaneneva
analyzed: niddiṭṭha ttā ca vippakiṇṇā ati saṅgahetabbāḥ honti na yevāpanakā saṅgaha gamanena iva
translated: and being indicated separately. The exception is not to be included because it is not scattered, being included in the inclusion itself.

original: tathā avippakiṇṇattā. Yasmā pana saṅkhārakkhandhapariyāpannā honti, tasmā taṃniddese🔽akhandhabhāvanivāraṇatthaṃ yevāpanātveva vuttāti na yevāpanakā ṭhapetabbāti. Paccayasaṅkhātenāti
analyzed: tathā a vippakiṇṇa ttā yasmā pana saṅkhāra khandha pariyāpannāḥ honti tasmā tad niddese  akhandha bhāva nivāraṇa attham yevāpanā tu eva vuttā ati na yevāpanakā ṭhapetabbā ati paccaya saṅkhātena ati
translated: But since it is included in the aggregate of mental formations, in the brief indication of that aggregate🔽it is said to be “an exception” in order to prevent it from being included in the aggregate.

original: āhārapaccayasaṅkhātenāti vuttaṃ hoti. Atha vā “hetu paccayo”ti etesu dvīsu janako
analyzed: āhāra paccaya saṅkhātena ati vuttam hoti atha vā hetu paccayo ti etesu dvīsu janakaḥ
translated: By way of the designation “condition” means by way of the designation “nutriment condition.” Or alternatively, in the two phrases “cause condition” and “nutriment condition,” the word “condition” is a collective term for the four kinds of conditions.

original: hetu upatthambhako paccayoti evaṃ visesavantesu paccayasaṅkhātena. Yathā hi kabaḷīkārāhāro
analyzed: hetu upatthambhako paccayo ti evam visesavantesu paccaya saṅkhātena yathā hi kabaḷīkāra āhāro
translated: and the condition called “support” is the cause.🔽Just as physical nutriment supports the material body by taking away the deficiency of material form,

original: ojaṭṭhamakarūpāharaṇena rūpakāyaṃ upatthambheti, evamimepi vedanādiāharaṇena nāmakāyanti.
analyzed: oja ṭṭhamaka rūpa āharaṇena rūpa kāyam upatthambheti evam ime api vedanā ādi āharaṇena nāmakāyanti
translated: so these four support the mental body by taking away the deficiency of feeling, etc.

original: Tathā ca hontīti sādhāraṇe sahajātādipaccaye sandhāyāha. Aññathā cāti aññena ca ekenākārena🔽paccayā hontiyevāti āhārāti vuccantīti attho. Tasmā āharaṇakiccarahitānaṃ hetuadhipatiādīnaṃ
analyzed: tathā ca honti iti sādhāraṇe sahajāta ādi paccaye sandhāya āha aññathā ca ati aññena ca ekena ākārena  paccayāḥ hontiyā eva ati āhārā ati vuccanti iti attho tasmai āharaṇa kicca rahitānam hetu adhipati ādīnam
translated: And they are so in the sense of the general conditions such as conascence, etc.,” he says. “Otherwise” means that they are conditions in another way,🔽in the sense of cause, predominance, etc., and they are called nutriments.🔽So there is no question of the cause, predominance, etc., which are devoid of the function of taking away deficiency, being nutriments.

original: natthi āhārabhāvappasaṅgo. Tisso ca vedanā āharatītiādi yathāsambhavavasena vuttaṃ,
analyzed: natthi āhāra bhāva pasaṅgo tissaḥ ca vedanāḥ āharati itiādi yathā sambhava vasena vuttam
translated: And the statement “The three kinds of feeling take on nutriment” is made according to the way in which it is possible,🔽not in this single consciousness by way of contact, etc.

original: na imasmiṃyeva citte phassādivasena. Tayo ca bhaveti kāmādibhavabhūtaṃ viññāṇaṃ visesena,
analyzed: na imasmin yeva citte phassa ādi vasena ca bhava iti kāma ādi bhava bhūtam viññāṇam visesena
translated: And the statement “The three kinds of becoming” refers to the consciousness that is the basis of sense-desire becoming, etc., in particular,

original: avisesena ca pañcupādānakkhandhe.
analyzed: avisesena ca pañca upādānakkhandhe
translated: and to the five aggregates as objects of clinging in general.

original: Ārammaṇaṃ upagantvā nijjhāyanaṃ cintanaṃ upanijjhāyanaṃ. Hetvaṭṭhenāti upāyatthena,
analyzed: ārammaṇam upagantvā nijjhāyanam cintanam upanijjhāyanam hetu aṭṭhena ati upāya tthena
translated: “Reflection” is the pondering of an object that has been taken up. “By way of cause” means by way of means.

original: na mūlatthena. Pubbabhāge gato paṭipanno nānākkhaṇiko aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo lokuttarakkhaṇeva
analyzed: na mūla atthena pubba bhāge gataḥ paṭipannaḥ nānākkhaṇikaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ lokuttara kkhaṇā iva
translated: not in the primary sense. The path that has gone in the prior stage is the eight-factored path that is not simultaneous with the supramundane path.🔽It is called “gone as the path” because it has arisen together with the path.

original: saha pavatto yathāgatamaggoti vutto. Vipassanākkhaṇato pubbeva kāyakammādīnaṃ suparisuddhatāya
analyzed: saha pavattaḥ yathāgata maggaḥ ti vuttaḥ vipassanā khaṇato pubbā iva kāya kamma ādīnam su parisuddha tāya
translated: Because bodily action, etc., are very pure even before the moment of insight,

original: aṭṭhaṅgikamaggupanissayassa “ariyo aṭṭhaṅgiko maggo bhāvanāpāripūriṃ gacchatī”ti
analyzed: aṭṭhaṅgika magga upanissayassa ariyaḥ aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ maggaḥ bhāvanā pāripūrim gacchati iti
translated: the condition for the eight-factored path is said to be fulfilled by the development of the noble eight-factored path.

original: evaṃ vuttena pariyāyena pubbabhāgamaggassa aṭṭhaṅgikatā yathāgatavacanena dīpitā,
analyzed: evam vuttena pariyāyena pubbabhāga maggassa aṭṭhaṅgika tā yathāgata vacanena dīpitā
translated: Thus the eight-factoredness of the path in the prior stage is shown by the words “gone as the path” in the indirect sense,

original: na ekakkhaṇe aṭṭhannaṃ aṅgānaṃ sabbhāvāti evamassapi pariyāyadesanatā veditabbā.
analyzed: na eka kkhaṇe aṭṭhannam aṅgānam sabbhāvā ti evam assa api pariyāya desana tā veditabbā
translated: not in the sense of the existence of the eight factors in a single moment. This is how the indirect teaching should be understood in this case.

original: Vijānanameva cittavicittatāti “cittavicittaṭṭhena ekova dhammo viññāṇakkhandho”ti
analyzed: vijānanam eva citta vicitta tā ti citta vicitta ṭṭhena ekaḥ iva dhammo viññāṇa kkhandho ti
translated: Consciousness itself is the variety of consciousness. Therefore it is said: “The variety of consciousness is one idea, the consciousness aggregate.”

original: āha. Cattāro khandhā hontītiādīsu vedanākkhandhādīnaṃ saṅgahe katepi puna “eko vedanākkhandho
analyzed: āha cattāro khandhāḥ honti iti ādīsu vedanā khandha ādīnam saṅgahe kate api punar ekaḥ vedanā khandho
translated: In the passage beginning “There are four aggregates” , although the aggregates of feeling, etc., are included, the statement “There is one aggregate of feeling” ,

original: hotī”tiādivacanaṃ na aneke vedanākkhandhādayo jātiniddesena idha vuttāti dassanatthaṃ.
analyzed: hoti iti ādi vacanam na aneke vedanā khandha ādayaḥ jāti niddesena idha vuttā ati dassana ttham
translated: etc., is made again in order to show that the aggregates of feeling, etc., are not many, since they are mentioned here by their individual names.

original: Indriyesu ca ekassa jātiniddesabhāve paṭikkhitte aññesaṃ indriyānaṃ āhārādīnañca
analyzed: indriyesu ca ekassa jāti niddesa bhāve paṭikkhitte aññesam indriyānaṃ āhāra ādīnaṃ ca
translated: And when the description of the kind of eye faculty is rejected, the rejection of the other faculties and of the kinds of nutriment, etc., is also made.

original: tappaṭikkhepo kato hotīti pubbaṅgamassa manindriyasseva katoti daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: tad paṭikkhepaḥ kataḥ hoti iti pubbaṅgamassa man indriyassa iva kataḥ iti daṭṭhabbaḥ
translated: So it should be regarded as made only of the mental faculty as the first.

original: Koṭṭhāsavāravaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Suññatavāravaṇṇanā
analyzed: koṭṭhāsa vāra vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  suññata vāra vaṇṇanā
translated: The section on the “part” is finished.

original: 121-145. Etthāti etasmiṃ yathāvutte samaye, etesu vā dhammesu. Bhāvoti satto, yo koci vā attho.
analyzed: ettha ati etasmin yathā vutte samaye etesu vā dhammesu bhāvo ti satto yaḥ koci vā attho
translated: Herein, at this time thus described, or in these ideas. Being: a being, or any meaning.

original: Dutiyacittādivaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya citta ādi vaṇṇanā
translated: The second kind of consciousness, etc.,

original: 146. Sappayogenāti līnassa cittassa ussāhanapayogasahitena. Saupāyenāti kusalassa karaṇākaraṇesu ādīnavānisaṃsapaccavekkhaṇaṃ parehi ussāhananti evamādiupāyasahitena.
analyzed: sa ppayogena ati līnassa cittassa ussāhana payoga sahitena sa upāyena ati kusalassa karaṇa akaraṇesu ādīnava anisaṃsa paccavekkhaṇam parehi ussāhanam ti evamādi upāya sahitena
translated: With prompting: with prompting to rouse up sluggish consciousness. With means: with the means consisting in reflection on the drawbacks and on the benefits in the cases of things to be done and not to be done, and with prompting by others, and so on.

original: 156-159. Mahāaṭṭhakathāyaṃ anuññātā nātisamāhitāya bhāvanāyāti yevāpanakehipi nibbisesataṃ dasseti.
analyzed: mahā aṭṭhakathā ayam anuññātā na ati samāhitāya bhāvanāya ati yevāpanakehi pi nibbisesa tam dasseti
translated: In the Great Commentary the “kind of development that is not too much in absorption” is allowed. He shows that it is not exclusive of the kinds with prompting and with means.

original: Puññakiriyavatthādikathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The section on the “bases for making merit,” etc.,

original: Apaciti eva apacitisahagataṃ puññakiriyāvatthu yathā “nandirāgasahagatā”ti. Apaciti
analyzed: apaciti eva apaciti sahagatam puñña kiriyā vatthu yathā nandi rāga sahagatā ati apaciti
translated: The “base for making merit consisting in giving accompanied by consolation” is like that “accompanied by joy and gladness” .

original: vā cetanāsampayuttakadhammā kāyavacīkiriyā vā, taṃsahitā cetanā apacitisahagataṃ.
analyzed: vā cetanā sampayuttaka dhammā kāya vacī kiriyā vā tad sahitā cetanā apaciti sahagatam
translated: Or else, the volition associated with the consciousness that is the basis for the act of giving, or the bodily and verbal formations that accompany that volition, together with the volition, are “accompanied by non-remorse.”

original: Hitapharaṇenāti desake mettāpharaṇena, “evaṃ me hitaṃ bhavissatī”ti pavattena hitacittena
analyzed: hita pharaṇena ati desake mettā pharaṇena evam me hitam bhavissati iti pavattena hita cittena
translated: “By the pervasion of good will”: by the pervasion of loving-kindness on the part of the giver, or by the thought of good will that occurs thus, “May this be for his welfare.”

original: vā. Kammassakatāñāṇaṃ diṭṭhijukammaṃ. Niyamalakkhaṇanti mahapphalatāniyamassa lakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: vā kammassaka tā ñāṇam diṭṭhi ju kammam niyama lakkhaṇan ti mahat phala tā niyamassa lakkhaṇaṃ
translated: The knowledge of the ownership of kamma is the “plow of view.” The characteristic of the “plow” is the characteristic of the certainty of great fruit.

original: Sīlamaye saṅgahaṃ gacchanti cārittavasena. Anavajjavatthuṃ pariccajanto viya abbhanumodamānopi
analyzed: sīla maye saṅgaham gacchanti cāritta vasena anavajja vatthum pariccajantaḥ viya
translated: They are included in virtue in the sense of conduct.

original: parassa sampattiyā modatīti abbhanumodanā dānamaye saṅgahitā. Bhāventopīti asamattabhāvanaṃ🔽sandhāyāha. Samattā hi appanā hotīti. Aṭṭheva koṭṭhāse katvāti ekassa sattassa ekasmiṃ🔽khaṇe uppannamekaṃ paṭhamacittaṃ dassetvā aññāni tādisāni adassentena sabbāni tāni
analyzed: parassa sampattiyā modati iti abbhanumodanā dāna maye saṅgahitā bhāventaḥ api iti asamatta bhāvanam  sandhāya āha samattā hi appanā hoti iti aṭṭha iva koṭṭhāse katvā ati ekassa sattassa ekasmin  khaṇe uppannam ekam paṭhamacittam dassetvā aññāni tādisāni a dassentena sabbāni tāni
translated: Just as one who gives up a blameless object of enjoyment rejoices in giving it, so too one who rejoices in another’s excellence gives it up in oneself.🔽“By the state of identification”: he says this referring to the non-identification of the jhānas, for the jhānas are identified with absorption.🔽Having made them into eight sections: having shown the first consciousness that arises in a single moment in a single being, and having not shown the others, all those are made one by the similarity of their mode of occurrence.

original: sarikkhaṭṭhena ekīkatāni honti, tathā sesānipīti evaṃ aṭṭha katvā.
analyzed: ekīkatāni honti tathā sesāni pi iti evam aṭṭha katvā
translated: And so too the rest.

original: Kāmāvacarakusalavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kāmāvacara kusala vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The profitable of the sense sphere has now been dealt with.

original: Rūpāvacarakusalaṃ
analyzed: rūpāvacara kusalam
translated: The profitable of the fine-material sphere

original: Catukkanayo
analyzed: catur kanayaḥ
translated: The method in fours

original: Paṭhamajjhānakathāvaṇṇanā🔽160. Uttarapadalopaṃ katvā rūpabhavo rūpanti vutto. Jhānassa amaggabhāvepi sati maggavacanaṃ🔽aññamaggabhāvanivāraṇatthanti imasmiṃ atthe maggaggahaṇassa payojanaṃ vuttaṃ, na
analyzed: uttara pada lopam katvā rūpa bhavaḥ rūpam ti vuttaḥ jhānassa amagga bhāve pi sati magga vacanam  añña magga bhāva nivāraṇa attham ti imasmin atthe magga ggahaṇassa payojanam vuttam na
translated: The first jhana🔽The word “fine-material” is used for the fine-material sphere by dropping the last syllable of the name of the sphere. The reason why the path is mentioned in the clause “The profitable of the fine-material sphere is the profitable associated with the path” is stated in the words “in order to preclude the path’s being a development” .

original: sabbassa kusalajjhānassa maggabhāvoti. Tattha maggassa bhāvanāya samayavavatthānassa
analyzed: sabbassa kusala jjhānassa magga bhāvo ti tattha maggassa bhāvanāya samaya vavatthānassa
translated: But it is not stated in order to show that all profitable jhana is a path.

original: katattā amaggabhāvanāsamaye pavattānaṃ phassādīnaṃ kusalabhāvo na dassito siyā, tasmā🔽sabbassa maggabhāvo dassetabboti. Ito añño maggo natthīti evaṃ aññabhūmikavidhuro
analyzed: kata ttā amagga bhāvanā samaye pavattānam phassa ādīnam kusala bhāvaḥ na dassitaḥ siyā tasmā  sabbassa magga bhāvo dassetabbo ti itas aññaḥ maggaḥ natthi iti evam añña bhūmika vidhuraḥ
translated: For since the path is a development, the time for it is defined, and so it might be thought that the profitable of the fine-material sphere that occurs at a time when there is no development of the path is not profitable.🔽So it is stated in order to show that all of it is profitable.🔽It should be understood that the path is called “all” in the sense of the fruition of the profitable, just as the fruition of the profitable is called “all” in the sense of the kind of states that cause rebirth in the fine-material sphere, like the kind of states that have the nature of fruition.

original: sati paccayantare rūpūpapattijanakasabhāvo vipākadhammasabhāvo viya vipākadhammavasena
analyzed: sati paccaya antare rūpa upapatti janaka sabhāvaḥ vipāka dhamma sabhāvaḥ viya vipāka dhamma vasena
translated: The meaning is that there is no other path than this.

original: sabbasamāno maggasaddena vuttoti dassetīti veditabbaṃ. Kusalaṃ dānanti alobho daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: sabba samānaḥ magga saddena vuttaḥ ti dasseti iti veditabbam kusalam dānam ti alobhaḥ daṭṭhabbo
translated: The profitable is generosity: non-greed should be understood.

original: Atha vā cetanā dānaṃ, taṃ vajjetvā itare dve cetanāsampayuttakāti vuttā. Vaṭṭantīti
analyzed: atha vā cetanā dānam tam vajjetvā itare dve cetanā sampayuttakā ati vuttāḥ vaṭṭanti iti
translated: Or else, the volition is the giving, and the other two are said to be associated with the volition, having been included by it.🔽They are fit to be called “path” because they are included in the path.

original: maggabhāvato jhānavacanena saṅgahetvā maggoti vattuṃ vaṭṭantīti attho. Okappanāti
analyzed: magga bhāvataḥ jhāna vacanena saṅgahetvā maggo ti vattum vaṭṭanti iti attho okappanā ti
translated: “Acceptance” is assent.

original: saddahanā. Aññattha diṭṭhaṃ atthaṃ pariccajitvā “janeti vaḍḍhetī”ti ayamattho kasmā
analyzed: saddahanā aññattha diṭṭham attham pariccajitvā janeti vaḍḍheti iti ayam atthaḥ kasmā
translated: Why is this meaning stated thus, “generates, causes to increase,”

original: vuttoti nirupasaggassa aññattha evamatthasseva diṭṭhattāti imamatthaṃ vibhāvetuṃ
analyzed: vuttaḥ ti nirupasaggassa aññattha evamatthassa iva diṭṭhattā ti imam attham vibhāvetum
translated: having rejected the meaning seen elsewhere? To make this meaning clear,

original: “puna caparaṃ udāyī”ti suttamāhaṭaṃ. Kesañci ariyānaṃ ariyamaggena siddhāni aññāni
analyzed: puna ca param udāyi iti suttam āhaṭam ariyānam ariya maggena siddhāni aññāni
translated: the sutta beginning with the words “Again, Udayin” is quoted.

original: ca jhānāni bhāvanāsabhāvānevāti tesupi bhāventena samayavavatthānaṃ ijjhatīti.
analyzed: ca jhānāni tesu pi bhāventena samaya vavatthānam ijjhati iti
translated: The other jhānas, which are accomplished by the noble path of some noble persons, are also of the nature of development. Therefore, the definition of the time is applicable to them also, when they are being developed.

original: Nissaranti niggacchanti etena, ettha vāti nissaraṇaṃ. Ke niggacchanti? Kāmā. Tesaṃ
analyzed: nissaranti niggacchanti etena ettha vā ati nissaraṇam ke niggacchanti kāmā tesam
translated: “Escape” is that by which one escapes, by which one goes out. What escapes? Sensual desires.

original: kāmānaṃ nissaraṇaṃ pahānanti attho. Evañhi “kāmāna”nti kattari sāmivacanaṃ yujjati.
analyzed: kāmānam nissaraṇam pahānanti attho evam hi kāmānam iti kattari sāmi vacanam yujjati
translated: The meaning is: the abandoning of those sensual desires. For thus the genitive case in “of sensual desires” is proper as a possessive compound.

original: Vatthukāmehipīti vatthukāmehi viviccevātipi attho yujjatīti evaṃ yujjamānatthantarasamuccayattho
analyzed: vatthu kāmehi pi iti vatthu kāmehi vivicca iva atipi atthaḥ yujjati iti evam yujjamāna ttha antara samuccaya tthaḥ
translated: The meaning “apart from sensual desires as objects” is also appropriate, so the word “and” has the meaning of combination of what is appropriate in this way.

original: pi-saddo, na kilesakāmasamuccayattho. Kasmā? Imasmiṃ atthe kilesakāmānaṃ dutiyapadena
analyzed: pi saddaḥ na kilesa kāma samuccaya atthaḥ kasmai imasmin atthe kilesa kāmānam dutiya padena
translated: It does not have the meaning of combination of the defilements of sensual desire. Why? Because in this meaning the second line

original: vivekassa vuttattā. Akusalasaddena yadipi kilesakāmā, athāpi sabbākusalā gahitā,
analyzed: vivekassa vutta ttā akusala saddena yadi pi kilesa kāmā atha api sabba akusalā gahitā
translated: states the separation from the defilements of sensual desire. Although the defilements of sensual desire are included by the word “unprofitable,” still all the unprofitable are included.

original: sabbathā pana kilesakāmehi viveko vuttoti āha “dutiyena kilesakāmehi vivekavacanato”ti.
analyzed: sabbathā pana kilesa kāmehi vivekaḥ vuttaḥ ti āha dutiyena kilesa kāmehi viveka vacanato ti
translated: In every way, however, the separation from the defilements of sensual desire is stated. That is why he says “because the second line states the separation from the defilements of sensual desire.”🔽The profitable and the unprofitable are stated in order to show the purity of the means and the purity of the end. The purity of the means is shown by the separation from the defilements of sensual desire, since even the pursuit of such things as killing breathing things is unmixedly profitable or unprofitable according to whether it is done with a profitable or an unprofitable consciousness.

original: Kāmaguṇādhigamahetupi pāṇātipātādiasuddhappayogo hotīti tabbivekena payogasuddhi
analyzed: pāṇātipāta ādi asuddha ppayogaḥ hoti iti tad bivekena payoga suddhi
translated: The purity of the end is shown by the separation from the pursuit of sensual desires as objects, since the pursuit of sensual desires as objects is the cause for the obtaining of the strands of sensual desire.

original: vibhāvitā. Taṇhāsaṃkilesasodhanena āsayaposanaṃ.
analyzed: vibhāvitā taṇhā saṃkilesa sodhanena āsaya posanam
translated: The nourishing of the inclination is by the purification of craving.🔽And also for others: for such things as views, conceit, etc., and for such things as contact.🔽The jhāna factors stated above are the higher jhāna factors.

original: Aññesampi cāti diṭṭhimānādīnaṃ phassādīnañca. Upari vuccamānāni jhānaṅgāni uparijjhānaṅgāni,🔽tesaṃ attano vipaccanīkānaṃ paṭipakkhabhāvadassanatthaṃ tappaccanīkanīvaraṇavacanaṃ.
analyzed: aññesam pi ca ati diṭṭhi māna ādīnam phassa ādīnam ca upari vuccamānāni jhāna aṅgāni uparijjhāna aṅgāni 🔽tesam attanaḥ vipaccanīkānam paṭipakkha bhāva dassana attham tad paccanīka nīvaraṇa vacanam
translated: The words “and the hindrances” are stated in order to show their opposition to the latter’s inimical states.

original: Byāpādavivekavacanena “anatthaṃ me acarī”tiādiāghātavatthubhedavisayassa dosassa🔽mohādhikānaṃ thinamiddhādīnaṃ vivekavacanena paṭicchādanavasena dukkhādipubbantādibhedavisayassa
analyzed: byāpāda viveka vacanena anattham me acari iti ādi āghāta vatthu bheda visayassa dosassa  moha adhikānam thina middha ādīnam viveka vacanena paṭicchādana vasena dukkha ādi pubbanta ādi bheda visayassa
translated: By the words “and the avoidance of ill will” is meant the avoidance of hate which has as its domain the various grounds for annoyance such as “He has done me harm,” etc.

original: mohassa vikkhambhanaviveko vutto. Kāmarāgabyāpādatadekaṭṭhathinamiddhādivikkhambhanakañcedaṃ
analyzed: mohassa vikkhambhana vivekaḥ vutto kāma rāga byāpāda tad eka ṭṭhathina middha ādi vikkhambhanakam ca idam
translated: By the words “and the avoidance of the states of mind that are opposed to the jhānas” is meant the avoidance of delusion which has as its domain the states of mind that are opposed to the jhānas, such as torpor and drowsiness, etc., which are rooted in delusion.

original: sabbākusalapaṭipakkhasabhāvattā sabbakusalānaṃ tena sabhāvena sabbākusalānaṃ pahānaṃ🔽hontampi kāmarāgādivikkhambhanasabhāvamevāti taṃsabhāvattā avisesetvā nīvaraṇākusalamūlādīnaṃ
analyzed: sabba akusala paṭipakkha sabhāva ttā sabba kusalānam tena sabhāvena sabba akusalānam pahānam  hontam pi kāma rāga ādi vikkhambhana sabhāvam eva ati tad sabhāva ttā a visesetvā nīvaraṇa akusala mūla ādīnam
translated: This avoidance of the hindrances is also the avoidance of all unprofitable states, since it is the opposite of all unprofitable states.

original: vikkhambhanaviveko vutto hotīti āha.🔽Vitakkassa kiccavisesena thirabhāvappatte paṭhamajjhānasamādhimhi paccanīkadūrībhāvakatena
analyzed: vikkhambhana vivekaḥ vuttaḥ hoti iti āha  vitakkassa kicca visesena thira bhāva ppatte paṭhama jhāna samādhimhi paccanīka dūrībhāva katena
translated: Therefore, without distinguishing the avoidance of the hindrances from the avoidance of the unprofitable, the avoidance of the unprofitable is stated in the text as the avoidance of the hindrances.

original: thirabhāvena taṃsadisesu vitakkarahitesu dutiyajjhānādisamādhīsu ca appanāti aṭṭhakathāvohāroti
analyzed: thira bhāvena tad sadisesu vitakka rahitesu dutiya jhāna ādi samādhīsu ca appanā ati aṭṭhakathā vohāro ti
translated: When the state of firmness is reached by the special function of applied thought, then the attainment of the jhāna is said to be “by avoidance of applied thought” in the first jhāna, and “by avoidance of the hindrances” in the second jhāna, etc., which are similar to the first jhāna but devoid of applied thought.

original: vitakkassa appanāyogo vutto, aññathā vitakkova appanāti tassa taṃsampayogo na siyāti.
analyzed: vitakkassa appanā yogo vuttaḥ aññathā vitakkaḥ iva appanā ti tassa tad sampayogo na siyāti
translated: The application of absorption to applied thought is stated; otherwise it would not be associated with it since it would be absorbed in applied thought itself.

original: Attho…pe… daṭṭhabbo jhānasamaṅgino vitakkavicārasamaṅgitādassanena jhānasseva savitakkasavicārabhāvassa vuttattā.🔽Vivekajaṃ pītisukhanti ettha purimasmiṃ atthe vivekajanti jhānaṃ. Pītisukhasaddato
analyzed: daṭṭhabbo jhāna samaṅginaḥ vitakka vicāra samaṅgi tā dassanena jhānassa iva sa vitakka sa vicāra bhāvassa vutta ttā  viveka jam pīti sukhanti ettha purimasmin atthe viveka janti jhānam pīti sukha saddato
translated: The meaning … should be regarded thus: because the state of being with applied thought and sustained thought is stated of the jhāna itself by showing that one possessing jhāna is also possessed of applied thought and sustained thought.🔽In the phrase born of seclusion, happiness, and bliss, in the first case the meaning is: born of seclusion is jhāna.🔽And because of the word happiness and the word bliss,🔽the meaning is: born of seclusion is jhāna, and happiness and bliss are born of seclusion.

original: ca atthiatthavisesavato assa, asmiṃ vāti ettha a-kāro vutto. Dutiye pītisukhameva
analyzed: ca atthi attha visesavataḥ assa asmin vā ati ettha akāraḥ vuttaḥ dutiye pīti sukham eva
translated: In the second case, happiness and bliss are born of seclusion.

original: vivekajaṃ. Vivekajaṃpītisukhanti ca aññapadatthe samāso paccattaniddesassa ca alopo
analyzed: viveka jam viveka jam pīti sukham ti ca añña padatthe samāsaḥ paccatta niddesassa ca a lopaḥ
translated: And the compound born of seclusion, happiness, and bliss is a copulative compound in the sense of another meaning, and the indication of the possessor is elided,

original: kato, lope vā sati “vivekajapītisukha”nti pāṭhoti ayaṃ viseso. Gaṇanānupubbatāti
analyzed: kataḥ lope vā sati viveka ja pīti sukhanti pāṭhaḥ ti ayam visesaḥ gaṇanā anupubba tā ti
translated: or if the elision is not allowed, the reading is born of seclusion, happiness, and bliss. This is the difference.🔽In the phrase in numerical series,🔽the meaning is: because of the numerical series, or the numerical series itself is first, according to the statement.

original: gaṇanānupubbatāya, gaṇanānupubbatāmattaṃ vā paṭhamanti vacananti attho. Niccādivipallāsappahānena
analyzed: gaṇanā anupubba tāya gaṇanā anupubba tā mattam vā paṭhamanti vacananti atthaḥ nicca ādi vipallāsa ppahānena
translated: By abandoning the perversions of permanence, etc.,

original: maggo asammohato aniccādilakkhaṇāni paṭivijjhatīti lakkhaṇūpanijjhānaṃ. Asammosadhammaṃ
analyzed: maggaḥ asammohataḥ anicca ādi lakkhaṇāni paṭivijjhati iti lakkhaṇa upanijjhānam asammosa dhammam
translated: The path penetrates the characteristics of impermanence, etc., by way of non-delusion, thus it is “penetration of the characteristics.”

original: nibbānaṃ aviparītalakkhaṇattā anaññathābhāvato tathalakkhaṇaṃ.
analyzed: nibbānam aviparīta lakkhaṇa ttā anaññathābhāvato tatha lakkhaṇam
translated: Nibbāna, which has the nature of being non-delusion, is “the characteristic of the way things are” because it is the undeluded characteristic, because it is not otherwise.

original: Dutiyajjhānakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya jhāna kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The second jhāna🔽By the words “with the stilling of applied and sustained thought” the surmounting of the gross factors of the first jhāna is shown.

original: 161-2. Vitakkavicārānaṃ vūpasamāti etena yehi vitakkavicārehi paṭhamajjhānassa oḷārikatā,🔽tesaṃ samatikkamā dutiyajjhānassa samadhigamo, na sabhāvato anoḷārikānaṃ phassādīnaṃ
analyzed: vitakka vicārānam etena yehi vitakka vicārehi paṭhamajjhānassa oḷārika tā  tesam samatikkamā dutiya jhānassa samadhigamaḥ na sabhāvataḥ anoḷārikānam phassa ādīnam
translated: For this is said: “With the stilling of applied and sustained thought: applied thought and sustained thought are gross; they are a disturbance of the mind’s continuity;🔽the first jhāna is peaceful, and these things are absent from it, thus it is said that the first jhāna is ‘with the stilling of applied and sustained thought.’🔽” So too in the case of the words “with the fading away of happiness” and so on.

original: samatikkamāti ayamattho dīpito hoti. Evaṃ “pītiyā ca virāgā”tiādīsu nayo. Tasmā vitakkavicārapītisukhasamatikkamavacanāni🔽oḷārikoḷārikaṅgasamatikkamā dutiyādiadhigamaparidīpakānīti tesaṃ ekadesabhūtaṃ vitakkavicārasamatikkamavacanaṃ
analyzed: samatikkamā ti ayam atthaḥ dīpitaḥ hoti evam pītiyā ca virāga ati ādīsu tasmā vitakka vicāra pīti sukha samatikkama vacanāni  oḷārika uḷārika aṅga samatikkamāḥ dutiya ādi adhigama paridīpakāni iti tesam eka desa bhūtam vitakka vicāra samatikkama vacanam
translated: Therefore the words “with the stilling of applied and sustained thought,” etc.,🔽indicate the attainment of the second jhāna, etc., by surmounting the gross factors, namely, applied thought, sustained thought, happiness, and bliss, respectively.🔽The words “with the stilling of applied and sustained thought”

original: taṃdīpakanti vuttaṃ. Atha vā vitakkavicāravūpasamavacaneneva taṃsamatikkamā dutiyādhigamadīpakena
analyzed: tat dīpakam ti vuttam atha vā vitakka vicāra vūpasama vacanena iva tad sama tikkamāḥ dutiya adhigama dīpakena
translated: indicate the surmounting of applied and sustained thought, which is one part of the gross factors.

original: pītivirāgādivacanānaṃ pītiyādisamatikkamā tatiyādiadhigamadīpakatā hotīti tassa taṃdīpakatā vuttā.🔽Nīlavaṇṇayogato nīlavatthaṃ viyāti nīlayogato vatthaṃ nīlaṃ viyāti adhippāyo. Yena
analyzed: pīti virāga ādi vacanānam tatiya ādi adhigama dīpaka tā hoti iti tassa taṃ dīpaka tā vuttā  nīla vaṇṇa yogataḥ nīla vattham viyāti nīla yogataḥ vattham nīlam viyāti adhippāyaḥ yena
translated: The words “with the fading away of happiness” and so on are said to show the third jhāna and so on because they show the surmounting of happiness and so on.🔽“Like a cloth from which one or two yarns have been removed” is the meaning intended.

original: sampasādanena yogā jhānaṃ sampasādanaṃ, tasmiṃ dassite “sampasādanaṃ jhāna”nti samānādhikaraṇaniddeseneva🔽taṃyogā jhāne taṃsaddappavatti dassitāti avirodho yutto. Ekodibhāve kathanti ekodimhi
analyzed: sampasādanena yogāḥ jhānam sampasādanam tasmin dassite sampasādanam jhānanti samāna adhikaraṇa niddesena iva  tad yogā jhāne tad sadda pavatti dassitā ati avirodhaḥ yuttaḥ eka udi bhāve kathanti eka udimhi
translated: The jhāna is called “confidence” because it is associated with confidence. When this is shown, the word “confidence” is shown as occurring in the jhāna in the sense of “confidence in the jhāna” by the method of expressing the unity of meaning of the compound as a determinative compound.🔽So there is no contradiction.🔽“In the singleness” is shown by the method of expressing the unity of meaning of the compound as a determinative compound.

original: dassite “ekodibhāvaṃ jhāna”nti samānādhikaraṇaniddeseneva jhānassa ekodivaḍḍhanatā
analyzed: dassite ekodi bhāvam jhānanti samāna adhikaraṇa niddesena iva jhānassa ekodi vaḍḍhana tā
translated: So the singleness of the jhāna is said to be increased.

original: vuttā hotīti. Ekodibhāvanti panidaṃ uddharitvā ekodissa niddeso na kattabbo siyāti
analyzed: vuttā hoti iti ekodi bhāvanti panidam uddharitvā ekodissa niddeso na kattabbo siyāti
translated: But the word “singleness” should not be taken out and shown separately.

original: ekodibhāvasaddo eva samādhimhi pavatto sampasādanasaddo viya jhānamhi pavattatīti yuttaṃ.
analyzed: eka udi bhāva saddo eva samādhimhi pavatto sampasādana saddaḥ viya jhānamhi pavattati iti yuttam
translated: So it is proper to say that the word “singleness” occurs in the jhāna in the way the word “confidence” does.

original: Appitāti gamitā vināsaṃ. Dutiyajjhānādiadhigamupāyadīpakena ajjhattasampasādanatāya
analyzed: gamitā vināsam dutiya jjhāna ādi adhigama upāya dīpakena ajjhatta sampasādana tāya
translated: “Gone to destruction” means “destroyed.”🔽The words “with the stilling of applied and sustained thought”

original: cetaso ekodibhāvatāya ca hetudīpakena avitakkāvicārabhāvahetudīpakena ca vitakkavicāravūpasamavacaneneva
analyzed: cetasaḥ eka udi bhāva tāya ca hetu dīpakena avitakka avicāra bhāva hetu dīpakena ca vitakka vicāra vūpa sama vacanena iva
translated: indicate the absence of applied and sustained thought by indicating the cause of the absence of applied and sustained thought, namely, confidence due to the surmounting of the hindrances and unification of mind due to the surmounting of the five jhānas.🔽What need is there to mention the words “without applied and sustained thought” as well?

original: vitakkavicārābhāvo dīpitoti kiṃ puna avitakkaavicāravacanena katenāti? Na, adīpitattā.
analyzed: vitakka vicāra abhāvaḥ kim punar a vitakka avicāra vacanena katena ati na
translated: Because they are not indicated.

original: Na hi vitakkavicāravūpasamavacanena vitakkavicārānaṃ appavatti vuttā hoti. Vitakkavicāresu🔽hi taṇhāpahānañca etesaṃ vūpasamanaṃ. Ye ca saṅkhāresu taṇhāpahānaṃ karonti, tesu
analyzed: na hi vitakka vicāra vūpasama vacanena vitakka vicārānaṃ appavatti vuttā hoti vitakka vicāresu  hi taṇhā apahānam ca etesam vūpasamanam ye ca saṅkhāresu taṇhā apahānam karonti tesu
translated: For the words “with the stilling of applied and sustained thought” do not express the non-occurrence of applied and sustained thought.🔽For the stilling of applied and sustained thought is the abandoning of craving for applied and sustained thought.

original: maggesu pahīnataṇhesu phalesu ca saṅkhārappavatti hoti, evamidhāpi vikkhambhitavitakkavicārataṇhassa
analyzed: maggesu pahīna taṇhesu phalesu ca saṅkhāra ppavatti hoti evam idha api vikkhambhita vitakka vicāra taṇhassa
translated: And in the paths and fruits where craving has been abandoned by the abandoning of formations, the occurrence of formations is found.

original: dutiyajjhānassa vitakkavicārasampayogo purimena na nivārito siyāti taṃnivāraṇatthaṃ
analyzed: dutiya jhānassa vitakka vicāra sampayogaḥ purimena na nivāritaḥ siyāti tad nivāraṇa attham
translated: So too here, the occurrence of applied and sustained thought in the second jhāna, which is associated with applied and sustained thought, would not be excluded by the former phrase.🔽Therefore, in order to exclude it,

original: āvajjitukāmatādiatikkamova tesaṃ vūpasamoti dassanatthañca “avitakkaṃ avicāra”nti vuttaṃ.🔽Tatiyajjhānakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: āvajjitu kāma tā ādi atikkamaḥ uva tesam vūpasamaḥ ti dassana ttham ca a vitakkam a vicāram ti vuttam  tatiya jhāna kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: and the surmounting of the desire to advert, etc., is their subsiding. And it is said that the third jhāna is “without happiness” in order to point out the subsiding of happiness in this way.🔽The third jhāna is ended.

original: 163. Parisuddhapakati khīṇāsavapakati nikkilesatā. Upekkhānimittanti ettha līnuddhaccapakkhapātarahitaṃ🔽majjhattaṃ vīriyaṃ “upekkhā”ti vuttaṃ, tadeva taṃ ākāraṃ gahetvā pavattetabbassa
analyzed: parisuddha pakati khīṇa āsava pakati nikkilesa tā upekkhā nimittan ti ettha līn uddhacca pakkhapāta rahitam  majjhattam vīriyam upekkhā ti vuttam tat eva tam ākāram gahetvā pavattetabbassa
translated: The fourth jhāna is entered upon and dwelt in by him who has thus ended the third jhāna, by giving up happiness and by giving up pain, by the previous surmounting of joy and by the previous abandoning of grief, by not giving attention to neither-pain-nor-pleasure, by giving attention only to equanimity purified of the factors of agitation and of grief.🔽Herein, by giving up happiness and by giving up pain: here too the abandoning of happiness is the non-attention to it, and the abandoning of pain is the non-attention to it as well.

original: tādisassa vīriyassa nimittabhāvato upekkhānimittaṃ. Paṭhamajjhānappaṭilābhatthāya
analyzed: tādisassa vīriyassa nimitta bhāvataḥ upekkhā nimittam paṭhamajjhāna paṭilābha atthāya
translated: By the previous surmounting of joy: here it is only the joy of the third jhāna that is called “previous” since it is actually present, while the joy of the first and second jhāna is called “previous” in the sense of temporal priority.🔽By the previous abandoning of grief: here it is only the grief of the first jhāna that is called “previous” since it is actually present, while the grief of the animal generation and the ghosts is called “previous” in the sense of temporal priority.

original: nīvaraṇe…pe… nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattipaṭilābhatthāya ākiñcaññāyatanasaññaṃ🔽paṭisaṅkhāsantiṭṭhanāpaññāsaṅkhārupekkhāsu ñāṇanti imā aṭṭha samāpattivasena uppajjanti.
analyzed: nīvaraṇa īpe nevasaññānāsaññāyatana samāpatti paṭilābha tthāya ākiñcaññāyatana saññam  paṭisaṅkhā santiṭṭhanā paññā saṅkhāra upekkhāsu ñāṇan ti imāḥ aṭṭha samāpatti vasena uppajjanti
translated: By not giving attention to neither-pain-nor-pleasure: here it is only the neither-pain-nor-pleasure of the second and third jhānas that is called “neither-pain-nor-pleasure” since it is actually present, while the neither-pain-nor-pleasure of the fourth jhāna is called “neither-pain-nor-pleasure” in the sense of temporal priority.🔽By giving attention to equanimity: here it is only the equanimity of the third jhāna that is called “equanimity” since it is actually present, while the equanimity of the first and second jhānas is called “equanimity” in the sense of temporal priority.

original: Sotāpattimaggapaṭilābhatthāya uppādaṃ pavattaṃ nimittaṃ āyūhanaṃ paṭisandhiṃ gatiṃ
analyzed: sotāpatti magga paṭilābha atthāya uppādam pavattam nimittam āyūhanam paṭisandhim gatim
translated: By giving attention to equanimity purified of the factors of agitation and of grief: here the equanimity purified of the factors of agitation is that of the first jhāna, and the equanimity purified of the factors of grief is that of the second jhāna.

original: nibbattiṃ upapattiṃ jātiṃ jarāmaraṇasokaparidevadukkhadomanassaupāyāse. Sotāpattiphalasamāpattatthāya
analyzed: nibbattim upapattim jātim jarā maraṇa soka parideva dukkha domanassa upāyāse sotāpatti phala samāpatta tthāya
translated: For the attainment of the fruit of arahantship, …🔽For the attainment of the emptiness attainment, …🔽For the attainment of the signless attainment, the arising, occurrence, sign, manifestation, and appearance of the five aggregates are the object of insight knowledge. For the attainment of the desireless attainment, …🔽For the attainment of the state of nothingness, …🔽For the attainment of the state of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, …🔽For the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling, …🔽For the attainment of the state of dispassion, …🔽For the attainment of the state of the fruit of stream-entry, …🔽For the attainment of the state of the fruit of once-returning, …🔽For the attainment of the state of the fruit of non-returning, …

original: uppādaṃ…pe… upāyāse…pe… arahattamaggapaṭilābhatthāya uppādaṃ…pe… upāyāse. Arahattaphalasamāpattatthāya…pe…
analyzed: arahatta magga paṭilābha tthāya uppāda upāyāse arahatta phala samāpatta tthāya
translated: For the attainment of the state of the fruit of arahantship, …🔽For the attainment of the state of the emptiness attainment, …🔽For the attainment of the state of the signless attainment, …

original: suññatavihārasamāpattatthāya…pe… animittavihārasamāpattatthāya uppādaṃ pavattaṃ āyūhanaṃ
analyzed: animitta vihāra samāpatta tthāya animitta vihāra samāpatta tthāya uppādam pavattam āyūhanam
translated: For the attainment of the state of the desireless attainment, …🔽For the attainment of the state of the state of nothingness, …🔽For the attainment of the state of the state of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, …🔽For the attainment of the state of the cessation of perception and feeling, …

original: paṭisandhiṃ…pe… paṭisaṅkhāsantiṭṭhanā paññā saṅkhārupekkhāsu ñāṇanti imā dasa vipassanāvasena uppajjanti.🔽Yadatthi yaṃ bhūtanti khandhapañcakaṃ, taṃ muñcitukamyatāñāṇena pajahati. Diṭṭhasovatthikattayassa
analyzed: paṭisandhiṃ pe paṭisaṅkhā santiṭṭhanā paññā saṅkhāra upekkhāsu ñāṇanti imā dasa vipassanā vasena uppajjanti  yat atthi yam khandha pañcakam tam muñcitu kamya tā ñāṇena pajahati diṭṭha sovatthika ttayassa
