original: vinābhūte vivitte bahi okāse ṭhānaṃ viya ākāsalaggaviññāṇassa viveke tadapagame tatiyāruppassa ṭhānaṃ.
analyzed: vinābhūte vivitte bahi okāse ṭhānam viya ākāsa lagga viññāṇassa viveke tad apagame tatiya āruppassa ṭhānam
translated: is standing in an empty place outside, so the third immaterial state is the support for the fourth immaterial state when the latter is devoid of the second immaterial state.

original: Arūpāvacarakusalakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: arūpa avacara kusala kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the profitable immaterial states is ended.

original: Tebhūmakakusalavaṇṇanā
analyzed: tebhūmaka kusala vaṇṇanā
translated: The profitable of the three planes

original: 269. Ime tāva chandādhipateyye pañca nayāti chandādhipateyyanaye ante purimanayānaṃ
analyzed: ime tāva chanda ādhipateyye pañca chanda ādhipateyya naye ante
translated: These are the five ways of interpreting the words “with will-power predominating” in the first method.

original: taṃnayābhimukhappavattiṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, ayaṃ pana pakāro na pāḷianugato. Na hi🔽pāḷiyaṃ suddhikanayādayo vatvā vīriyādhipateyyādinayā vuttāti. Mahāpakaraṇe sattahi
analyzed: tad naya abhimukha ppavattim sandhāya vuttam ayam pana pakāraḥ na pāḷi anugataḥ na hi  pāḷiyam suddhika naya ādayaḥ vatvā vīriya ādhipateyya ādi nayā vuttā ati mahā apakaraṇe sattahi
translated: These are the five kinds of direction governed by zeal. So in the direction governed by zeal, the last direction is said with reference to the occurrence of the previous directions facing towards that direction. But this method is not in accordance with the text,🔽for in the text the pure directions, etc., are not stated and then the direction governed by energy, etc.

original: mahāvārehi anulomādinayavicittehi hīnattiko vibhatto. Tattha ca majjhimadhammekadesabhūtā
analyzed: mahā vārehi anuloma ādi naya vicittehi hīna ttikaḥ vibhattaḥ tattha ca majjhima dhamma eka desa bhūtā
translated: In the Great Book the twenty kinds of direction are distributed in the inferior plane by the analysis of the directions in the seven great divisions beginning with the direction of conformity.

original: ime vīsati lokiyamahānayāti katvā “tattha vibhattā”ti vuttaṃ, na etena kamena imesaṃ
analyzed: ime vīsati lokiya mahā nayā ti katvā tattha vibhattā ati vuttam na etena kamena imesam
translated: And it is said that these twenty mundane directions are distributed there as being a part of the middle way,

original: nayānaṃ tattha āgatattā.🔽Evametesaṃ vibhattaṭṭhānaṃ dassetvā idāni etasmiṃ tebhūmakakusalakathāvasānaṭṭhāne🔽aṭṭhārasakammadvāradassanatthaṃ “imasmiṃ pana ṭhāne”tiādimāha. Atha vā hīnapaṇītehi
analyzed: nayānam tatthe āgata ttā  evam etesam vibhatta ṭṭhānam dassetvā idāni etasmim tebhūmaka kusala kathā avasāna ṭhāne  aṭṭhārasa kamma dvāra dassana ttham imasmin pana ṭhāne iti ādim āha atha vā hīna paṇītehi
translated: not because these directions are found there in that way.🔽So after showing the place where they are distributed, he now says “In this context” in order to show the eighteen doors of work at the end of the discussion of the three planes of profitable ideas.

original: vinivattetvā majjhimarāsiantogadhabhāvaṃ dassentena etesaṃ tebhūmakakusalanayānaṃ
analyzed: vinivattetvā majjhima rāsi antogadha bhāvam dassentena etesam tebhūmaka kusala nayānam
translated: Or alternatively, after turning aside from the inferior and superior, he says this in order to show the middle plane as the one to be gone to by those who are zealous for the middle way.

original: hīnattike vibhāgo kato. “Imasmiṃ pana ṭhāne”tiādikassa yathāvuttova sambandho. Hīnattike
analyzed: hīna ttike vibhāgaḥ kataḥ imasmin pana ṭhāne iti ādikassa yathā vuttaḥ uva sambandhaḥ hīna ttike
translated: The division into inferior and superior is made in the case of the three kinds of action. The construction of the words “Herein, etc.,” is that already stated.

original: majjhimarāsimhi ye savipākā vaṭṭanissiteneva dānādivasena pavattitā, te hīnāti kātabbā.
analyzed: majjhima rāsimhi ye sa vipākāḥ vaṭṭa nissitena iva dāna ādi vasena pavatti tā te hīnā ati kātabbā
translated: In the case of the three kinds of action in the middle category, those that have results and that occur by way of giving, etc., only as dependent for their arising on the round of rebirths should be understood as inferior.

original: Ye vivaṭṭanissitena dānādivasena pavattitā, te paṇītāti kātabbā. Avipākā majjhimāti
analyzed: ye vivaṭṭa nissitena dāna ādi vasena pavatti tā te paṇītā ati kātabbā avipākā majjhimā ati
translated: Those that occur by way of giving, etc., only as dependent for their arising on the cessation of the round of rebirths should be understood as superior. Those that have no results should be understood as medium.

original: kātabbā. Avipākattā ca tesu majjhimarāsiṃ ṭhapetvā itare dve ekantavaṭṭanissitā nava,
analyzed: kātabbāḥ avipāka attā ca tesu majjhima rāsim ṭhapetvā itare dve ekanta vaṭṭa nissitāḥ nava
translated: And because they have no results, among the three kinds of action in the middle category, the other two are entirely dependent for their arising on the round of rebirths,

original: vivaṭṭupanissayabhūtā ca navāti aṭṭhārasa kammadvārāni, kammāni ca tāni tassa tassa
analyzed: vivaṭṭa upanissaya bhūtā ca aṭṭhārasa kamma dvārāni kammāni ca tāni tassa tassa
translated: and the other nine are dependent for their arising on the cessation of the round of rebirths. Thus there are eighteen doors of action and actions.🔽They are “doors of action” because they are doors to the various results of action.

original: phalassa kāraṇabhāvena dvārāni cāti kammadvārāni. Tattha tattha vā cittāni kammadvārānīti
analyzed: phalassa kāraṇa bhāvena dvārāni ca ati kamma dvārāni tattha tattha vā cittāni kamma dvārāni iti
translated: Or the doors of action are the various kinds of consciousness that occur in the various doors.🔽Or the doors of action are the various kinds of bodily and other action.

original: āha. Taṃtaṃdvārāni vā kāyādīni. Aṭṭhārasa khattiyā ca abhabbā hīnahīnattayādayo nava,
analyzed: āha taṃ taṃ dvārāni vā kāya ādīni aṭṭhārasa khattiyā ca abhabbāḥ nava
translated: The eighteen kinds of nobles, the nine kinds of incapable, the inferior of the inferior, and so on,

original: bhabbā ca paṇītapaṇītattayādayo navāti kammānurūpeneva veditabbā. Evaṃ brāhmaṇādayo
analyzed: bhabbā ca paṇīta paṇīta ttayā ādayaḥ navā ati kamma anurūpena iva veditabbā evam brāhmaṇa ādayaḥ
translated: and the nine kinds of capable, the superior of the superior, and so on, should be understood according to the kind of action. So too the brahmans,

original: devā ca yojetabbā. Aṭṭhacattālīsa gottacaraṇāni tesaññeva khattiyādīnaṃ bhedā. “Kāmāvacaraṃ🔽kusalaṃ cittaṃ uppannaṃ hoti…pe… cittādhipateyya”nti evaṃ vutto cittassa cittādhipateyyabhāvo,
analyzed: devā ca yojetabbā aṭṭhacattālīsa gotta caraṇāni tesan eva khattiya ādīnam bhedā kāmāvacaram  kusalam cittam uppannam hoti pe citta ādhipateyyanti evam vuttaḥ cittassa citta ādhipateyya bhāvo
translated: and the gods are to be yoked. The forty-eight modes of conduct are the divisions of those same nobles, etc., themselves. “ Wholesome consciousness belonging to the sense sphere arises … with the support of a faculty” : the state of being the dominant condition for consciousness stated thus is the state of being the dominant condition for the aggregate of consciousness.

original: cittacetasikasamudāye samayavavatthāpako cittasaddo pavattoti “sampayuttadhammānaṃ🔽vasena vutto”ti āha.
analyzed: citta cetasika samudāye samaya vavatthāpako citta saddo pavatto ti sampayutta dhammānam  vasena vuttā iti āha
translated: The word “consciousness” occurs in the sense of the aggregate of consciousness and its concomitants, distinguishing the moment by way of the associated states.

original: Tebhūmakakusalavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Lokuttarakusalavaṇṇanā🔽277. Lokaṃ taratīti etena lokasamatikkamapaṭipattimāha. Uttaratīti etena lokassantagamanaṃ🔽phale patiṭṭhānaṃ phalaṃ. Samatikkammātiādinā nibbānaṃ. Samatikkammāti hi nissaritvā.🔽Abhibhuyyāti visaṃyuttaṃ hutvāti attho. Tividhopi cattho maggādīsu ekekasmiṃ yojetabbo,
analyzed: tebhūmaka kusala vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā          lokam tarati iti etena loka samatikkama paṭipattim āha uttarati iti etena lokaḥ santa gamanam  phale patiṭṭhānam phalam samatikkamma ati ādinā nibbānam samatikkamma ati hi nissaritvā  abhibhuyya ati visaṃyuttam hutvā iti atthaḥ tividhaḥ api catthaḥ magga ādīsu ekekasmin yojetabbo
translated: The description of the wholesome consciousness of the three planes is concluded.

original: maggeyeva vā idha tassa adhippetattā. Ekacittakkhaṇikanti ekamaggassa dve vāre anuppattiṃ
analyzed: vā idha tassa adhippeta ttā eka citta khaṇikam ti eka maggassa dve vāre anuppattim
translated: The supramundane wholesome consciousness is called “supramundane” because it transcends the mundane. It is called “noble” because it is the property of the noble ones. It is called “the path” because it is the way to the deathless. It is called “the way of practice” because it is the way of practice for arriving at the deathless. It is called “the way of practice leading to the deathless” because it is the way of practice that leads to the deathless. It is called “the way leading to the extinction of suffering” because it is the way that leads to the extinction of suffering. It is called “the way leading to the stopping of suffering” because it is the way that leads to the stopping of suffering. It is called “the way leading to the abandoning of suffering” because it is the way that leads to the abandoning of suffering. It is called “the way leading to the relinquishing of suffering” because it is the way that leads to the relinquishing of suffering. It is called “the way leading to the giving up of suffering” because it is the way that leads to the giving up of suffering. It is called “the way leading to the decline of suffering” because it is the way that leads to the decline of suffering. It is called “the way leading to the cessation of suffering” because it is the way that leads to the cessation of suffering. It is called “the way leading to the appeasement of suffering” because it is the way that leads to the appeasement of suffering. It is called “the way leading to the passing away of suffering” because it is the way that leads to the passing away of suffering. It is called “the way leading to the destruction of suffering” because it is the way that leads to the destruction of suffering. It is called “the way leading to the giving up of the burden” because it

original: sandhāyāha. Aññamaññaṃ dhammānaṃ anativattanādisādhikāya paññāya vaḍḍheti. “Niyyātīti
analyzed: sandhāya āha aññam aññam dhammānam anativattana ādi sādhikāya paññāya vaḍḍheti niyyāti iti
translated: He said this with reference to the fact that it is by means of the wisdom that consists in the non-transgression of the mutual dependence of states, etc., that it is extended.🔽“It is to be gone out to”

original: niyyānīya”nti vattabbe ī-kārassa rassattaṃ ya-kārassa ca ka-kāraṃ katvā “niyyānika”nti🔽vuttaṃ. Niyyāti etenāti niyyānaṃ, niyyānameva niyyānikaṃ venayiko viya. Ettha “neyyānika”nti
analyzed: niyyānīyanti vattabbe īkārassa rassa ttam yakārassa ca kakāram katvā niyyānikanti  vuttam niyyāti etena ati niyyānam niyyānam eva niyyānikam venayikaḥ viya ettha neyyānikam ti
translated: means that it is to be gone out to by means of the path. But “niyyāna” is said by dropping the i-vowel sign and changing the y to k in the word “niyyānīya.”🔽“It is that by which one goes out” is the meaning of “niyyāna” .🔽“It is that which has going out” is the meaning of “niyyānika” .

original: vattabbe i-kārassa e-kārattaṃ akatvā vuttaṃ.🔽Phalanti cittacetasikarāsi vuccati, taṃ aññamaññaṃ sampayuttānaṃ dhammānaṃ attano
analyzed: vattabbe ikārassa a katvā vuttam  phalanti citta cetasika rāsi vuccati tam aññamaññam sampayuttānam dhammānam attano
translated: “Neyyānika” is said by dropping the e-vowel sign in the word “niyyānika” .🔽“It is the fruit” is said of the aggregate of consciousness and its concomitants. It is the support for the states associated with it that are its own components.

original: avayavabhūtānaṃ nissayo hoti. Phalañāṇaṃ vā phalaṃ, sammādiṭṭhiādayo aṅgāni vā. Lokuttarabhāveti
analyzed: avayava bhūtānam nissayaḥ hoti phala ñāṇam vā phalam sammādiṭṭhi ādayaḥ aṅgāni vā lokuttara bhāveti
translated: Or “it is the fruit” is said of the knowledge of the fruit, or of the path, or of the factors of the path, such as right view, etc.🔽“The state of having gone beyond the world” is said of the supramundane. By this he includes the fruit and Nibbāna.

original: lokaṃ uttiṇṇabhāve. Tena phalanibbānāni saṅgaṇhāti. Tesu yaṃ bhavati phalaṃ, taṃ
analyzed: lokam uttiṇṇa bhāve tena phala nibbānāni saṅgaṇhāti tesu yam bhavati phalam tam
translated: Among them, the fruit is called “the plane” .

original: “bhūmī”ti vuccati. Yathā vā kammanibbattā kāmabhavādayo taṃsamaṅgino nissayabhāvena
analyzed: bhūmī iti vuccati yathā vā kamma nibbattā kāma bhava ādayo tad samaṅginaḥ nissaya bhāvena
translated: Or, just as the sensual-desire realm, etc., which are produced by kamma, are the support for those who possess them in the sense of being their components,

original: “bhūmī”ti vuccanti, evaṃ maggena nibbattaṃ phalaṃ ariyasāvakassa kālena kālaṃ samāpajjitabbatāya
analyzed: bhūmī iti vuccanti evam maggena nibbattam phalam ariyasāvakassa kālena kālam samāpajjitabba tāya
translated: “Ground” is said because the fruit arisen by means of the path is to be entered upon from time to time by the noble disciple,

original: nissayabhāvato “bhūmī”ti vuccati, tatoyeva ariyā cirataraṃ tiṭṭhanti. Samucchedavivekavasenāti
analyzed: nissaya bhāvataḥ bhūmī iti vuccati tatas yā iva ariyā cirataram tiṭṭhanti samuccheda viveka vasena ati
translated: and because it is the support. It is said “ground” because the noble ones remain for a long time on it.

original: ettha apāyagamanīyānaṃ accantasamucchedo itaresañca vijjutobhāsena viya tamassa samucchedo
analyzed: ettha apāya gamanīyānam itaresam ca vijjutobhāsena tamassa samucchedo
translated: By the severance of the severance: here the severance of the severance of those who go to the states of loss should be seen as the severance of the severance of those who do not go to the states of loss.

original: daṭṭhabbo. Lokiyajjhānampi puthujjanassa ariyassa ca akatādhikārassa na vinā paṭipadāya
analyzed: daṭṭhabbaḥ lokiya jhānam pi puthujjanassa ariyassa ca a kata adhikārassa na vinā paṭipadāya
translated: The mundane jhāna of the ordinary man and of the noble one who has not made spiritual progress does not succeed without the practice of the path.

original: ijjhati, katādhikārassa pana ariyassa maggeneva samijjhanato vipākānaṃ viya kusalena
analyzed: ijjhati kata adhikārassa pana ariyassa maggena iva vipākānam viya kusalena
translated: But that of the noble one who has made spiritual progress succeeds by means of the path, like the fruition attainment.

original: tathā samiddhassa ariyamaggena sadisatāya abhāvato atabbipākattā ca na maggapaṭipadā🔽tassa jhānassa paṭipadāti sakkā vattunti tattha tathā garuṃ katvā paṭipadāhi eva
analyzed: tathā samiddhassa ariya maggena sadisa tāya abhāvataḥ a tad vipāka ttā ca na magga paṭipadā  tassa jhānassa paṭipadā ati sakkā vattunti tattha tathā garum katvā eva
translated: So it is not tenable to call the mundane jhāna “the practice” because it is not similar to the noble path in that way, and because it is not a fruition.

original: desanā na katā, yathāvuttajjhānasaṅgahatthaṃ suddhikadesanāpi katā.
analyzed: desanā na katā yathā vutta jhāna saṅgaha ttham suddhika desanā api katā
translated: Therefore the teaching is not given in this way by way of practice, as it is in the case of the noble path.🔽But the teaching is given by way of the severance of the severance, and the teaching is given by way of the severance, and the teaching is given by way of the kinds, for the purpose of including the jhāna stated in this way.

original: Idha pana kassaci vinā paṭipadāya asiddhito garuṃ katvā dassetuṃ “dukkhapaṭipada”ntiādi
analyzed: idha pana kassaci vinā paṭipadāya asiddhitaḥ garum katvā dassetum dukkha paṭipad anti ādi
translated: But in the case of some, since they are not established without practice, it is said, “with difficulty,” in order to show that it is heavy.

original: vuttaṃ. Yo koci vāroti sakiṃ dvikkhattuṃ tikkhattuṃ catukkhattuṃ anekakkhattunti
analyzed: vuttam yaḥ koci vāro ti sakim dvi khattum ti khattum catu khattum aneka khattum ti
translated: “Anyone” is in the cases of suppression once, twice, thrice, four times, many times, etc.

original: evamādīsu vikkhambhanavāresu yo koci. Sakiṃ dvikkhattuñca vikkhambhanavārā sukhā🔽paṭipadā eva, na ca tato uddhaṃ sukhā paṭipadā hotīti tikkhattuṃ vikkhambhanavāraṃ
analyzed: evamādīsu vikkhambhana vāresu yaḥ koci sakim dvi kkhattum ca vikkhambhana vārā sukhā  paṭipadā eva na ca tatas uddham sukhā paṭipadā hoti iti tikkhattum vikkhambhana vāram
translated: The cases of suppression once and twice are the pleasant way,🔽and there is no pleasant way beyond that. So the teachers of the commentary🔽approve the case of suppression thrice as the difficult way.

original: dukkhā paṭipadāti rocesuṃ aṭṭhakathācariyā. Tasmiṃ tathārocite tato paresu catukkhattuṃ🔽vikkhambhanavārādīsu vattabbameva natthīti. Rūpārūpānaṃ lakkhaṇādīhi paricchinditvā🔽gahaṇaṃ rūpārūpapariggaho, nāmarūpamattametaṃ, na añño koci sattādikoti vavatthāpanaṃ
analyzed: dukkhā paṭipadā ti rocesuṃ aṭṭhakathā cariyā tasmin tathā ārocite tatas paresu catu khattum  vikkhambhana vāra ādīsu vattabbam eva natthi iti rūpa arūpānam lakkhaṇa ādīhi paricchinditvā  gahaṇam rūpa arūpa pariggahaḥ nāma rūpam attam etam na añño koci satta ādiko ti vavatthāpanam
translated: When it is approved in this way, there is nothing more to be said about the cases of suppression four times, etc.🔽The discerning of material and immaterial states by their characteristics, etc.,🔽is the discerning of mentality-materiality. The defining of it thus, “This is mere mentality-materiality, there is no other being or soul,”

original: nāmarūpavavatthāpanaṃ. Pariggahitarūpārūpassa maggapātubhāvadandhatā ca nāmarūpavavatthāpanādīnaṃ
analyzed: nāma rūpa vavatthāpanam pariggahita rūpa arūpassa magga pātubhāva dandha tā ca nāma rūpa vavatthāpana ādīnam
translated: is the defining of mentality-materiality. The manifestation of the path in one who discerns material and immaterial states in this way is the outcome of the discerning of mentality-materiality, etc.

original: kicchasiddhito siyāti na rūpārūpapariggahakicchatāya eva dukkhapaṭipadatā vattabbāti🔽ce? Taṃ na, nāmarūpavavatthāpanādīnaṃ paccanīkakilesamandatāya sukhasiddhiyampi tathāsiddhavipassanāsahagatānaṃ
analyzed: kiccha siddhitaḥ siyā ti na rūpa arūpa pariggaha kiccha tāya eva dukkha paṭipada tā vattabbā ti  ce tam na nāma rūpa vavatthāpana ādīnam paccanīka kilesa manda tāya tathā siddha vipassanā sahagatānam
translated: “But is the painful way only to be stated as the painful way because of the difficulty of discerning materiality and immateriality?”

original: indriyānaṃ mandatāya maggapātubhāvadandhabhāvato.🔽Rūpārūpaṃ pariggahetvāti akicchenapi pariggahetvā. Kicchena pariggahite vattabbameva🔽natthi. Evaṃ sesesupi. Imaṃ vāraṃ rocesunti kalāpasammasanāvasāne udayabbayānupassanāya🔽vattamānāya uppannassa vipassanupakkilesassa tikkhattuṃ vikkhambhanena kicchatāvāraṃ🔽dukkhā paṭipadāti rocesuṃ etadantattā paṭipadāya. Etassa akicchattepi purimānaṃ kicchatte
analyzed: manda tāya  rūpa arūpam pariggahetvā ti a kicchena api pariggahetvā kicchena pariggahite vattabbam eva  natthi evam sesesu pi imam vāram rocesunti kalāpa sammasana avasāne udaya bbaya anupassanāya  vattamānāya uppannassa vipassanu pakkilesassa tikkhattum vikkhambhanena  dukkhā paṭipadā ati rocesuṃ etad anta ttā paṭipadāya etassa a kicchatte pi purimānam kicchatte
translated: —No, because of the slowness of the path’s manifestation due to the slowness of the faculties that are accompanied by insight that is slow to reach its goal, even though there is slowness in discerning mentality-materiality, etc., because of the slowness of the defilements’ opposition.

original: dukkhapaṭipadatā vuttanayāvāti na paṭisiddhāti daṭṭhabbaṃ. Yathāvuttaṃ vā sabbaṃ
analyzed: dukkha paṭipada tā vutta nayāvā ati na paṭisiddhā ati daṭṭhabbam yathā vuttam vā sabbam
translated: “Having discerned materiality and immateriality” means having discerned them even without difficulty. There is nothing to be stated about them when they are discerned with difficulty. So too with the rest. “We approve of this section” means that they approved of the painful way as the painful way because of the manifestation of the path being slow due to the threefold suppression of the imperfections of insight that arise in the contemplation of arising and falling away at the end of the exercise in the method of the survey of the four primary elements.

original: rūpārūpapariggahādikicchataṃ tikkhattuṃ vikkhambhanavāratāvasena “imaṃ vāra”nti āha.
analyzed: rūpa arūpa pariggaha ādi kicchatam tikkhattum vikkhambhana vāra tā vasena imam āha
translated: He said “this turn” in the sense of the three-times-suppressed desire to take up visible-data-and-sound-as-object, etc., as a turn.

original: Yassa pana sabbattha akicchatā, tassa sukhā paṭipadā veditabbā.
analyzed: yassa pana sabbattha a kiccha tā tassa sukhā paṭipadā veditabbā
translated: But that of which there is no desire in any instance should be understood as the pleasant way.

original: Musāvādādīnaṃ visaṃvādanādikiccatāya lūkhānaṃ apariggāhakānaṃ paṭipakkhabhāvato pariggāhakasabhāvā🔽sammāvācā. Sā siniddhabhāvato sampayuttadhamme pariggaṇhāti sammāvācāpaccayasubhāsitasotārañca🔽janaṃ. Kāyikakiriyākiccaṃ kattabbaṃ samuṭṭhāpeti, sayañca samuṭṭhahanaṃ ghaṭanaṃ
analyzed: musāvāda ādīnam visaṃvādana ādi kicca tāya lūkhānam a pariggāhakānam paṭipakkha bhāvato pariggāhaka sabhāvā  sammāvācā sā siniddha bhāvataḥ sampayutta dhamme pariggaṇhāti sammāvācā paccaya subhāsita sotāram ca  janam kāyika kiriyā kiccam kattabbam samuṭṭhāpeti sayam ca samuṭṭhahanam ghaṭanam
translated: Right speech is the opposite of the rough, non-embracing speech of lying, etc., because of its embracing function of non-deception, etc.,🔽and it embraces associated states because of its smoothness. It embraces people who listen to the good speech that has right speech as its requisite condition.

original: hotīti sammākammantasaṅkhātā viratipi samuṭṭhānasabhāvāti vuttā. Sampayuttadhammānaṃ🔽vā ukkhipanaṃ samuṭṭhahanaṃ kāyikakiriyāya bhārukkhipanaṃ viya, jīvamānassa sattassa,
analyzed: hoti iti sammā kammanta saṅkhātā virati pi samuṭṭhāna sabhāvā ti vuttā sampayutta dhammānam  vā ukkhipanam samuṭṭhahanam kāyika kiriyāya bhāru khipanam viya jīvamānassa sattassa
translated: Right action, called abstinence, is said to have the function of instigation because it instigates the function of bodily action that should be done and because it is the instigation and the bringing about of that.🔽Or alternatively, it is said to have the function of instigation because it is the lifting up of associated states, like the lifting up of a load by a porter,

original: sampayuttadhammānaṃ vā suddhi vodānaṃ ājīvasseva vā jīvitindriyavuttiyā.
analyzed: sampayutta dhammānam vā ājīvassa iva vā jīvitindriya vuttiyā
translated: or because it is the purification and cleansing of associated states or of the life of one who has right action, as the life of one who has the life of purity .

original: 283. Maggasannissitanti paramatthamaggasabhāvattā maggāvayavabhāvena samudāyasannissitanti attho.
analyzed: magga sannissitanti paramattha magga sabhāvattā magga avayava bhāvena samudāya sannissitanti attho
translated: “Based on the path” means “based on the path as a whole” in the sense of being a factor of the path, because it has the nature of the ultimate path.

original: 285. Patiṭṭhānaṃ kilesavasena, āyūhanaṃ abhisaṅkhāravasena. Taṇhāvasena vā patiṭṭhānaṃ,
analyzed: patiṭṭhānam kilesa vasena āyūhanam abhisaṅkhāra vasena taṇhā vasena vā patiṭṭhānam
translated: “Establishment” is by way of defilement, “accumulation” by way of kamma-formation. Or else, “establishment” is by way of craving,🔽“accumulation” by way of views. “Enlightenment” should be construed as “that which is called the conformity knowledge.”

original: diṭṭhivasena āyūhanaṃ. Bodhīti yā ayaṃ dhammasāmaggī vuccatīti yojetabbā. Senaṅgarathaṅgādayo
analyzed: diṭṭhi vasena āyūhanam bodhi iti yā ayam dhamma sāmaggī vuccati iti yojetabbā senaṅga rathaṅga ādayo
translated: Like the factors of an army, the factors of a chariot, etc.🔽By this he shows that the designation of a person is a non-existent designation.

original: viyāti etena puggalapaññattiyā avijjamānapaññattibhāvaṃ dasseti. Aṅga-saddo kāraṇatthopi🔽hotīti catusaccabodhāya saṃvattantīti bojjhaṅgā. Bujjhantīti bodhiyo, bodhiyo eva
analyzed: viya iti etena puggala paññattiyāḥ avijjamāna paññatti bhāvam dasseti aṅga saddo kāraṇa atthaḥ api  hoti iti catu sacca bodhāya saṃvattanti iti bojjhaṅgāḥ bujjhanti iti bodhiyaḥ bodhiyaḥ eva
translated: The word “factor” has the meaning of cause.🔽Therefore, “the factors of enlightenment” are so called because they lead to the enlightenment of the four truths. They are “enlightenments” because they enlighten. They are “factors” because they are factors of enlightenment.

original: aṅgāti “anubujjhantīti bojjhaṅgā”ti vuttaṃ. Vipassanādīnaṃ kāraṇānaṃ bujjhitabbānañca
analyzed: aṅgā ati anubujjhantīti bojjhaṅgā iti vuttam vipassanā ādīnam kāraṇānam bujjhitabbānam ca
translated: “The factors of enlightenment are the enlighteners” is said.🔽They enlighten the causes such as insight, and the truths to be enlightened to,

original: saccānaṃ anurūpaṃ paccakkhabhāvena paṭimukhaṃ aviparītatāya sammā ca bujjhantīti
analyzed: saccānam anurūpam paccakkha bhāvena paṭimukham a viparīta tāya sammā ca bujjhanti iti
translated: by way of direct knowledge, by facing them, by being unperverted, and by being right.

original: evamatthavisesadīpakehi upasaggehi “anubujjhantī”tiādi vuttaṃ. Bodhi-saddo hi sabbavisesayuttaṃ🔽bujjhanaṃ sāmaññena saṅgaṇhātīti.🔽299. Tiṇṇanti rāgādīnaṃ. Karoti nāma kiṃ duccaritāni anuvattamānāni.
analyzed: evam attha visesa dīpakehi upasaggehi anubujjhanti itiādi vuttam bodhi saddaḥ hi sabba visesa yuttam  bujjhanam sāmaññena saṅgaṇhāti iti  rāga ādīnam karoti nāma kim duccaritāni anuvattamānāni
translated: So too, the words “he penetrates” and so on are said with the prefix anu in order to show a particular meaning. For the word bodhi includes all kinds of awakening in common.🔽The word tiṇṇā is a past participle formed from the verbal noun tiṇa, which is derived from the verb tināti .🔽The word karoti is a present participle formed from the verbal noun kāra, which is derived from the verb kāreti .

original: 301. Pāṇātipātādinipphāditapaccayānaṃ niccasevanaṃ dhuvapaṭisevanaṃ. Sakiccakoti
translated: The word niccaṃ is an indeclinable formed from the adjective nicca .🔽The word sakiccako is a present participle formed from the verbal noun sakicca, which is derived from the verb sakiccaṃ karoti .

original: visuṃ attano kiccavā. Na hotīti atthantarabhāvaṃ paṭikkhipati. Paccayapaṭisevanasāmantajappanairiyāpathappavattanāni
analyzed: visum attanaḥ kiccavā na hoti iti attha antara bhāvam paṭikkhipati paccaya paṭisevana sāmanta jappa na eriyāpatha ppavattanāni
translated: The word na hoti is a present participle formed from the verbal noun na hoti .

original: pāpicchatānibbattāni tīṇi kuhanavatthūnīti.
analyzed: pāpa iccha tā nibbattāni tīṇi kuhana vatthūni iti
translated: The words pāpicchatānibbattāni are a present participle and a past participle formed from the verbal noun pāpicchatā, which is derived from the verb pāpicchataṃ karoti , and from the verb nibbattati .🔽The word vuṭṭhānagāminī is a present participle formed from the verbal noun vuṭṭhāna, which is derived from the verb vuṭṭhāti .🔽The word sānulomā is a present participle formed from the verbal noun anuloma, which is derived from the verb anulometi .

original: 343. Vuṭṭhānagāminīvipassanā saṅkhārupekkhā sānulomā, sā suññato passantī “suññatā”ti
analyzed: vuṭṭhāna gāminī vipassanā saṅkhāra upekkhā sa anulomā sā suññatas passantī suññatā ti
translated: The word suññato is a locative formed from the noun suññatā, which is derived from the verb suññaṃ karoti .

original: vuccati, dukkhato passantī taṇhāpaṇidhisosanato “appaṇihita”nti. Sā āgamanīyaṭṭhāne
analyzed: vuccati dukkhato passantī taṇhā paṇidhi sosanato appaṇihitanti sā āgamanīya ṭhāne
translated: The word appaṇihita is a locative formed from the noun appaṇihita, which is derived from the verb appaṇidhāpeti .

original: maggādhigamatthaṃ āgamanapaṭipadāṭhāne ṭhatvā suññatāppaṇihitanti nāmaṃ deti. Āgamanato
analyzed: magga adhigama attham āgamana paṭipadā ṭhāne ṭhatvā suñña tā appaṇihitanti nāmam deti āgamanataḥ
translated: The word āgamanīya is a locative formed from the noun āgamanīya, which is derived from the verb āgacchati .

original: nāme laddhe saguṇato ārammaṇato ca nāmaṃ siddhameva hoti, na pana saguṇārammaṇehi
analyzed: nāme laddhe sa guṇataḥ ārammaṇato ca nāmam siddham eva hoti na pana sa guṇa ārammaṇehi
translated: When the name is obtained, the named is established by its qualities and its object, but not by the named.🔽When the name is obtained, the named is established by its coming in everywhere, but not by its qualities and its object.

original: nāmalābhe sabbattha āgamanato nāmaṃ siddhaṃ hotīti paripuṇṇanāmasiddhihetuttā saguṇārammaṇehi
analyzed: nāma lābhe sabbattha āgamanataḥ nāmam siddham hoti iti paripuṇṇa nāma siddhi hetuttā sa guṇa ārammaṇehi
translated: The combination of all three terms is by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name.🔽The combination of the three terms is by way of the coming in, not by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name.

original: sabbesampi nāmattayayogo, na āgamanatoti vavatthānakarattā ca nippariyāyadesanāya
analyzed: sabbesam pi nāma ttaya yogaḥ na āgamanato ti vavatthānakara ttā ca nippariyāya desanāya
translated: The combination of the three terms is by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name, not by way of the coming in.🔽The combination of the three terms is by way of the coming in, not by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name.

original: āgamanatova idha nāmaṃ labhati, na itarehīti vuttaṃ.🔽350. Animittavipassananti aniccānupassanaṃ. Nimittadhammesūti samūhādighanavasena
analyzed: āgamanataḥ vai idha nāmam labhati na itarehi iti vuttam  animitta vipassanam ti anicca anupassanam nimitta dhammesu iti samūha ādi ghana vasena
translated: The combination of the three terms is by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name, not by way of the coming in.🔽The combination of the three terms is by way of the coming in, not by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name.🔽The combination of the three terms is by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name, not by way of the coming in.🔽The combination of the three terms is by way of the coming in, not by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name.

original: ca sakiccaparicchedatāya ca sapariggahesu khandhesu. Animittavimokkhoti aniccānupassanamāha.
analyzed: ca sa kicca pariccheda tāya ca sa pariggahesu khandhesu animitta vimokkhaḥ ti anicca anupassanam āha
translated: The combination of the three terms is by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name, not by way of the coming in.🔽The combination of the three terms is by way of the coming in, not by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name.🔽The combination of the three terms is by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name, not by way of the coming in.🔽The combination of the three terms is by way of the coming in, not by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name.

original: Evaṃsampadamidanti kathamidha upamāsaṃsandanaṃ hoti. Na hi chandacittānaṃ maggasaṅkhātaadhipatibhāvābhāvo
analyzed: evaṃsampadam idam ti katham idha upamā saṃsandanam hoti na hi chanda cittānam magga saṅkhāta adhipati bhāva abhāvaḥ
translated: The combination of the three terms is by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name, not by way of the coming in.🔽The combination of the three terms is by way of the coming in, not by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name.🔽The combination of the three terms is by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name, not by way of the coming in.

original: viya saddhindriyādhikassa animittavimokkhassa animittabhāvābhāvo atthi, na ca amaggādhipatīnaṃ
analyzed: viya saddhi indriya adhikassa animitta vimokkhassa animitta bhāva abhāvaḥ atthi na ca amagga adhipatīnam
translated: The combination of the three terms is by way of the coming in, not by way of the cause of the establishment of the complete name.🔽The combination of the three terms

original: maggādhipatināmadānābhāvo viya animittassa animittanāmadānābhāvoti sakkā vattuṃ animittavimokkhassa
analyzed: magga adhipati nāmadāna abhāvaḥ viya animittassa animitta nāmadāna abhāvaḥ ti sakkā vattum a nimitta vimokkhassa
translated: It can be said that the signless has no name of signless, as the path has no name of overlord.🔽Because the signless deliverance has no signlessness.

original: ananimittatāya abhāvato. Maggo adhipati etesanti ca maggādhipatinoti yutto tattha
analyzed: an animitta tāya abhāvataḥ maggaḥ adhipati etesanti ca magga adhipatino ti yuttaḥ tattha
translated: And it is proper to say that the path is the overlord of these, thus they are “having the path as overlord.”

original: chandacittehi taṃsampayuttānaṃ maggādhipatibhāvābhāvo. Idha pana maggo animittaṃ
analyzed: chanda cittehi tad sampayuttānam magga adhipati bhāva abhāvaḥ idha pana maggaḥ animittam
translated: But in the case of zeal and consciousness, the path is not their overlord.🔽But here the meaning “the path is signless for him” is not possible.

original: etassāti maggānimittoti ayamattho na sambhavatīti na tena amaggena maggassa animittabhāvo
analyzed: etassa ati magga animittaḥ ti ayam atthaḥ na sambhavati iti na tena amaggena maggassa animitta bhāvaḥ
translated: So the path is not tenable as signless because of that non-path.🔽Or what is the common property here?

original: na yujjati, kiṃ vā ettha sāmaññaṃ adhippetanti. Amaggaṅgamagganāmābhāvo. Yathā satipi🔽adhipatibhāve chandacittānaṃ na maggādhipatīti magganāmaṃ, na ca tehi maggassa tesaṃ
analyzed: na yujjati kim vā ettha sāmaññam adhippetanti a magga aṅga magga nāma abhāvaḥ yathā sati pi  adhipati bhāve chanda cittānam na magga adhipati iti magga nāmam na ca tehi maggassa tesam
translated: The absence of the name “path” for a factor of the path.

original: amaggaṅgattā, tathā satipi saddhāya āgamanabhāvena tassā animittanti magganāmaṃ,
analyzed: a maggaṅga ttā tathā sati pi saddhāya āgamana bhāvena tassā animittam ti magga nāmam
translated: Just as, although zeal and consciousness are overlords, they do not have the name “path” because they are not overlords of the path as regards zeal and consciousness, and the path does not have their name because they are not path factors as regards them,🔽so although faith is signless because of its arrival in the signless, the path does not have its name because it is not a path factor as regards it.🔽So the path is not tenable as signless because of that non-path.

original: na ca tāya maggassa tassā amaggaṅgattā. Evaṃ animittavipassanāyapi animittabhāvo
analyzed: na ca tāya maggassa tassāḥ a maggaṅga ttā evam animitta vipassanāya api animitta bhāvaḥ
translated: And so too in the case of insight that is signless.

original: nippariyāyena natthīti dīpito hoti.
analyzed: nippariyāyena natthi iti dīpitaḥ hoti
translated: but in the ultimate sense it is shown that there is not.

original: Nanu ca idha jhānaṃ suññatādināmena vuttaṃ, na maggoti ce? Na, maggasampayogato jhānassa
analyzed: nanu ca idha jhānam suññatā ādi nāmena vuttam na maggo ti ce na magga sampayogato jhānassa
translated: But has not jhāna been called emptiness, etc., here, not the path? —It is so called because of its association with the path,

original: suññatādināmakattā. Suttantapariyāyena saguṇārammaṇehi idha abhidhammepi nāmaṃ labhatīti
analyzed: suññata ādi nāmaka ttā suttanta pariyāyena sa guṇa ārammaṇehi idha abhidhamme pi nāmam labhati iti
translated: and because of the words of the sutta, which is a source of what is accepted in the Abhidhamma, they say. That is why it is denied in the commentarial exegesis.

original: āhaṃsu. Tasmā paṭikkhittā “na pana labhantī”ti. Kiṃ kāraṇā? Abhidhamme sarasaṃ anāmasitvā
analyzed: āhaṃsu tasmā paṭikkhittāḥ na pana labhanti iti kim kāraṇā abhidhamme sarasam an āmasitvā
translated: Why? —The intention is this: the name is not obtained in the Abhidhamma by the method of the sutta, but by the method of the opposite.

original: paccanīkatova nāmalābhāti adhippāyo. Yo hi saguṇārammaṇehi nāmalābho, so sarasappadhāno
analyzed: paccanīkato va nāma lābhā ti adhippāyaḥ yaḥ hi sa guṇa ārammaṇehi nāma lābhaḥ so sa rasa ppadhāno
translated: For the name obtained by the method of the sutta is a name obtained by the method of the associated object.

original: hoti. Saraseneva ca nāmalābhe sabbamaggānaṃ suññatādibhāvoti vavatthānaṃ na siyā.
analyzed: hoti sa rasena iva ca nāma lābhe sabba maggānam suñña tā ādi bhāvaḥ ti vavatthānam na siyā
translated: And if the name were obtained by the method of the associated object, then all the paths would have to be defined as emptiness, etc.,🔽because of the words, “The path is the emptiness of permanence, etc., and of the view of permanence, etc.” .

original: Tasmā abhidhamme satipi dvīhi nāmalābhe paccanīkato nāmavavatthānakaraṃ gahitanti
analyzed: tasmai abhidhamme sati pi dvīhi nāma lābhe paccanīkataḥ nāma vavatthāna karam gahitanti
translated: So although the name is obtained in two ways in the Abhidhamma, it is taken as defined by the method of the opposite.🔽That is why it is said that the path of emptiness and the path of desireless- ness do not obtain their names by the method of the associated object.

original: saguṇārammaṇehi suññatāppaṇihitamaggā nāmaṃ na labhantīti āha. Atha vā na pana labhantīti
analyzed: sa guṇa ārammaṇehi suñña tā appaṇihita maggāḥ nāmam na labhanti iti āha atha vā na pana labhanti iti
translated: Or alternatively, the words “But they do not” can be explained as follows.

original: aññanirapekkhehi saguṇārammaṇehi na labhanti. Kiṃ kāraṇā? Abhidhamme sarasapaccanīkehi🔽sahitehi nāmalābhāti attho. Paccanīkañhi vavatthānakaraṃ anapekkhitvā kevalassa sarasassa🔽nāmahetubhāvo abhidhamme natthi avavatthānāpattito. Tasmā attābhinivesapaṇidhipaṭipakkhavipassanānulomā
analyzed: añña nirapekkhehi sa guṇa ārammaṇehi na labhanti kim kāraṇā abhidhamme sa rasa paccanīkehi  sahitehi nāma lābhā ati attho paccanīkam hi vavatthāna karam an apekkhitvā kevalassa sarasassa  nāma hetu bhāvaḥ abhidhamme natthi avavatthāna āpattito tasmai attā abhinivesa paṇidhi paṭipakkha vipassanā anulomā
translated: They do not get a name from mere qualities that are not dependent on anything else. Why is that? Because in the Abhidhamma

original: maggā satipi sarasantare paccanīkasahitena sarasena nāmaṃ labhanti. Animittamaggassa
analyzed: maggā sati pi sara santare paccanīka sahitena sa rasena nāmam labhanti a nimitta maggassa
translated: the mere quality does not get a name unless it is accompanied by the opposite of the mere quality. For in the Abhidhamma there is no such thing as a mere quality being a cause for a name without depending on a definition that is its opposite. Therefore, although the supramundane paths are accompanied by mere qualities, they get a name from the mere quality accompanied by the opposite of the mere quality, which is the opposite of the clinging to self and the aspiration that is the opponent of insight.

original: pana vipassanā nimittapaṭipakkhā na hoti sayaṃ nimittaggahaṇato nimittaggahaṇānivāraṇāti
analyzed: pana vipassanā nimitta paṭipakkhā na hoti sayam nimitta ggahaṇataḥ nimitta ggahaṇa a nivāraṇā ati
translated: But the path of the signless attainment is not the opposite of the sign because insight into the signless attainment is not the opposite of the sign, since it does not prevent the apprehension of the sign.

original: tadanulomamaggopi na nimittassa paṭipakkho. Yadi siyā, nimittagatavipassanāyapi paṭipakkho
analyzed: tad anuloma maggaḥ api na nimittassa paṭipakkhaḥ yadi siyā paṭipakkhaḥ
translated: And the path that is in conformity with that is not the opposite of the sign either. If it were, it would be the opposite of insight into the sign.

original: siyāti. Tasmā vijjamānopi saraso vavatthānakarapaccanīkābhāvā abhidhamme animittanti
analyzed: siyā ati tasmā vijjamānaḥ api sarasaḥ vavatthāna kara paccanīka abhāvā abhidhamme animittan ti
translated: Therefore, although the mere quality exists, it does not get the name “signless” in the Abhidhamma because there is no definition that is its opposite.

original: nāmadāyako na gahito. Aniccānupassanānulomo pana maggo suddhikapaṭipadānayeyeva saṅgahitoti
analyzed: nāma dāyakaḥ na gahitaḥ anicca anupassanā anulomaḥ pana maggo suddhika paṭipadā nayeya iva saṅgahito ti
translated: but the name-giver is not included. But the path that is in conformity with the contemplation of impermanence is to be regarded as included only by the method of mere effect.🔽And that is why the method is called “that” .

original: daṭṭhabbo. Tasmā eva ca so nayo vuttoti. Evanti yaṃ vakkhati “aniccato vuṭṭhahantassa
analyzed: daṭṭhabbaḥ tasmai eva ca saḥ nayaḥ vutto ti evam ti yam vakkhati aniccataḥ vuṭṭhahantassa
translated: And so, taking it as he will say, “When he emerges from the contemplation of impermanence,

original: maggo animitto hotī”ti, evaṃ āharitvā aṭṭhakathācariyehi so animittamaggo dīpitoti attho.
analyzed: maggaḥ animittaḥ hoti iti evam āharitvā aṭṭhakathā cariyehi so animitta maggaḥ dīpitaḥ iti attho
translated: the path is signless,” the meaning is that the path of the signless has been shown by the teachers of the commentary.

original: Vuṭṭhāna…pe… kimārammaṇāti aniccādito vuṭṭhahantassa vuṭṭhānagāminiyā lakkhaṇārammaṇatte
analyzed: vuṭṭhāna pe kim ārammaṇā ti anicca āditaḥ vuṭṭhahantassa vuṭṭhāna gāminiyā lakkhaṇa ārammaṇa tte
translated: When he emerges … what is its object? When he emerges from the contemplation of impermanence, etc., if he has the characteristics as his object,

original: sati saṅkhārehi vuṭṭhānaṃ na siyā, saṅkhārārammaṇatte ca lakkhaṇapaṭivedhoti maññamāno
analyzed: sati saṅkhārehi vuṭṭhānam na siyā saṅkhāra ārammaṇa tte ca lakkhaṇa paṭivedho ti maññamāno
translated: his emergence will not be from formations, and if he has formations as his object, there will be no penetration of the characteristics, thinking thus,

original: pucchati. “Anicca”ntiādinā saṅkhāresu pavattamānena ñāṇena lakkhaṇānipi paṭividdhāni
analyzed: pucchati aniccanti ādinā saṅkhāresu pavattamānena ñāṇena lakkhaṇāni pi paṭividdhāni
translated: he asks the question. With the knowledge occurring in regard to formations as impermanent, etc., the characteristics are also penetrated,

original: honti tadākārasaṅkhāragahaṇatoti āha “lakkhaṇārammaṇā”ti. Saṅkhārārammaṇā eva yathāvuttādhippāyena
analyzed: honti tad ākāra saṅkhāra gahaṇato ti āha lakkhaṇa ārammaṇā ti saṅkhāra ārammaṇāḥ eva yathā vutta adhippāyena
translated: because of the inclusion of the formations in their aspect as those characteristics. Hence he says “with the characteristics as its object.” With formations as its object, in the way stated, is the meaning.

original: “lakkhaṇārammaṇā”ti vuttāti dassento “lakkhaṇaṃ nāmā”tiādimāha. Aniccatā dukkhatā
analyzed: lakkhaṇa ārammaṇā iti vuttā iti dassentaḥ lakkhaṇam nāma ati ādim āha anicca tā dukkha tā
translated: “The characteristic is the object” is said. Showing this, he says, “The characteristic is called ….” Impermanence, suffering,

original: anattatāti hi visuṃ gayhamānaṃ lakkhaṇaṃ paññattigatikaṃ paramatthato avijjamānaṃ,
analyzed: anatta tā ati hi visum gayhamānam lakkhaṇam paññatti gatikam paramatthataḥ a vijjamānam
translated: and non-self are the characteristic when taken separately. They are conceptual, and in the ultimate sense they do not exist.

original: avijjamānattā eva parittādivasena navattabbadhammabhūtaṃ. Tasmā visuṃ gahetabbassa
analyzed: eva paritta ādi vasena navattabba dhamma bhūtam tasmā visum gahetabbassa
translated: Because they do not exist, they are not to be taken as phenomena that can be spoken of in terms of limited and so forth. Therefore, because the characteristic that is to be taken separately

original: lakkhaṇassa paramatthato abhāvā “aniccaṃ dukkhamanattā”ti saṅkhāre sabhāvato sallakkhentova
analyzed: lakkhaṇassa paramatthataḥ abhāvā aniccam dukkham anattā ati saṅkhāre sabhāvataḥ sallakkhentaḥ iva
translated: does not exist in the ultimate sense, one contemplates the formations as they really are by means of “impermanent, suffering, non-self.”

original: lakkhaṇāni sallakkheti nāmāti āha “yo pana aniccaṃ dukkhamanattāti tīṇi lakkhaṇāni
analyzed: lakkhaṇāni sallakkhā iti nāma ati āha yaḥ pana aniccam dukkham anattā ati tīṇi lakkhaṇāni
translated: Thus it is said: “But one who contemplates the three characteristics of impermanence, suffering, and non-self”

original: sallakkhetī”ti. Yasmā ca aniccantiādinā saṅkhārāva dissamānā, tasmā te kaṇṭhe baddhakuṇapaṃ🔽viya paṭinissajjanīyā honti.
analyzed: sallakkheti iti yasmā ca aniccanti ādinā saṅkhārā ava dissamānā tasmā te kaṇṭhe baddha kuṇapam  viya paṭinissajjanīyāḥ honti
translated: And because the formations are seen by means of “impermanent” and so forth, therefore they are to be rejected like a corpse bound to one’s neck.

original: Lokuttarakusalaṃ
analyzed: lokuttara kusalam
translated: The supramundane wholesome

original: Pakiṇṇakakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: pakiṇṇaka kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The commentary on the miscellaneous section

original: Tatrāti lokuttarajjhāne. Ajjhattañcāti upaḍḍhagāthāya abhinivisitabbaṃ vuṭṭhātabbaṃ
analyzed: tatra ati lokuttara jhāne ajjhattam ca ati upaḍḍha gāthāya abhinivisitabbam vuṭṭhātabbam
translated: There, in the supramundane jhāna, one should enter and emerge from the half-verse “internally” and so forth.

original: vipassanābhūmiṃ pañcadhā uddisati. Sattaaṭṭhādīni aṅgāni sattaṭṭhaṅgānīti ādisaddassa
analyzed: vipassanā bhūmim pañcadhā uddisati satta aṭṭha ādīni aṅgāni satta ṭṭhaṅgāni iti ādi saddassa
translated: He defines the plane of insight in five ways. The words “the factors of the first jhāna, etc., are seven, eight” should be

original: lopo daṭṭhabbo. Nimittanti yato vuṭṭhānaṃ, tāni nimittapavattāni nimittavacaneneva
analyzed: lopaḥ daṭṭhabbaḥ nimittam ti yatas vuṭṭhānam tāni nimitta pavattāni nimitta vacanena iva
translated: regarded as abbreviated. The “sign” is the sign of resolution, and he defines that by the words “sign” and “arising.”

original: uddisati. Saṅkhārupekkhāñāṇameva ariyamaggassa bojjhaṅgādivisesaṃ niyameti. Kasmā?🔽Tato tato dutiyādipādakajjhānato uppannassa sasaṅkhārupekkhāñāṇassa pādakajjhānātikkantānaṃ
analyzed: uddisati saṅkhāra upekkhā ñāṇam eva ariya maggassa bojjhaṅga ādi visesam niyameti kasmā  tatas tatas dutiya ādi pādakajjhānato uppannassa sa saṅkhāra upekkhā ñāṇassa pādakajjhāna atikkantānam
translated: The knowledge of equanimity about formations determines the distinction of the noble path as the enlightenment factor, etc. Why?🔽Because the knowledge of equanimity about formations that arises from the second and subsequent basic jhānas, etc., does not have the virtue of being developed by the desire to attain the jhāna factors that transcend the basic jhānas,

original: aṅgānaṃ asamāpajjitukāmatāvirāgabhāvanābhāvato itarassa ca atabbhāvato. Tesampi vādesu…pe…
analyzed: aṅgānam a samāpajjitu kāma tā virāga bhāvanā bhāvataḥ itarassa ca a tabbhāvataḥ tesam pi
translated: and because the knowledge of equanimity about formations that arises from the first jhāna, etc., does not have the virtue of being developed by the desire to attain the jhāna factors that transcend the first jhāna, etc.🔽Or in the case of the other theories, etc.,

original: vipassanāva niyametīti veditabbā. Kasmā? Vipassanāniyameneva hi paṭhamattheravādepi
analyzed: vipassanā ava niyameti iti veditabbā kasmā vipassanā niyamena iva hi paṭhama tthera vāde pi
translated: it should be understood that insight determines the distinction of the noble path as the enlightenment factor, etc. Why?

original: apādakapaṭhamajjhānapādakamaggā paṭhamajjhānikāva honti, itare ca pādakajjhānavipassanāniyamehi
analyzed: a pādaka paṭhamajjhāna pādaka maggā paṭhamajjhānikā va honti itare ca pādaka jjhāna vipassanā niyamehi
translated: Because in the first elder’s theory, too, the path that has the first jhāna as its support and the path that has no jhāna as its support are both of the first jhāna,

original: taṃtaṃjhānikā. Evaṃ sesavādesupi vipassanāniyamo yathāsambhavaṃ yojetabbo.
analyzed: evam sesa vādesu pi vipassanā niyamaḥ yathāsambhavam yojetabbaḥ
translated: and the others are of the respective jhānas according to the jhāna and insight that are their supports. So too in the other theories.

original: Pakiṇṇakasaṅkhāreti pādakajjhānato aññasaṅkhāre. Tena pādakajjhānasaṅkhāresu sammasitesu
analyzed: pakiṇṇaka saṅkhāra iti pādaka jjhānataḥ añña saṅkhāre tena pādaka jjhāna saṅkhāresu sammasitesu
translated: ‘Other kinds of formations’ are those other than the basic jhāna. By that he shows that there is nothing to be done with the formations that are investigated in the basic jhāna.🔽‘There too’: in the second elder’s view.

original: vattabbameva natthīti dasseti. Tatrāpīti dutiyattheravādepi. Taṃtaṃjhānikatā taṃtaṃsammasitasaṅkhāravipassanāniyamehi
analyzed: vattabbam eva natthi iti dasseti tatra api iti dutiya thera vāde pi taṃ taṃ jhānika tā taṃ taṃ sammasita saṅkhāra vipassanā niyamehi
translated: It is because of the kind of jhāna and because of the investigation of the formations that the path is of the kind of the jhāna and of the kind of insight.

original: hoti. Tatrāpi hi vipassanā taṃtaṃvirāgāvirāgabhāvanābhāvena somanassasahagatā upekkhāsahagatā
analyzed: hoti tatra api hi vipassanā taṃ taṃ virāga avirāga bhāvanā bhāvena somanassa sahagatā upekkhā sahagatā
translated: For in that case too the insight is accompanied by joy and accompanied by equanimity, according as there is fading of greed or not, and it makes the path of the kind of the jhāna factors, etc.,

original: ca hutvā jhānaṅgādiniyamaṃ maggassa karotīti evaṃ vipassanāniyamo vuttanayeneva veditabbo.🔽Tanti taṃtaṃjhānasadisabhavanaṃ. Svāyamattho pādakajjhānasammasitajjhānupanissayehi🔽vinā ajjhāsayamattena asijjhanā upanissayena vinā saṅkappamattena sakadāgāmiphalādīnaṃ
analyzed: ca hutvā jhāna aṅga ādi niyamam maggassa karoti iti evam vipassanā niyamaḥ vutta nayena iva veditabbaḥ  tanti taṃ taṃ jhāna sadisa bhavanam pādaka jhāna sammasita jhāna upanissayehi  vinā ajjhāsaya mattena upanissayena vinā saṅkappa mattena sakadāgāmi phala ādīnam
translated: So the kind of insight should be understood in the way stated.🔽‘That’: the kind of development like the kind of jhāna. This meaning should be illustrated by the Nandaka Sutta, which illustrates the fact that the fruit of once return, etc., is not entered upon and dwelt in by mere aspiration without the support of the basic jhāna and the jhāna arisen from the investigation of formations,🔽and by the fact that it is not entered upon and dwelt in by mere aspiration without the support of the kind of insight that is the development of the fading away of greed, etc.,

original: asijjhanadīpakena nandakovādena dīpetabbo. Tattha hi sotāpannāyapi paripuṇṇasaṅkappabhāvaṃ
analyzed: nandaka uvādena dīpetabbo tattha hi paripuṇṇa saṅkappa bhāvam
translated: Herein, the state of one who has entered upon the fruit of stream-entry is complete aspiration.

original: vadantena bhagavatā yassa yassa upanissayo atthi, tassa tasseva ajjhāsayo niyāmako,
analyzed: vadantena bhagavatā yassa yassa upanissayaḥ atthi tassa tassa iva ajjhāsayaḥ niyāmako
translated: When the Blessed One said this, he showed that the intention of each of those who have the requisite support is the determining condition for the arising of the path,

original: nāññassāti tena tena paripuṇṇasaṅkappatā hoti, na tato paraṃ saṅkappasabbhāvepi asijjhanatoti🔽ayamattho dīpito hoti. Evamidhāpi yassa yassa dutiyādijhānikassa maggassa yathāvutto
analyzed: na aññassa ati tena tena paripuṇṇa saṅkappa tā hoti na tato param saṅkappa sabbhāve pi a sijjhanato ti  ayam atthaḥ dīpitaḥ hoti evam idha api yassa yassa dutiya ādi jhānikassa maggassa yathā vutto
translated: not that of any other, since there is no overstepping of the intention in the absence of the requisite support.

original: upanissayo atthi, tassa tasseva ajjhāsayo niyāmako, nāññassa satipi tasmiṃ asijjhanato.
analyzed: upanissayaḥ atthi tassa tassa iva ajjhāsayaḥ niyāmakaḥ na aññassa tasmin
translated: So the meaning here is shown in this way. And so too in the case of the second jhāna, etc., the intention of each of those who have the requisite support as already described is the determining condition for the arising of the path, not that of any other, since there is no overstepping of the intention in the absence of the requisite support.

original: Imasmiṃ pana vāde pādakasammasitajjhānupanissayasabbhāve ajjhāsayo ekantena hoti,
analyzed: imasmin pana vāde pādaka sammasita jhāna upanissaya sabbhāve ajjhāsayo ekantena hoti
translated: But in this theory the intention is invariably the determining condition for the requisite support for the basic jhāna,

original: taṃtaṃphalūpanissayasabbhāve taṃtaṃsaṅkappo viyāti tadabhāvābhāvato ajjhāsayo niyametīti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: taṃ taṃ phala upanissaya sabbhāve taṃ taṃ saṅkappaḥ viyāti tad abhāva abhāvataḥ ajjhāsayaḥ niyameti iti vuttam
translated: and the intention is invariably the determining condition for the requisite support for the respective fruit in the absence of the respective fruit.

original: Yasmiṃ pana pādakajjhānaṃ natthīti catutthajjhānikavajjānaṃ pādakāni lokiyajjhānāni
analyzed: yasmim pana pādaka jhānam na atthi iti catuttha jhānika vajjānam pādakāni lokiya jhānāni
translated: But when it is said that there is no basic jhāna in the case of the path of the third and higher paths, it is said with reference to the mundane jhāna that is the basic jhāna for the supramundane jhāna.

original: sandhāya vuttaṃ. Appanāppatti ca oḷārikaṅgātikkamanupanissayābhāve pañcahi aṅgehi
analyzed: sandhāya vuttam appanā appatti ca oḷārika ṅga atikkaman upanissaya abhāve pañcahi aṅgehi
translated: And the attainment of absorption is invariably the determining condition for the requisite support for the basic jhāna in the absence of the requisite support for the surmounting of grossness.

original: vinā na hotīti “somanassasahagatamaggo hotī”ti āha. Upekkhāsahagatamaggoti etena
analyzed: vinā na hoti iti somanassa sahagata maggo hoti iti āha upekkhā sahagata maggo ti etena
translated: “He is accompanied by joy” means that the path is accompanied by joy.

original: catutthajjhānikatāpi samānā anusayasamugghāṭanasamatthassa na saṅkhārāvasesatāti🔽dasseti. Te ca vādā na virujjhanti ajjhāsayavasena pañcamajjhānikatāya paṭhamādijjhānikatāya🔽ca sambhavatoti adhippāyo. Ajjhāsayo ca sātthako hoti, aññathā pādakasammasitajjhāneheva
analyzed: catuttha jhānika tā api samānā anusaya samugghāṭana samatthassa na saṅkhāra avasesa tā ti  te ca vādāḥ na virujjhanti ajjhāsaya vasena pañcama jhānika tāya paṭhama ādi jhānika tāya  ca sambhavato ti adhippāyaḥ ajjhāsayo ca sātthakaḥ hoti aññathā pādaka sammasita jjhānehi iva
translated: “Accompanied by equanimity” means that although it is of the fourth jhāna, it is not incapable of uprooting the underlying tendencies,🔽because it is not accompanied by formations. The intention is that these statements are not contradicted, because it is possible for the path to be of the fifth jhāna according to the inclination of the meditator, and of the first, second, etc., jhānas.

original: niyamassa siddhattā ajjhāsayo niyāmako vuccamāno niratthako siyāti. Idha pana aṭṭhasāliniyā🔽niyāmane ekantikaṃ vipassanāsaṅkhātaṃ atthameva uddharitvā “tesampi vādesu ayaṃ…pe…
analyzed: niyamassa siddha ttā ajjhāsayaḥ niyāmakaḥ vuccamānaḥ niratthako siyāti idha pana aṭṭhasāliniyā  niyāmane ekantikam vipassanā saṅkhātam attham eva uddharitvā tesam pi vādesu ayaṃ pe
translated: And the inclination is fruitful, otherwise, since the rule would be established by the jhāna that is the basis for the path, the inclination would be useless if stated as the determiner.🔽But here in the determination by the method of the eight terms, the meaning of insight alone is extracted from the rule, and it is said: “In these statements too … insight alone determines.”

original: vipassanāva niyametī”ti vadantena tayopete vāde vipassanāva niyametīti dassitaṃ.
analyzed: vipassanā ava niyameti iti vadantena tayā upete vāde vipassanā ava niyameti iti dassitam
translated: Thus it is shown that in the three statements insight alone determines.

original: Taṃtaṃvādānañhi vipassanāsahitānameva siddhi, nāññathāti dassitanti.
analyzed: taṃ taṃ vādānam hi vipassanā sahitānam eva siddhi na aññathā ti dassitan ti
translated: For the success of these statements is only when they are accompanied by insight, not otherwise.

original: Pavedhatīti gotrabhussa paccayo bhavituṃ na sakkotīti attho. Yadi pañcamacittakkhaṇe
analyzed: pavedhati iti gotrabhussa paccayaḥ bhavitum na sakkoti iti atthaḥ yadi pañcama citta kkhaṇe
translated: If impulsion has occurred at the moment of the fifth consciousness,

original: javanaṃ patitaṃ nāma hoti, kathaṃ tadā gotrabhu tadanantarañca maggo javanassa patitakkhaṇe🔽uppajjatīti? Apubbassa javanantarassa patitatābhāvato. Tadeva hi javanaṃ anekakkhattuṃ
analyzed: javanam patitam nāma hoti katham tadā gotrabhu tad anantaram ca maggaḥ javanassa patita kkhaṇe  uppajjati iti apubbassa javana antarassa patita tā bhāvataḥ tat eva hi javanam aneka kkhattum
translated: how can the prenascent and the path arise at the moment of the impulsion?🔽Because there is no occurrence of a new impulsion after the impulsion.

original: pavattamānaṃ patitaṃ siyāti, gotrabhu pana ārammaṇantare uppannaṃ apubbaṃ javanaṃ,
analyzed: pavattamānam patitam siyāti gotrabhu pana ārammaṇa antare uppannam apubbam javanam
translated: For that same impulsion may occur many times, and then it would be “prenascent.” But the prenascent is a new impulsion that has arisen with a different object,🔽and so is the path, since it belongs to a different stage.

original: tathā maggo bhūmantarato cāti. Nanu ca sattamajavanacetanāya balavatāya upapajjavedanīyabhāvo🔽hoti ānantariyatāpīti, tatthāyaṃ adhippāyo siyā “paṭisandhiyā anantarapaccayabhāvino
analyzed: tathā maggaḥ bhūmantarataḥ ca ati nanu ca sattama javana cetanāya balavatāya upapajja vedanīya bhāvaḥ  hoti ānantariya tā api iti tattha ayam adhippāyaḥ siyā paṭisandhiyā anantara paccaya bhāvino
translated: But is it not the case that because of the strength of the seventh impulsion-consciousness, the action is of such a kind that it is ripening in the next existence?

original: vipākasantānassa anantarapaccayabhāvena antimajavanacetanāya susaṅkhatattā sā sattamajavanacetanā
analyzed: vipāka santānassa anantara paccaya bhāvena antima javana cetanāya su saṅkhata ttā sā sattama javana cetanā
translated: The intention here may be this: “Because of the extreme compactness of the impulsion-consciousness that is immediately next to the rebirth-linking, the continuity of the ripening is next to the condition being immediately next to rebirth-linking. That seventh impulsion-consciousness

original: upapajjavedanīyā ānantarikā ca hoti, na apatitajavanacetanā viya balavatāyā”ti.
analyzed: upapajja vedanīyā ānantarikā ca hoti na a patita javana cetanā balavatā āyāti
translated: and it is the next-to-last, not the impulsion consciousness that is the cause of rebirth-linking, as is the case with a strong man’s thought of jumping, for example” .

original: Puna anulomaṃ taṃ anubandheyyāti gotrabhussa hi saṅkhārārammaṇatte sati tadapi anulomamevāti
analyzed: punar anulomam tam anubandheyya ati gotrabhuḥ sa hi saṅkhāra ārammaṇa tte sati tat api anulomam eva ati
translated: “It would follow in conformity with the preceding” : for when the formations have the truth of suffering as their object, then that is in conformity with the preceding.

original: purimaanulomaṃ viya taṃ tadapi aññaṃ anulomaṃ anubandheyya, na maggoti maggavuṭṭhānameva
analyzed: purima anulomam viya tam tat api aññam anulomam anubandheyya na maggo ti magga vuṭṭhānam eva
translated: So it would follow in conformity with that, which is another conformity, not with the path. And there would be no emergence from the path.

original: ca na bhaveyya attano sadisālambanassa āvajjanaṭṭhāniyassa paccayassa alābhā. Appahīnabhāvena
analyzed: ca na bhaveyya attano sadisa ālambanassa āvajjana ṭṭhāniyassa paccayassa alābhā appahīna bhāvena
translated: Because there would be no condition in the form of adverting, which has the same object as the preceding conformity.

original: pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu anusayitā kilesā sā bhūmi etehi laddhāti katvā bhūmiladdhā.
analyzed: pañcasu upādānakkhandhesu anusayitā kilesā sā bhūmi etehi laddhā ati katvā bhūmi laddhā
translated: The defilements that lie latent in the five aggregates that are not yet abandoned are called “latent in the plane.”

original: Vaṭṭaṃ sinonti bandhantīti katvā vaṭṭasetū ca, tesaṃ samugghātakaraṇantipi etadevassa🔽lobhakkhandhādipadālanaṃ vuccati. Tanti pavattaṃ. Ekaṃ bhavanti anāgāmino anekakkhattuñca
analyzed: vaṭṭam sinonti bandhanti iti katvā vaṭṭa setū ca tesam etat evassa  lobha kkhandha ādi padālanam vuccati ekam bhavanti anāgāminaḥ aneka khattum ca
translated: They are called “bridges of the round” because they bind the round. The act of “removing them” is

original: tattheva upapajjantassa heṭṭhā anāgamanavasena eko bhavoti gahetvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tattha iva upapajjantassa heṭṭhā anāgamana vasena ekaḥ bhavaḥ ti gahetvā vuttam
translated: called “crushing the mass of greed, etc.” “That” is the round. “One becoming” : non-returners are called “one-becoming” because they take rebirth only once more, or because they have only one more becoming, since they do not return to this world.

original: Imassa panatthassāti yathāvuttassa upādinnakapavattato vuṭṭhānassa. Apāyesu sattamabhavato
analyzed: imassa pana atthassa ati yathā vuttassa upādinnaka pavattataḥ vuṭṭhānassa apāyesu sattama bhavataḥ
translated: ‘For this purpose’: for the purpose of the emergence from the occurrence of what is clung to.

original: uddhaṃ sugatiyañca vipākadāyakassa abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇassa paccayaghāto sotāpattimaggañāṇena🔽abhisaṅkhāraviññāṇassa nirodho daṭṭhabbo. Dvīsu bhavesūti anāgāmimagge abhāvite sakadāgāmissa
analyzed: uddham sugatiyam ca vipāka dāyakassa abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇassa paccaya ghāto sotāpatti magga ñāṇena  abhisaṅkhāra viññāṇassa nirodho daṭṭhabbaḥ dvīsu bhavesu iti anāgāmi magge abhāvite sakadāgāmissa
translated: The destruction of the condition for the resultant consciousness that occurs in the happy destinies after the seventh existence in the unhappy destinies,🔽which is the consciousness that occurs as a result of kamma that gives results in the unhappy destinies, should be seen as the cessation of the resultant consciousness,

original: kāmadhātuyaṃ ye dve bhavā uppajjeyyuṃ, tesūti attho. Calatīti etena calanasabhāvameva
analyzed: ye dve bhavāḥ uppajjeyyum tesu iti attho calati iti etena calana sabhāvam eva
translated: which is due to the path of stream-entry. ‘In the two existences’: if the path of non-return is not developed, the two existences that would arise in the sense-desire realm are meant.

original: dasseti, na acalanābhāvaṃ, tasmā acalanaṃ dassetvā puna calanaṃ dassetuṃ “tathāgatassa🔽hī”tiādimāha. Yepi vā katthaci cattāropi magge samānapaṭipade disvā sabhāvato acalanameva
analyzed: dasseti na a calana abhāvam tasmai acalanam dassetvā puna calanam dassetum tathāgatassa  hi iti ādim āha ye pi vā katthaci cattāraḥ api magge samāna paṭipade disvā sabhāvataḥ acalanam eva
translated: ‘It moves’ shows only the nature of moving, not the absence of not moving. Therefore, after showing the not moving, he says ‘Tathāgata’s …’ in order to show the moving again.

original: gaṇheyyuṃ, tesaṃ taṃgahaṇanivāraṇatthaṃ “calatī”ti vuttaṃ, na calanāvadhāraṇatthanti
analyzed: gaṇheyyum tesam taṃ gahaṇa nivāraṇa attham calati iti vuttam na calana avadhāraṇa attham ti
translated: Or, in order to prevent those who, having seen the four paths as having the same practice, would take the not moving as the nature of all, he says ‘It moves’ for the purpose of showing the moving, not for the purpose of showing the moving only.

original: yuttaṃ ubhayadassanaṃ. Atha vā yadipi kesañci cattāropi maggā samānapaṭipadā, tathāpi
analyzed: yuttam ubhaya dassanam atha vā yadi pi cattāro api maggā samāna paṭipadā tathā api
translated: Or, although the paths of some are the same in practice,

original: kilesindriyehi sijjhamānā paṭipadā tesaṃ vasena calanapakatikā evāti “calati”cceva
analyzed: kilesa indriyehi sijjhamānā paṭipadā tesam vasena calana pakatikā eva ati calati icca iva
translated: the practice is still wavering by nature in accordance with the defilements and faculties that are being overcome, and so it is said to “waver”

original: vuttaṃ, na “na calatī”ti.
analyzed: vuttam na na calati iti
translated: and not “not to waver.”

original: Lokuttarakusalapakiṇṇakakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
translated: The commentary on the “Miscellaneous” section on the supramundane profitable is ended.

original: Paṭhamamaggavīsatimahānayavaṇṇanā
translated: The twenty-one great exercises in the case of the first path

original: 357. Yassa pubbabhāge “maggaṃ bhāvemī”ti ajjhāsayo pavatto, so maggaṃ bhāveti. Evaṃ sabbattha ajjhāsayavisesena taṃtaṃbhāvanāviseso daṭṭhabbo.🔽358. Chandādhipateyyantiādīsu ekacittakkhaṇe vattamānesu dhammesu kathaṃ chandassa
analyzed: yassa pubba bhāge maggam bhāvemi iti ajjhāsayaḥ pavatto saḥ maggam bhāveti evam sabbattha ajjhāsaya visesena taṃ taṃ bhāvanā visesaḥ daṭṭhabbo  chanda ādhipateyya ntiādīsu eka cittakkhaṇe vattamānesu dhammesu katham chandassa
translated: . He who has the aspiration “I shall develop the path” in the prior stage develops the path. So the difference in the development should be understood in each case according to the difference in the aspiration.🔽In the case of “with predominance of desire” and so on, how is it that desire, which occurs in a single conscious moment together with the states that occur then,

original: taṃsahajātassa adhipatibhāvo vīriyādīnañcāti? Upanissayavasena. Yassa hi sace chandavato
analyzed: tad sahajātassa adhipati bhāvaḥ vīriya ādīnam ca ati upanissaya vasena yassa hi sace chandavato
translated: is the dominant? And how is it that energy, etc., are? It is by way of decisive support. For when a profitable state arises in one who has desire,

original: kusalaṃ nipphajjati, “ahaṃ nipphādessāmī”ti pavattamānassa kusalaṃ nipphannaṃ, tassa
analyzed: kusalam nipphajjati aham nipphādessāmi iti pavattamānassa kusalam nipphannam tassa
translated: and when the profitable state has arisen, he thinks, “I have made it arise.”

original: taṃsahajāto chando tena purimupanissayena visiṭṭho sahajātadhamme attano vase vatteti.
analyzed: tad sahajātaḥ chandaḥ tena purima upanissayena visiṭṭhaḥ sahajāta dhamme attanaḥ vase vatteti
translated: and the desire that is conascent with it is distinguished by that prior decisive-support condition, and it makes the conascent states come into being in its own way.

original: Tasmiñca pavattamāne te pavattanti, nivattamāne nivattanti, tadanurūpabalā ca honti
analyzed: tasmin ca pavattamāne te pavattanti nivattamāne nivattanti tad anurūpa balā ca honti
translated: And when it is occurring, they occur, and when it is ceasing, they cease, and they are powerful in proportion to it,

original: rājapurisā viyāti. Evaṃ vīriyādīsu. Sesadhammānaṃ pana katthaci vuttappakārappavattisabbhāvepi
analyzed: rāja purisāḥ viyā ti evam vīriya ādīsu sesa dhammānam pana katthaci vutta ppakāra ppavatti sabbhāve pi
translated: like the king’s men. So too with energy, and so on. But in the case of the remaining states, although they occur in the way already stated,

original: ataṃsabhāvattā adhipatibhāvo natthīti daṭṭhabbo.
analyzed: a taṃsa bhāva ttā adhipati bhāvaḥ na atthi iti daṭṭhabbo
translated: their state of predominance is not present because of their not being of that nature.

original: Dutiyamaggavaṇṇanā
analyzed: dutiya magga vaṇṇanā
translated: The second path

original: 361. Ā-kārassa rassattaṃ katvā aññindriyaṃ vuttaṃ, ā-kāro ca dhammamariyādattho.
analyzed: ākārassa rassa ttam katvā aññindriyam vuttaṃ ākāro ca
translated: The other faculty is stated with the letter ā, which is the first letter of the word ariya, and ariya is the meaning of dhamma.

original: Tatiyacatutthamaggavaṇṇanā🔽362. Maggaṅgāni na pūrenti akiccakattā sammādiṭṭhiyāti adhippāyo. Mārento gacchatīti
analyzed: tatiya catuttha magga vaṇṇanā  maggaṅgāni na pūrenti a kiccaka ttā sammādiṭṭhiyā ati adhippāyaḥ mārentaḥ gacchati iti
translated: The third and fourth paths

original: hi maggo, na cetāya māretabbaṃ atthīti. Mānassa diṭṭhisadisā pavatti ahamasmīti pavattamānassa
analyzed: hi maggaḥ na cetāya māretabbam atthi iti mānassa diṭṭhi sadisā pavatti aham asmi iti pavatta mānassa
translated: The intention is this: the path factors do not fulfil their function because of the non-performance of right view. For a path is that by which one goes, and there is nothing to be gone by means of view. The occurrence of the conceit “I am” is like that of wrong view.

original: diṭṭhiṭṭhāne ṭhānaṃ. Ālokasseva pavattikālo viyāti cirappavattiṃ sandhāyāha. Ekadesasāmaññena
analyzed: diṭṭhi ṭhāne ṭhānam ālokassa iva pavatti kālaḥ viya iti cira ppavattim sandhāya āha eka desa sāmaññena
translated: For a simile is one in which there is a similarity in some one part .🔽In the lye is in the lye of ashes of wood, etc.🔽Having kneaded is having soaked.

original: hi yathādhippetena upamā hotīti. Khāre vāti kaṭṭhādīnaṃ khāracchārikāyaṃ. Sammadditvāti🔽kiledetvā. Chandoti taṇhā. Anusayoti taṇhā mānānusayo ca. Etasmiñca sutte asamūhatassa
analyzed: hi yathā adhippetena upamā hoti iti khāre vāti khāra chārikāyam sammadditvā ati  kiledetvā chando ti taṇhā anusayo ti taṇhā māna anusayo ca etasmin ca sutte a samūhatassa
translated: Desire is craving.🔽Innate is both craving and the innate conceit.

original: gandhassa samugghāṭanaṃ viya asamūhatamānādisamugghātaṃ dassentena aññamaññe kilese
analyzed: gandhassa samugghāṭanam viya dassentena aññamaññe kilese
translated: And in this sutta the innate conceit, etc., are shown as abandoned by the abandoning of one by the other, as the smell that is not removed is removed by the removal of the wood, etc.

original: pajahatīti dassitanti ānītaṃ, na yathāvuttanayena upamāya vuttattāti daṭṭhabbaṃ.🔽Nirantaraṃ pavattamāne citte tassa saṃkilesavodānakarā sāvajjānavajjā cetasikā uppajjamānā
analyzed: pajahati iti dassitam ti ānītam na yathā vutta nayena upamāya vutta ttā ti daṭṭhabbam  nirantaram pavattamāne citte tassa saṃkilesa vodāna karā sāvajjā anavajjā cetasikā uppajjamānā
translated: It should be regarded as brought in thus, not as a simile stated in the way already described.

original: tassaṅgabhūtā avayavā viya hontīti “cittaṅgavasenā”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: tad saṅga bhūtāḥ avayavāḥ viya honti iti citta aṅga vasena ati vuttam
translated: When the mind occurs uninterruptedly, the blameworthy and the blameless mental states that are the cause of its defilement and purification are like its parts, its components.

original: Lokuttarakusalavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: lokuttara kusala vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the supramundane profitable is ended.

original: Kusalakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: kusala kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The description of the profitable is ended.

original: Akusalapadaṃ
analyzed: a kusala padam
translated: The unprofitable

original: Dhammuddesavāro
analyzed: dhammuddesa vāro
translated: The section on the exposition of the states

original: Paṭhamacittakathāvaṇṇanā
translated: The first kind of talk is that about the mind.

original: 365. Kusale vuttanayaṃ anugantvā yathānurūpaṃ veditabbatāya “vuttanayenā”ti āha.🔽Gantabbābhāvatoti bujjhitabbābhāvato. Diṭṭhiyā gatamattanti diṭṭhiyā gatimattaṃ gahaṇamattaṃ.
analyzed: kusale vutta nayam anugantvā yathānurūpam veditabba tāya vutta nayena āha  gantabba abhāvato ti bujjhitabba abhāvataḥ diṭṭhiyā gata mattam ti diṭṭhiyā gati mattam gahaṇa mattam
translated: The method should be understood as stated in the case of the profitable, according to the kind of case.🔽Because there is no going: because there is no understanding.🔽Merely gone by way of view: merely gone by way of view, merely grasped by way of view.

original: Āsannakāraṇattā ayonisomanasikārassa visuṃ gahaṇaṃ ekantakāraṇattā ca. Satisaṃvaroti
analyzed: āsanna kāraṇa ttā a yoniso manasikārassa visum gahaṇam ekanta kāraṇa ttā ca
translated: Because wrong reflection is a proximate cause, it is given separately. And because it is the sole cause,

original: idha sītādīhi phuṭṭhassa appamajjanaṃ khamanaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Pahānasaṃvaroti vīriyasaṃvaro.
analyzed: idha sītā ādīhi phuṭṭhassa appamajjanam khamanam daṭṭhabbam pahāna saṃvaro ti vīriya saṃvaro
translated: Here the not-neglecting of one who is touched by cold, etc., should be regarded as patience. The restraint of mindfulness is

original: Assādadassananti assādadiṭṭhi. Phalaṭṭhena paccupaṭṭhānena asammāpaṭipattipaccupaṭṭhānomoho,
analyzed: assāda dassananti assāda diṭṭhi phala aṭṭhena paccupaṭṭhānena asammāpaṭipatti paccupaṭṭhānaḥ moho
translated: The seeing of gratification is the view of gratification. The delusion that is the proximate cause of wrong practice, which is the opposite of right practice, is

original: sammāpaṭipattipaṭipakkhabhāvaggahaṇākāro vā. Sabbassa lobhassa abhijjhābhāve satipi
analyzed: sammā paṭipatti paṭipakkha bhāva ggahaṇa ākāraḥ vā sabbassa lobhassa abhijjhā bhāve sati pi
translated: The way in which the wrong practice is grasped as the opposite of right practice. Although all greed is covetousness,

original: visesayuttāya abhijjhāya kammapathappattāya idhuppajjamānāya lakkhaṇādiṃ dassetuṃ
analyzed: visesa yuttāya abhijjhāya kammapatha pattāya idha uppajjamānāya lakkhaṇa ādim dassetuṃ
translated: still, in order to point out the characteristic, etc., of that which occurs here as covetousness associated with a particular kind of greed that has reached the state of a course of kamma by being accompanied by a particular wrong view,

original: “sā parasampattīna”ntiādimāha. Attano pariṇāmanassa purecārikā taṇhābhirati abhirati.
analyzed: sā attanaḥ pariṇāmanassa purecārikā taṇhā abhirati abhirati
translated: “The other’s success” is the success of another. The prior-to-that craving is the delight.

original: Anupaparikkhā moho. Mohavasena hi diṭṭhivasena vā avatthusmiṃ sānunayo adhimokkho
analyzed: anupaparikkhā mohaḥ moha vasena hi diṭṭhi vasena vā avatthusmim sa anunayaḥ adhimokkho
translated: The non-reflection is delusion. For it is through delusion or through view that approval arises in a non-existent object.

original: uppajjatīti. Asatiyacitteti ahirikādīhi ārakkharahitacitte. Satirahitattā satipaṭipakkhattā
analyzed: uppajjati iti asatiya citta iti ahirika ādīhi ārakkha rahita citte sati rahita ttā sati paṭipakkha ttā
translated: In a mind without conscience: in a mind devoid of shame, etc. Because of the absence of mindfulness, because of being the opposite of mindfulness,

original: cāti etena satirahitā satipaṭipakkhā ca akusalā khandhā eva micchāsatīti dasseti.
analyzed: ca ati etena sati rahitā sati paṭipakkhā ca akusalā khandhā eva micchā satī ti dasseti
translated: he shows that the unwholesome aggregates, which are devoid of mindfulness and are the opposite of mindfulness, are wrong mindfulness.

original: Te pana upanāhādippavattiyaṃ cirakatādisallakkhaṇe paṭusaññāsampayuttā daṭṭhabbā.
analyzed: te pana upanāha ādi pavattiyam cirakata ādi sat lakkhaṇe paṭu saññā sampayuttā daṭṭhabbā
translated: But they should be regarded as being associated with the quick perception that is the characteristic of what is done long ago, etc., in the occurrence of the approach of defilement, etc.

original: Sadarathādibhāvo avisesena kilesasampayogato vutto lahutādiekantapaṭipakkhānaṃ thinamiddhādīnaṃ
analyzed: sadaratha ādi bhāvaḥ avisesena kilesa sampayogataḥ vuttaḥ lahu tā ādi ekanta paṭipakkhānam thinamiddha ādīnam
translated: The state of having a load, etc., is said without distinction because of association with defilements. The lightness, etc., are the opposites of the heaviness, etc., of torpor, drowsiness, etc.,

original: kesañci idha abhāvā. Avūpasamoti asannisinnasabbhāvamāha. Anavaṭṭhānarasanti calanakiccaṃ.
analyzed: kesañci idha abhāvāḥ avūpasamaḥ ti asannisinna sabbhāvam āha calana kiccam
translated: which are not found here. Non-quiescence is the non-stillness of the mind. The taste of non-suspension is the function of agitation.

original: Cetaso avūpasameti nipphādetabbe payojane bhummaṃ, avūpasamapaccayabhūtaṃ ārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: cetasaḥ a vūpasameti nipphādetabbe payojane bhummam a vūpasama paccaya bhūtam ārammaṇam
translated: In the non-quiescence of the mind: in the object that is the condition for non-quiescence, which is the basis for the effort to be made in the production of the mind.

original: vā “avūpasamo”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: vā a vūpasamaḥ iti vuttam
translated: and it is said that it is not calmed.

original: Dhammuddesavārakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: dhamma uddesa vāra kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the section of the exposition of ideas is ended.

original: Niddesavārakathāvaṇṇanā🔽377. Sahajātadhammesu akampanaṃ na kosajjesu akampanaṃ viya tappaṭipakkhabhāvato daṭṭhabbaṃ, taṃtaṃpāpakiriyāya ussahanavasena pana thiratā tattha akampanaṃ.🔽381. Diṭṭhiyā virūpaṃ phanditanti tathā tathā sassatādivasena pavattā diṭṭhi eva vuccati. Tarantīti titthe viya pilavanti. Vipariyesatoti vatthussa viparītato.🔽390. Sabhāvapaṭicchādanavasena pakatiattādiasantagahaṇassa aniccādīnaṃ niccādivisamagahaṇassa ca saññādivipariyesassa nissayattā “asantaṃ asamañca bujjhatī”ti vuttaṃ.
analyzed: niddesa vāra kathā vaṇṇanā  sahajāta dhammesu akampanam na kosajjesu akampanam viya tad paṭipakkha bhāvataḥ daṭṭhabbam taṃ taṃ pāpa kiriyāya ussahana vasena pana thira tā tattha akampanam  diṭṭhiyā virūpam phanditan ti tathā tathā sassata ādi vasena pavattā diṭṭhi eva vuccati taranti iti titthe viya pilavanti vipariyesataḥ ti vatthussa viparītataḥ  sabhāva paṭicchādana vasena pakati atta ādi asanta gahaṇassa anicca ādīnam nicca ādi visama gahaṇassa ca saññā ādi vipariyesassa nissaya ttā asantam asamañca bujjhati iti vuttam
translated: The commentary on the section of the exposition of the analysis
