analyzed: ekasmin dvāre ahetuka paṭisandhi janaka
translated: which is of the same kind as that which causes rebirth-linking without root-cause to arise,

original: ahetukatadārammaṇaṃ dassento “catunnaṃ pana duhetukakusalacittānaṃ aññatarajavanassa…pe…🔽patiṭṭhātī”ti āha. Ahetukapaṭisandhikassa pana tihetukajavane javite paṭisandhidāyakena🔽kammena ahetukassa tadārammaṇassa nibbatti na paṭisedhitā. Evaṃ duhetukapaṭisandhikassapi
analyzed: ahetuka tad ārammaṇam dassento catunnam pana du hetuka kusala cittānam aññatara javanassape  patiṭṭhāti iti āha ahetuka paṭisandhikassa pana ti hetuka javane javite paṭisandhi dāyakena  kammena ahetukassa tad ārammaṇassa nibbatti na paṭisedhitā evam du hetuka paṭisandhikassa api
translated: the object of that adverting is given as “the object of the adverting that arises next to any one of the four profitable-resultant consciousnesses without root-cause” ,

original: tihetukānantaraṃ duhetukatadārammaṇaṃ appaṭisiddhaṃ daṭṭhabbaṃ. Paripuṇṇavipākassa
analyzed: ti hetuka anantaram du hetuka tad ārammaṇam appaṭisiddham daṭṭhabbam paripuṇṇa vipākassa
translated: and so on. But when the rebirth-linking consciousness without root-cause arises next to profitable-resultant consciousness with three roots, the arising of the object of that rebirth-linking consciousness without root-cause is not prevented by the kamma that causes the rebirth-linking consciousness to arise. So too, when the rebirth-linking consciousness with two roots arises next to profitable-resultant consciousness with three roots, the arising of the object of that rebirth-linking consciousness with two roots should be regarded as unprecluded.

original: ca paṭisandhijanakakammassa vasenāyaṃ vipākavibhāvanā tassā mukhanidassanamattamevāti
analyzed: ca paṭisandhi janaka kammassa vasena ayam vipāka vibhāvanā tassāḥ mukha nidassana mattam evā ti
translated: And since the exposition of resultants given here is in terms of the kamma that causes the rebirth-linking consciousness to arise, it is only a mere indication of the actual state of things.

original: pavattivipākassa ca ekassa tihetukādikammassa soḷasavipākacittādīni vuttanayena yojetabbāni.
analyzed: pavatti vipākassa ca ekassa ti hetuka ādi kammassa soḷasa vipāka citta ādīni vutta nayena yojetabbāni
translated: And the sixteen kinds of resultant consciousness, etc., should be construed in the same way as the profitable-resultant consciousness with three roots, etc., in the case of the single kind of resultant consciousness that occurs in the course of an existence.

original: Tasmā yena kenaci kammunā ekena anekaṃ tadārammaṇaṃ pavattamānaṃ kammavisesābhāvā
analyzed: tasmā yena kenacid kammunā ekena anekam tad ārammaṇam pavattamānam kamma visesa abhāvā
translated: So when many objects of the kind stated occur through any one of the kinds of kamma, the difference in the kamma is not the cause.

original: yesaṃ taṃ anubandhabhūtaṃ, tesaṃ javanasaṅkhātānaṃ paccayānaṃ visesena visiṭṭhaṃ
analyzed: yesam tam anubandha bhūtam tesam javana saṅkhātānam paccayānam visesena visiṭṭham
translated: and it is distinguished by the special conditions called impulsion.

original: hotīti javanenāyaṃ tadārammaṇaniyāmo vutto, na nānākammunā nibbattamānassa vasena.🔽Evañca katvā paṭṭhāne “sahetuke khandhe aniccato dukkhato anattato vipassati. Kusalākusale
analyzed: hoti iti javanena ayam tad ārammaṇa niyāmaḥ vuttaḥ na nānā kammunā nibbattamānassa vasena  evañca katvā paṭṭhāne sa hetuke khandhe aniccataḥ dukkhataḥ anattataḥ vipassati kusala akusale
translated: So the rule about object is stated by impulsion, not by the way in which it is produced by different kinds of kamma.

original: niruddhe ahetuko vipāko tadārammaṇatā uppajjatī”ti ñāṇānantaraṃ ahetukatadārammaṇaṃ,🔽“kusalākusale niruddhe sahetuko vipāko tadārammaṇatā uppajjatī”ti akusalānantarañca🔽sahetukatadārammaṇaṃ vuttaṃ, na ca “taṃ etena therena adassita”nti katvā tassa paṭisedho kato hotīti.
analyzed: niruddhe ahetukaḥ vipākaḥ tad ārammaṇa tā uppajjati iti ñāṇa anantaram ahetuka tad ārammaṇam  kusala akusale niruddhe sa hetukaḥ vipākaḥ tad ārammaṇa tā uppajjati iti akusala anantaram ca  sa hetuka tad ārammaṇam vuttam na ca tam etena therena a dassitam ti katvā tassa paṭisedho kataḥ hoti iti
translated: And when it is so taken, then the following is said in the Paṭṭhāna: “When he contemplates the aggregates with cause as impermanent, painful, not-self, then, when the profitable and unprofitable are ceased, their result, which is without cause, comes into focus” , and next to the “knowledge” is stated the object without cause.🔽And: “When the profitable and unprofitable are ceased, their result, which has cause, comes into focus” , and next to the unprofitable is stated the object with cause. And it is not that the denial is made because “that is not shown by this Elder” .

original: Yaṃ pana javanena…pe… taṃ kusalaṃ sandhāya vuttanti idaṃ kusalassa viya akusalassa
analyzed: yam pana javanenape tam kusalam sandhāya vuttanti idam kusalassa viya akusalassa
translated: But the words “The object with cause is stated by impulsion … and so on … that is said of profitable impulsion” are said because there is no result similar to the profitable,

original: sadiso vipāko natthīti katvā vuttaṃ. Sasaṅkhārikāsaṅkhārikaniyamanaṃ pana sandhāya
analyzed: sadisaḥ vipākaḥ natthi iti katvā vuttam sa saṅkhārika asaṅkhārika niyamanam pana sandhāya
translated: and because the denial is made in order to show the rule about what is due to individual essence and what is not.

original: tasmiṃ vutte akusalepi na taṃ na yujjatīti. Aṭṭhānametanti idaṃ niyamitādivasena
analyzed: tasmin vutte akusale api na tam na yujjati iti aṭṭhānam etat ti idam niyamita ādi vasena
translated: and when that is said, it is not inappropriate to say that it is unwholesome. ‘This is impossible’—

original: yoniso ayoniso vā āvaṭṭite ayoniso yoniso vā vavatthāpanassa abhāvaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ.
analyzed: yonisaḥ ayonisaḥ vā āvaṭṭite ayonisaḥ yonisaḥ vā vavatthāpanassa abhāvam sandhāya vuttam
translated: and when that is said, it is not inappropriate to say that it is unprofitable too. ‘This is impossible’ is said with reference to the absence of any such determinations as ‘in order’ or ‘out of order’ when the round is set going either rightly or wrongly by means of the limited, etc., kinds of knowledge.

original: Paṭisiddhanti avacanameva paṭisedhoti katvā vuttaṃ. Kāmataṇhānibbattena kammunā mahaggatalokuttarānubhavanavipāko
analyzed: paṭisiddhanti avacanam eva paṭisedhaḥ ti katvā vuttam kāma taṇhā nibbattena kammunā mahaggata lokuttara anubhavana vipākaḥ
translated: ‘Is denied’ is said taking denial as non-saying. The result of the kind of kamma that is produced by craving for sense desires is not the experience of the exalted and the supramundane.

original: na hotīti tattha tadārammaṇābhāvo veditabbo. Āpāthagate visaye tanninnaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ
analyzed: na hoti iti tattha tad ārammaṇa abhāvaḥ veditabbaḥ āpātha gate visaye tat ninnam bhavaṅgam
translated: So the absence of that as object should be understood. When the object has come into focus, the life-continuum,

original: āvajjanaṃ uppādetīti āvajjanaṃ visaye ninnattā uppajjati. Bhavaṅgaṃ pana sabbadā🔽savisaye ninnamevāti visayantaraviññāṇassa paccayo hutvāpi tadabhāvā vinā āvajjanena
analyzed: āvajjanam uppādeti iti āvajjanam visaye ninnattā uppajjati bhavaṅgam pana sabbadā  sa visaye ninnam eva ati visaya antara viññāṇassa paccayaḥ hutvā api tad abhāvāḥ vinā āvajjanena
translated: which is tending towards that object, causes the adverting to arise. So adverting arises because of its tending towards the object. But the life-continuum

original: savisaye ninnattāva uppajjati. Ciṇṇattāti āvajjanena vinā bahulaṃ uppannapubbattā.
analyzed: sa visaye uppajjati ciṇṇattā ati āvajjanena vinā bahulam uppanna pubba ttā
translated: always tends towards the object. So even though it is a condition for the consciousness of another object, it arises tending towards the object without adverting, because of the absence of that. ‘Tending towards what is familiar’ means that it arises often without adverting because it has already arisen.

original: Samudācārattāti āpāthagate visaye paṭisandhivisaye ca bahulaṃ uppāditapubbattā. Ciṇṇattāti🔽vā puggalena āsevitabhāvo vutto. Samudācārattāti sayaṃ bahulaṃ pavattabhāvo. Nirodhassa
analyzed: samudācāra ttā ati āpātha gate visaye paṭisandhi visaye ca bahulam uppādita pubba ttā ciṇṇa ttā ati  vā puggalena āsevita bhāvaḥ vutto samudācāra ttā ati sayam bahulam pavatta bhāvaḥ nirodhassa
translated: By practice: by the frequent repetition of the defilement in the objective field that has come into focus and in the rebirth-linking that has already occurred. By cultivation: by the person’s repeated practice. By practice: by the frequent occurrence of the defilement itself.

original: anantarapaccayaṃ nevasaññānāsaññāyatananti idaṃ tadanantarameva nirodhaphusanaṃ sandhāya🔽vuttaṃ, na arūpakkhandhānaṃ viya nirodhassa anantarapaccayabhāvaṃ. Nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṃ
analyzed: anantara paccayam nevasaññānāsaññāyatanan ti idam tad anantaram eva nirodha phusanam sandhāya  vuttam na arūpa kkhandhānam viya nirodhassa anantara paccaya bhāvam nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam
translated: By practice means by repeated practice in the past in the objective fields that have come into focus and in the rebirth-linking field. By cultivation means by the person’s repeated practice. By practice means by his own repeated occurrence. The base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception is the condition, as proximity condition, for cessation. This is said with reference to the mere touching of cessation that is next to it,

original: pana kiñci parikammena vinā uppajjamānaṃ natthi. Parikammāvajjanameva tassa āvajjananti
analyzed: pana kiñci parikammena vinā uppajjamānam natthi parikamma āvajjanam eva tassa āvajjananti
translated: not with reference to the proximity condition for cessation as there is for the immaterial aggregates. But the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception does not occur without some preliminary work. The preliminary-work-impulsion is its impulsion.

original: aññassa viya etassapi sāvajjanatāya bhavitabbaṃ.
analyzed: aññassa viya etassa api sāvajjana tāya bhavitabbam
translated: So it must have an impulsion like that of any other.

original: Ayaṃ panetthādhippāyo daṭṭhabbo – nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa na nirodhassa anantarapaccayabhāve
analyzed: ayam pana itthā adhippāyaḥ daṭṭhabbo nevasaññānāsaññāyatanassa na nirodhassa anantara paccaya bhāve
translated: But the intention here should be regarded as follows. The fact that the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception and cessation are a proximity condition is stated

original: ninnāditā aññattha diṭṭhā atadatthaparikammabhāve ca uppattiyā, atha ca taṃ tassa
analyzed: ninnāditā aññattha diṭṭhā a tad attha parikamma bhāve ca uppattiyā atha ca tam tassa
translated: with reference to the fact that they are so described elsewhere and with reference to their occurrence as preliminary-work-impulsion and object-impulsion respectively.

original: anantarapaccayo hoti, tathā ca uppajjati. Evaṃ yathāvuttā manoviññāṇadhātu asatipi🔽nirāvajjanuppattiyaṃ ninnādibhāve nirāvajjanā uppajjatīti. Evañca katvā “ariyamaggacittaṃ🔽maggānantarāni phalacittānī”ti idaṃ vuttaṃ. Yadi hi nibbānārammaṇāvajjanābhāvaṃ sandhāyetaṃ
analyzed: anantara paccayaḥ hoti tathā ca uppajjati evam yathā vuttā manaḥ viññāṇa dhātu asati pi  nirāvajjana uppattiyam ninna ādi bhāve nirāvajjanā uppajjati iti evam ca katvā ariya magga cittam  magga anantarāni phala cittāni iti idam vuttam yadi hi nibbāna ārammaṇa avajjana abhāvam sandhāya itam
translated: and it arises in that way. So the kind of mind-element stated thus arises without prompting even when there is no prompting.🔽And it is in this way that it can be said that “the noble-path consciousnesses and the fruition consciousnesses arise next to the path.”

original: vuttaṃ siyā, gotrabhuvodānāni nidassanāni siyuṃ teheva etesaṃ nirāvajjanatāsiddhito.🔽Phalasamāpattikāle ca “parittārammaṇaṃ mahaggatārammaṇaṃ anulomaṃ phalasamāpattiyā🔽anantarapaccayena paccayo”ti vacanato samānārammaṇāvajjanarahitattā “maggānantarāni
analyzed: vuttam siyā gotra bhuvaḥ udānāni nidassanāni siyum tehi iva etesam  phala samāpatti kāle ca paritta ārammaṇam mahaggata ārammaṇam anulomam phala samāpattiyā  anantara paccayena paccayaḥ ti vacanato samāna ārammaṇa āvajjana rahita ttā magga anantarāni
translated: If this were said with reference to the absence of prompting in the case of the path’s having Nibbāna as its object, then the change-of-lineage and conformity should be mentioned too, because their absence of prompting is established by that same fact.

original: phalacittānī”ti evaṃ phalasamāpatticittāni na vajjetabbāni siyuṃ, gotrabhuvodānāni
analyzed: phala cittāni iti evam phala samāpatti cittāni na vajjetabbāni siyum gotra bhuvaḥ udānāni
translated: And at the time of fruition attainment, the words “A small object is a condition, as proximity condition, for a great object, for fruition attainment” show that the fruition consciousnesses should not be called “arisen next to the path” because they are devoid of prompting with the same object as the path.

original: pana yadipi nibbāne ciṇṇāni samudācārāni ca na honti, ārammaṇantare ciṇṇasamudācārāneva.
analyzed: pana yadi api nibbāne ciṇṇāni samudācārāni ca na honti ārammaṇa antare
translated: But although the change-of-lineage and conformity have had Nibbāna as their object, they have had as their object only what has been already discerned and is not being presently experienced.

original: Phalasamāpatticittāni ca maggavīthito uddhaṃ tadatthaparikammasabbhāvāti tesaṃ gahaṇaṃ
analyzed: phala samāpatti cittāni ca magga vīthitaḥ uddham tad attha parikamma sabbhāvā ti tesam gahaṇam
translated: And the consciousnesses of fruition attainment are not included because they are not subsequent to the path and because they are not the means to that end.

original: na kataṃ, anulomānantarañca phalasamāpatticittaṃ ciṇṇaṃ samudācāraṃ, na nevasaññānāsaññāyatanānantaraṃ
analyzed: na katam anuloma anantaram ca phala samāpatti cittam ciṇṇam samudācāram na nevasaññānāsaññāyatana anantaram
translated: And the fruition attainment consciousness that is next to conformity is a habit pattern; it is not next to the base consisting of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: maggānantarassa viya tadatthaparikammābhāvāti “nirodhā vuṭṭhahantassā”ti tañca nidassanaṃ.
analyzed: magga anantarassa viya tad attha parikamma abhāvā ati nirodhāḥ vuṭṭhahantassa ati tat ca nidassanam
translated: And because it is not the means to that end as is that next to the path, the words “when he emerges from cessation” are stated by way of illustration.

original: Ārammaṇena pana vinā nuppajjatīti idaṃ etassa mahaggatārammaṇattābhāvā pucchaṃ kāretvā🔽ārammaṇaniddhāraṇatthaṃ vuttaṃ.🔽Tatthāti vipākakathāyaṃ. Jaccandhapīṭhasappiupamānidassanaṃ vipākassa nissayena vinā🔽appavattidassanatthaṃ. Visayaggāhoti idaṃ cakkhādīnaṃ savisayaggahaṇena cakkhuviññāṇādivipākassa
analyzed: ārammaṇena pana vinā nuppajjati iti idam etassa mahaggata ārammaṇa tta abhāvā puccham kāretvā  ārammaṇa niddhāraṇa attham vuttam  tattha ati vipāka kathāyam jat candha pīṭha sappi upamāni dassanam vipākassa nissayena vinā  appavatti dassana attham visaya ggāhaḥ ti idam cakkha ādīnam sa visaya ggahaṇena cakkhu viññāṇa ādi vipākassa
translated: But it does not occur without a mental object: this is said in order to determine the mental object since it is asked about because it has no exalted mental object.🔽“There” in the section on fruition. The illustration of the “blind man’s staff” is stated in order to show that fruition does not occur without a support.🔽“The apprehension of an object”: this is said in order to show that fruition consciousness as eye-consciousness, etc., has an object such as visible forms, etc., as well as an eye, etc., as its support.

original: dassanatthaṃ vuttaṃ. Upanissayato cakkhādīnaṃ dassanādiatthato ca tasseva vipākassa
analyzed: dassana attham vuttam upanissayataḥ cakkha ādīnam dassana ādi atthataḥ ca tassa iva vipākassa
translated: “The condition by decisive support”: this is said in order to show that the eye, etc., are the support for that fruition by way of decisive support and in order to show that the eye, etc., are the cause for that fruition by way of the eye’s being the cause for seeing, etc.

original: dassanatthaṃ “upanissayamatthaso”ti vuttaṃ. Hadayavatthumevāti yathā purimacittāni
analyzed: dassana attham upanissayam atthaso ti vuttam hadaya vatthum evā iti yathā purima cittāni
translated: “For the purpose of seeing” is said by way of decisive support.

original: hadayavatthunissitāni ca pasādavatthuanugatāni ca aññārammaṇāni honti, na evaṃ bhavaṅgaṃ,🔽taṃ panetaṃ vatthārammaṇantararahitaṃ kevalaṃ hadayavatthumeva nissāya pavattatīti
analyzed: hadaya vatthu nissitāni ca pasāda vatthu anugatāni ca añña ārammaṇāni honti na evam bhavaṅgam  tam pana itam vattha ārammaṇa antara rahitam kevalam hadaya vatthum eva nissāya pavattati iti
translated: The meaning is: just as the preceding consciousnesses are supported on the heart-basis and are accompanied by the sensitive matter, and have other objects, so the life-continuum is not.

original: vuttaṃ hoti. Hadayarūpavatthukanti idhāpi aññavatthānugatanti adhippāyo veditabbo.🔽Makkaṭakassa hi suttārohaṇaṃ viya pasādavatthukaṃ cittaṃ, suttena gamanādīni viya
analyzed: vuttam hoti hadaya rūpa vatthukan ti idha api añña vattha anugatan ti adhippāyaḥ veditabbo  makkaṭakassa hi sutta ārohaṇam viya pasāda vatthukam cittam suttena gamana ādīni viya
translated: But it is said that this occurs only supported on the heart-basis devoid of a sensitive matter and an object.🔽The meaning is: just as the heart-basis is the physical basis for the life-continuum, so the heart-basis matter is the physical basis for the heart-basis.🔽The intention is that the other physical basis is accompanied by the sensitive matter.

original: tadanugatāni sesacittānīti. Suttaghaṭṭanamakkaṭakacalanāni viya pasādaghaṭṭanabhavaṅgacalanāni
analyzed: tad anugatāni sesa cittāni iti sutta ghaṭṭana makkaṭaka calanāni viya pasāda ghaṭṭana bhavaṅga calanāni
translated: The consciousness accompanied by the sensitive matter is like the monkey’s climbing up the rope, and the other consciousnesses accompanied by it are like the going, etc., of the rope.🔽The shaking of the rope and the shaking of the monkey are together,

original: saha hontīti dīpanato “ekekaṃ…pe… āgacchatī”tipi dīpeti.
analyzed: saha honti iti dīpanataḥ āgacchati itipi
translated: and so it is said that “each … comes” in order to show that the shaking of the sensitive matter and the shaking of the life-continuum are together.

original: Bhavaṅgassa āvaṭṭitakāloti idaṃ dovārikasadisānaṃ cakkhuviññāṇādīnaṃ pādaparimajjakasadisassa
analyzed: bhavaṅgassa āvaṭṭita kālo ti idam dovārika sadisānam cakkhu viññāṇa ādīnam pāda parimajjaka sadisassa
translated: The time of the life-continuum’s turning back: this is said by way of the eye-consciousness, etc., which are like the gatekeeper, and the life-continuum, which is like the man who is asleep in the house.

original: āvajjanassa saññādānasadiso anantarapaccayabhāvo eva bhavaṅgāvaṭṭananti katvā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: āvajjanassa saññā dāna sadisaḥ anantara paccaya bhāvaḥ eva bhavaṅga avaṭṭanam ti katvā vuttam
translated: The function of adverting is said to be like that of perceiving, and the function of the life-continuum is said to be like that of determining, since the former and the latter are respectively the condition by way of proximity and the condition by way of decisive support.

original: Vipākamanodhātuādīnaṃ adisvāva sampaṭicchanādikaraṇaṃ gāḷhaggahaṇamattaputhulacaturassabhāvavijānanamattakahāpaṇabhāvavijānanamattakammopanayanamattasāmaññavasena🔽vuttaṃ, na gāḷhaggāhakādīnaṃ kahāpaṇadassanassa abhāvo taṃsamānabhāvo ca sampaṭicchanādīnaṃ
analyzed: vipāka manaḥ dhātu ādīnam sampaṭicchana ādi karaṇam gāḷha ggahaṇa matta puthula catur assa bhāva vijānana matta kahāpaṇa bhāva vijānana matta kamma upanayana matta sāmañña vasena  vuttam na gāḷhaggāhaka ādīnam kahāpaṇa dassanassa abhāvaḥ tad samāna bhāvaḥ ca sampaṭicchanā ādīnam
translated: The function of the resultant mind element, etc., is said to be like that of grasping a heavy object, etc., because of the similarity of their respective functions of merely receiving, and so on.

original: adhippetoti veditabbo.
analyzed: adhippetaḥ iti veditabbaḥ
translated: It should be understood that the meaning intended is not that the heavy object, etc., are not seen, and that the seeing of the heavy object, etc., is similar to the function of receiving, etc.

original: Paṇḍaraṃ etanti paṇḍararūpadassanasāmaññato cakkhuviññāṇameva dassanakiccaṃ sādhetīti
analyzed: paṇḍaram etat ti paṇḍara rūpa dassana sāmaññato cakkhu viññāṇam eva dassana kiccam sādheti iti
translated: The meaning of the simile is to be understood as follows: “The eye consciousness alone accomplishes the function of seeing because of the similarity of its function to the seeing of a white object.”🔽The same method of explanation applies to the ear door, etc., with the appropriate changes in the wording.

original: dīpanaṃ veditabbaṃ. Evaṃ sotadvārādīsupi yojetabbaṃ savanādivasena. Santāpanavasena
analyzed: dīpanam veditabbam evam sota dvāra ādīsu pi yojetabbam savana ādi vasena santāpana vasena
translated: The simile of the sugar-cane is given because of the similarity of the function of the ear door, etc., to the tasting of sugar-cane.

original: guḷasīlo guḷappayojano vā goḷiyako. Upanissayatoti na upanissayapaccayaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: guḷa sīlaḥ guḷa ppayojanaḥ vā goḷiyakaḥ upanissayato ti na upanissaya paccayam sandhāya
translated: By way of decisive support: not by way of the decisive support condition.

original: vuttaṃ. Yasmiṃ pana asati yo na hoti, so idha “upanissayo”ti adhippeto. Ālokasannissitanti
analyzed: vuttam yasmin pana asati yaḥ na hoti saḥ idha upanissayaḥ ti adhippetaḥ āloka sannissitanti
translated: But when it is not there, that is what is intended here as “predominance condition.” “Dependent on light” :

original: idampi āloke sati sabbhāvaṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ, na upanissayapaccayataṃ. Mandathāmagataṃ
analyzed: idam api āloke sati sabbhāvam sandhāya vuttam na upanissaya paccaya tam manda thāma gatam
translated: this is said with reference to the real nature of light, not with reference to predominance condition. “Slow and sluggish” :

original: nāma kiriyacittassa paccayabhāvaṃ anupagantvā sayameva pavattamānaṃ.🔽Asaṅkhārikasasaṅkhārikesu dosaṃ disvāti na kammassa viruddhasabhāvena vipākena bhavitabbanti🔽asaṅkhārikakammassa sasaṅkhārikavipākesu, sasaṅkhārikakammassa ca asaṅkhārikavipākesu
analyzed: nāma kiriya cittassa paccaya bhāvam an upagantvā sayam eva pavattamānam  asaṅkhārika sasaṅkhārikesu dosam disvā ati na kammassa viruddha sabhāvena vipākena bhavitabbanti  asaṅkhārika kammassa sa saṅkhārika vipākesu sa saṅkhārika kammassa ca asaṅkhārika vipākesu
translated: this is said with reference to the state of the function of the result of kamma that has not yet become a condition for a functional consciousness.🔽“Seeing the fault in the non-volitional and the volitional” : seeing the fault in the non-volitional kamma having a volitional result, and in the volitional kamma having a non-volitional result.

original: dosaṃ disvā. Ahetukānaṃ pana rūpādīsu abhinipātamattādikiccānaṃ na sasaṅkhārikaviruddho
analyzed: dosam disvā ahetukānam pana rūpa ādīsu abhinipāta matta ādi kiccānam na sa saṅkhārika viruddhaḥ
translated: But the non-volitional materiality, etc., which have the function of mere descent, etc., are not opposed in nature to volitional kamma,

original: sabhāvoti asaṅkhārikatā natthi, asaṅkhārikaviruddhasabhāvābhāvā nāpi sasaṅkhārikatāti
analyzed: sabhāvaḥ ti asaṅkhārika tā natthi asaṅkhārika viruddha sabhāva abhāvā na api sasaṅkhārika tā ati
translated: so they are not non-volitional. And because they are not opposed in nature to non-volitional kamma, they are not volitional either.

original: ubhayāvirodhā ubhayenapi tesaṃ nibbattiṃ anujānāti. Cittaniyāmanti tadārammaṇaniyāmaṃ.
analyzed: ubhaya avirodhā ubhayena api tesam nibbattim anujānāti citta niyāmam ti tad ārammaṇa niyāmam
translated: Therefore, since they are not opposed to either, they are allowed to arise by both. “The restriction of consciousness” : the restriction of the object.

original: Kiriyato pañcāti imesaṃ…pe… patiṭṭhātīti kiriyajavanānantarañca tadārammaṇaṃ vuttaṃ.
analyzed: kiriyato pañca ati imesam pe patiṭṭhāti iti kiriya javana anantaram ca tad ārammaṇam vuttam
translated: From the functional, five: after the functional impulsions of the fine-material sphere, the fine-material-sphere functional registration is the result.

original: Paṭṭhāne pana “kusalākusale niruddhe vipāko tadārammaṇatā uppajjatī”ti vipākadhammadhammānameva
analyzed: paṭṭhāne pana kusala akusale niruddhe vipāko tad ārammaṇa tā uppajjati iti vipāka dhamma dhammānam eva
translated: But in the Paṭṭhāna the functional and resultant dhammas are stated as the condition by way of decisive support only in the clause “When profitable and unprofitable are ceased, resultant is the condition, by way of decisive support, for registration” .

original: anantarā tadārammaṇaṃ vuttaṃ. Kusalattike ca “sekkhā vā puthujjanā vā kusalaṃ aniccato”tiādinā
analyzed: anantarā tad ārammaṇam vuttam kusala ttike ca sekkhāḥ vā puthujjanāḥ vā kusalam aniccato tiādinā
translated: And in the clause “When those in higher training and ordinary men contemplate the profitable as impermanent, etc.,”

original: kusalākusalajavanameva vatvā tadanantaraṃ tadārammaṇaṃ vuttaṃ, na abyākatānantaraṃ,🔽na ca katthaci kiriyānantaraṃ tadārammaṇassa vuttaṭṭhānaṃ dissati. Vijjamāne ca tasmiṃ
analyzed: kusala akusala javanam eva vatvā tad anantaram tad ārammaṇam vuttam na abyākata anantaram  na ca katthaci kiriyā anantaram tad ārammaṇassa vutta ṭṭhānam dissati vijjamāne ca tasmin
translated: only profitable and unprofitable impulsions are mentioned, and after that registration is mentioned, not after any other kind of dhamma.

original: avacane kāraṇaṃ natthi, tasmā upaparikkhitabbo eso theravādo. Vipphārikañhi javanaṃ🔽nāvaṃ viya nadīsoto bhavaṅgaṃ anubandhatīti yuttaṃ, na pana chaḷaṅgupekkhavato santavuttiṃ
analyzed: avacane kāraṇam na atthi tasmai upaparikkhitabbaḥ esaḥ thera vādaḥ vipphārikam hi javanam  nāvam viya nadī sotaḥ bhavaṅgam anubandhati iti yuttam na pana chaḷaṅgu pekkhavato santa vuttim
translated: And there is no reason for not mentioning it if it exists. So this view of the elder needs to be investigated.🔽For it is proper to say that impulsion, which is the flood, the pursuit, the yoke, the proliferation, the bait, the thorn, the bondage, the hindrance, the entanglement, the concealment, the underlying tendency, the danger, the stress, the corruption, the stain, the boil, the tumour, the disaster, the calamity, the sickness, the dart, is what follows on the life-continuum like a boat in a stream.

original: kiriyajavanaṃ paṇṇapuṭaṃ viya nadīsototi.
analyzed: kiriya javanam paṇṇa puṭam viya
translated: But it is not proper to say that the functional impulsion, which is peaceful, sublime, a guard for the doors of the sense faculties, moderate in eating, devoted to wakefulness, and which is like a raft because it is for the purpose of crossing over , is what follows on the life-continuum like a boat in a stream.

original: Piṇḍajavanaṃ javatīti kusalākusalakiriyajavanāni piṇḍetvā kathitānīti tathā kathitāni
analyzed: piṇḍa javanam javati iti kusala akusala kiriya javanāni piṇḍetvā kathitāni iti tathā kathitāni
translated: The “impulsive” impulsions are said to be “impulsive” because they are spoken of by collecting together the profitable, unprofitable, and functional impulsions.

original: javanāni piṇḍitāni viya vuttāni, ekasmiṃ vā tadārammaṇe piṇḍetvā dassitāni hutvā
analyzed: javanāni piṇḍitāni viya vuttāni ekasmin vā tad ārammaṇe piṇḍetvā dassitāni hutvā
translated: They are said to be “impulsive” as if they were collected together, or they are said to be “impulsive” as if they were shown by collecting them together in a single object.

original: javitāneva vuttāni. Imañca pana piṇḍajavanaṃ vadantena akusalato cattāriyeva upekkhāsahagatāni🔽gahetvā dvādasupekkhāsahagatajavanāni piṇḍitāni viya vuttāni. Paṭṭhāne pana “kusalaṃ
analyzed: vuttāni imam ca pana piṇḍa javanam vadantena akusalato cattāriya iva upekkhā sahagatāni  gahetvā dvādasa upekkhā sahagata javanāni piṇḍitāni viya vuttāni paṭṭhāne pana kusalam
translated: But when this “impulsive” impulsions is spoken of, only the four associated with equanimity are taken from the unprofitable,

original: assādeti abhinandati, taṃ ārabbha rāgo uppajjati. Diṭṭhi, vicikicchā, uddhaccaṃ,
analyzed: assādeti abhinandati tam ārabbha rāgaḥ uppajjati diṭṭhi vicikicchā uddhaccam
translated: so that the twelve associated with equanimity are said to be as if collected together. But in the Paṭṭhāna it is said: “When a profitable state … is relished and rejoiced in, delight arises in dependence on it. From the arising of delight, the arising of greed, false view of individuality, uncertainty, agitation,

original: domanassaṃ uppajjati. Akusale niruddhe vipāko tadārammaṇatā uppajjatī”ti vuttattā
analyzed: domanassam uppajjati akusale niruddhe vipāko tad ārammaṇa tā uppajjati iti vutta ttā
translated: and grief can be expected. When the unprofitable state has ceased, the result and the reaction can be expected” .

original: itarāni dve iṭṭhārammaṇe pavattavicikicchuddhaccasahagatānipi kusalavipāke tadārammaṇe
analyzed: itarāni dve iṭṭha ārammaṇe pavatta vicikicchu ddhacca sahagatāni pi kusala vipāke tad ārammaṇe
translated: So the other two associated with uncertainty and agitation occurring in a desirable object should be collected together in the profitable result and the reaction.

original: piṇḍetabbāni siyuṃ. Tesaṃ pana anantaraṃ ahetukavipākeneva tadārammaṇena bhavitabbaṃ,
analyzed: piṇḍetabbāni siyum tesam pana anantaram ahetuka vipākena iva tad ārammaṇena bhavitabbam
translated: But after them there must be the reaction with root-cause only.

original: so ca santīraṇabhāveneva gahitoti apubbaṃ gahetabbaṃ natthi. Ahetuke ca piṇḍetabbaṃ
analyzed: so ca santīraṇa bhāvena iva gahitaḥ ti apubbam gahetabbam natthi ahetuke ca piṇḍetabbam
translated: and since that is included by the method of investigation, there is nothing to be included that has not already been included.

original: nārahantīti adhippāyena na piṇḍetīti.
analyzed: na ārahanti iti adhippāyena na piṇḍeti iti
translated: and since the intention is that it should not be included in the immaterial-sphere triad, it is not included.

original: Tihetukajavanāvasāne panetthāti etasmiṃ dutiyavāde tihetukajavanāvasāne tihetukatadārammaṇaṃ
analyzed: ti hetuka javana avasāne pana itthā ati etasmin dutiya vāde ti hetuka javana avasāne ti hetuka tad ārammaṇam
translated: But at the end of the impulsions of the two-rooted kind in this second view,

original: yuttanti dassetuṃ yuttaṃ vadati javanasamānattā, nālabbhamānattā aññassa. Paṭhamattherena
analyzed: yuttam ti dassetum yuttam vadati javana samānattā na alabbhamānattā aññassa paṭhama ttherena
translated: he says that it is proper to say that the two-rooted resultant is proper, that is, suitable, because of the similarity of the impulsions, not because of the unsuitability of any other.

original: akusalānantaraṃ vuttassa ahetukatadārammaṇassa, kusalānantaraṃ vuttassa ca sahetukatadārammaṇassa🔽akusalānantaraṃ uppattiṃ vadantassa hi paṭisandhijanakaṃ tihetukakammaṃ duhetukāhetukaṃ
analyzed: akusala anantaram vuttassa ahetuka tad ārammaṇassa kusala anantaram vuttassa ca sa hetuka tad ārammaṇassa  akusala anantaram uppattim vadantassa hi paṭisandhi janakam ti hetuka kammam du hetuka ahetukam
translated: The first elder’s statement of the two-rooted resultant that is a condition for the unprofitable, and his statement of the three-rooted resultant that is a condition for the profitable,🔽for if he were to say that it arises after the unprofitable, then the three-rooted kamma that generates rebirth-linking would not generate a two-rooted or rootless result after the three-rooted impulsion.

original: vipākaṃ janayantampi tihetukajavanānantaraṃ na janetīti na ettha kāraṇaṃ dissatīti
analyzed: vipākam janayantam pi ti hetuka javana anantaram na janeti iti na ettha kāraṇam dissati iti
translated: So there is no reason to be seen for saying that it does.🔽The intention is that it is proper to include it in this way, even though it is not stated.

original: evaṃ yuttaṃ gahetabbaṃ avuttampīti adhippāyo. Atha vā tasmiṃ tasmiṃ theravāde yena
analyzed: evam yuttam gahetabbam avuttam pi iti adhippāyaḥ atha vā tasmin tasmin thera vāde yena
translated: Or else, in each of the elders’ views, that which

original: adhippāyena sasaṅkhārāsaṅkhāravidhānādi vuttaṃ, taṃ teneva adhippāyena yuttaṃ gahetabbaṃ,
analyzed: adhippāyena sa saṅkhāra asaṅkhāra vidhāna ādi vuttam tam tena iva adhippāyena yuttam gahetabbam
translated: The intention is that the statement about the “with- and without-clinging” is made in order to show the difference in the way of abandoning the defilements.🔽The meaning is that it should be taken in that way, not by being confused with some other intention.

original: na adhippāyantaraṃ adhippāyantarena āloḷetabbanti attho. Hetusadisamevāti janakakammahetusadisameva.🔽Mahāpakaraṇe āvi bhavissatīti mahāpakaraṇe āgatapāḷiyā pākaṭaṃ uppattividhānaṃ āvi
analyzed: na adhippāya antaram adhippāya antarena āloḷetabbanti atthaḥ hetu sadisam eva ati janaka kamma hetu sadisam eva  mahā pakaraṇe bhavissati iti mahā pakaraṇe āgata pāḷiyā pākaṭam uppatti vidhānam āvi
translated: “Like the cause”: like the generating kamma.

original: bhavissatīti adhippāyena vadati.🔽Kāmāvacarakusalavipākakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: bhavissati iti adhippāyena vadati  kāmāvacara kusala vipāka kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: “Will be clear in the Great Book”: the meaning is that he says this intending that the method of arising will be clear in the text of the Great Book.

original: Rūpāvacarārūpāvacaravipākakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: rūpāvacara arūpāvacara vipāka kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: The explanation of the section on the result of consciousness belonging to the fine-material sphere and the immaterial sphere🔽“Without interruption”: without the condition of falling away.

original: 499. Anantarāyenāti parihānipaccayavirahena. Paṭipadādibhedoti paṭipadārammaṇabhedo.
analyzed: anantarāyena ati parihāni paccaya virahena paṭipad ādi bhedo ti paṭipad ārammaṇa bhedo
translated: “The difference in the way of practice, etc.”: the difference in the way of practice and the object.

original: Tathā hi dukkhapaṭipadaṃ dandhābhiññaṃ jhānaṃ uppādetvā punappunaṃ samāpajjantassa
analyzed: tathā hi dukkha paṭipadam dandhābhiññam jhānam uppādetvā punappunam samāpajjantassa
translated: For when one who has aroused jhāna of painful practice and slow acquisition of knowledge enters upon it again and again,

original: taṃ jhānaṃ taṃpaṭipadameva hoti. Etasmiṃ aparihīne tassa vipāko nibbattamāno tappaṭipadova
analyzed: tam jhānam taṃ paṭipadam eva hoti etasmin a parihīne tassa vipākaḥ nibbattamāno tad paṭipadaḥ uva
translated: that jhāna is of that way of practice. When he does not fall away from it, the result of that jhāna, when it arises, is of that way of practice.

original: bhavituṃ arahatīti. Chandādhipateyyādibhāvo pana tasmiṃ khaṇe vijjamānānaṃ chandādīnaṃ
analyzed: bhavitum arahati iti chanda ādhipateyya ādi bhāvaḥ pana tasmin khaṇe vijjamānānam chanda ādīnam
translated: it is possible for it to be. But the presence of the predominance of zeal, etc., at that moment is due to the fact that zeal, etc.,🔽

original: adhipatipaccayabhāvena hoti, na āgamanavasena. Tathā hi ekameva jhānaṃ nānākkhaṇesu
analyzed: adhipati paccaya bhāvena hoti na āgamana vasena tathā hi ekam eva jhānam nānā kkhaṇesu
translated: It is possible for it to be so. But the presence of the state of predominance of zeal, etc., is due to the condition of predominance of zeal, etc., present at that time; it is not due to their coming. For in the various moments of a single jhāna

original: nānādhipateyyaṃ hoti. Catutthajjhānasseva hi caturiddhipādabhāvena bhāvanā hoti,🔽tasmā vipākassa āgamanavasena chandādhipateyyāditā na vuttā.
analyzed: nānā ādhipateyyam hoti catuttha jhānassa iva hi catur iddhipāda bhāvena bhāvanā hoti  tasmā vipākassa āgamana vasena chanda ādhipateyya ādi tā na vuttā
translated: the state of predominance is different. For the fourth jhāna is developed as the four roads to power,

original: Rūpāvacarārūpāvacaravipākakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Lokuttaravipākakathāvaṇṇanā🔽505. Yathā vaṭṭaṃ ācinati, tathā taṇhādīhi abhisaṅkhataṃ lokiyakammaṃ upacitanti🔽vuccati. Lokuttaraṃ pana evaṃ na hotīti tathā na vuttaṃ. Suddhāgamanavasenāti animittāppaṇihitanāmadāyakehi🔽saguṇārammaṇehi vijjamānehipi phalassa suññatanāmadānadīpane aggahitabhāveneva avomissenāti
analyzed: rūpāvacara arūpāvacara vipāka kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā 🔽lokuttara vipāka kathā vaṇṇanā 🔽yathā vaṭṭam ācinati tathā taṇhā ādīhi abhisaṅkhatam lokiya kammam upacitanti 🔽vuccati lokuttaram pana evam na hoti iti tathā na vuttam suddha āgamana vasena ati animitta appaṇihita nāma dāyakehi 🔽sa guṇa ārammaṇehi vijjamānehi pi phalassa suññata nāma dāna dīpane aggahita bhāvena iva avomissena ati
translated: and so on. That is why it is not said of the resultant jhāna that it has the predominance of zeal, etc., due to their coming.

original: attho. Āgamanato suññatāppaṇihitanāmavato maggassa āgamanīyaṭṭhāne ṭhatvā attano
analyzed: atthaḥ āgamanataḥ suñña tā appaṇihita nāmavataḥ maggassa āgamanīya ṭhāne ṭhatvā attano
translated: The meaning is this. The path called “void” and “desireless” is connected with the arrival of its fruit. It is as if it were established in the place of arrival of the path.

original: phalassa nāmattayadānaṃ yojitaṃ, itarassapi pana tatheva yojetabbaṃ. Nayamattadassanañhetaṃ.
analyzed: phalassa nāmattaya dānam yojitam itarassa api pana tathā iva yojetabbam naya matta dassanam ha etam
translated: The other path is also to be connected in the same way. But this is not the only way.

original: Saguṇārammaṇehi pana nāmattayavato aniccānupassanānantarassapi maggassa āgamanīyaṭṭhāne🔽ṭhatvā attano phalassa nāmattayadānaṃ na nivāritanti. Vaḷañjanakaphalasamāpattiyā🔽ca vipassanāgamanavasena nāmalābhe maggassa viya animittanāmalābho na siyā. Yathā
analyzed: sa guṇa ārammaṇehi pana nāma ttayavataḥ anicca anupassanā anantarassa api maggassa āgamanīya ṭhāne  ṭhatvā attano phalassa nāmattaya dānam na nivāritanti vaḷañjanaka phala samāpattiyā  ca vipassanā gamana vasena nāma lābhe maggassa viya animitta nāma lābhaḥ na siyā yathā
translated: For when the path is established in the place of arrival of the path that possesses the three names and has the three characteristics, namely, impermanence, etc.,🔽it is not prevented from giving its own fruit the three names. And if the path were to obtain the name “signless” in the way already stated, it would not do so by arriving at the signless attainment,🔽just as it does not by arriving at the fruition attainment.

original: pana maggānantarassa viya vaḷañjanakaphalasamāpattiyāpi jhānapaṭipadābhedo hoti,🔽evaṃ suññatādināmalābhe sati animittanāmañca labhatīti. Avūpasantāyāti idaṃ kenaci
analyzed: pana magga anantarassa viya vaḷañjanaka phala samāpattiyā api jhāna paṭipadā bhedaḥ hoti  evam suññata ādi nāma lābhe sati animitta nāman ca labhati iti idam kenacid
translated: But just as the path is differentiated as the fine-material-sphere and immaterial-sphere path according to whether it arrives at fruition attainment of the fine-material sphere or the immaterial sphere,🔽so too it is differentiated as void, etc., and signless, etc., according to whether it arrives at the signless attainment or not.

original: aññena anantaritattā tādisāya eva saddhāya…pe… paññāya ca anantarapaccayabhāvaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: aññena anantarita ttā tādisāya eva paññāya ca anantara paccaya bhāvam sandhāya
translated: “Not being stilled”: this is said because such faith, etc., are not interrupted by anything else and so are a condition, by way of proximity condition, for such faith, etc.

original: vuttaṃ. Tena chandādayopi attano anantarasadisānaṃ chandādīnaṃ uppādakā adhipatibhūtā
analyzed: vuttam tena chanda ādayaḥ api attanaḥ anantara sadisānam chanda ādīnam uppādakāḥ adhipati bhūtā
translated: This is said.

original: adhipatibhūte eva uppādentīti imamatthaṃ dīpeti.🔽555. Kilesasamucchedakassa maggassa sammādiṭṭhiādikassa niyyānikasabhāvassa phalenapi
analyzed: adhipati bhūte eva uppādenti iti imam attham dīpeti  kilesa samucchedakassa maggassa sammādiṭṭhi ādikassa niyyānika sabhāvassa phalena api
translated: By this he shows the meaning that even will, etc., are dominant in producing their own next similar will, etc., and that they produce only those that are dominant.🔽And since the path that terminates in the termination of defilements has the nature of leading out by means of right view, etc.,

original: paṭippassaddhakilesena niyyānasabhāveneva bhavitabbaṃ, tasmā phalepi “maggaṅgaṃ maggapariyāpanna”nti
analyzed: paṭippassaddha kilesena niyyāna sabhāvena iva bhavitabbam tasmā phale pi maggaṅgam magga pariyāpannanti
translated: it must also have the nature of leading out by means of its fruit, which is the termination of defilements. Therefore it is said that even the fruit is a path factor and included in the path.

original: vuttaṃ. Evañca katvā maggavibhaṅge phalesu ca aṭṭhaṅgiko pañcaṅgiko ca maggo uddhaṭo,
analyzed: vuttam evam ca katvā magga vibhaṅge phalesu ca aṭṭhaṅgikaḥ pañcaṅgikaḥ ca maggaḥ uddhaṭaḥ
translated: And it is in this way that the eightfold and fivefold paths are included in the description of the path and its fruit.🔽And so too the enlightenment factors.

original: evaṃ bojjhaṅgāpīti. Maggaṃ upādāyāti maggasadisatāya maggoti imamatthaṃ sandhāyāha.
analyzed: evam bojjhaṅgā api iti maggam upādāya ati magga sadisa tāya maggo ti imam attham sandhāya āha
translated: “Taking the path as a basis”: he says this with reference to the meaning that they are similar to the path.

original: Lokuttaravipākakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.
analyzed: lokuttara vipāka kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā
translated: The commentary on the exposition of the supramundane result is ended.

original: Akusalavipākakathāvaṇṇanā
analyzed: akusala vipāka kathā vaṇṇanā
translated: Exposition of the Result of the Unwholesome

original: 556. Iṭṭhaiṭṭhamajjhattesu viya na aniṭṭhaaniṭṭhamajjhattesu santīraṇaviseso atthi, aniṭṭhārammaṇameva pana adhimattaṃ mandañca evaṃ dvidhā vuttaṃ.
analyzed: iṭṭha aiṭṭha majjhattesu viya na aniṭṭha aniṭṭha majjhattesu santi īraṇa viseso atthi aniṭṭha ārammaṇam eva pana adhimattam mandam ca evam dvidhā vuttam
translated: but only in the object, which is unpleasing, and in the degree of intensity, which is slight.

original: Akusalavipākakathāvaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽Kiriyābyākataṃ
analyzed: akusala vipāka kathā vaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā  kiriyā byākatam
translated: The section on the result of the unprofitable is ended🔽The profitable is threefold as that associated with the three kinds of knowledge,🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.

original: Manodhātucittavaṇṇanā
translated: The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.

original: 566. Vātapupphanti moghapupphaṃ. Taṃ acchinnepi rukkhe na phalati, chinnarukkhapupphaṃ
analyzed: vāta pupphanti mogha puppham tam a chinne api rukkhe na phalati chinna rukkha puppham
translated: The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.

original: pana acchinne phaleyya. Evaṃ acchinnabhavamūlassapi pavattamānaṃ yaṃ na phalati,
analyzed: pana acchinne phaleyyaḥ evam acchinna bhava mūlaḥ api pavattamānam yam na phalati
translated: The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.

original: taṃ vātapupphasadisaṃ. Itarasseva pana pavattamānaṃ chinnarukkhapupphasadisaṃ. Tañhi
analyzed: tam vāta puppha sadisam itarassa iva pana pavattamānam chinna rukkha puppha sadisam tat hi
translated: The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.

original: acchinne bhavamūle phaleyyāti.
analyzed: acchinne bhava mūle phaleyyā ati
translated: The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.🔽The mind element and the mind-consciousness element are profitable, unprofitable, and functional.🔽The mind-consciousness element is also indeterminate.

original: Kiriyamanoviññāṇadhātucittavaṇṇanā🔽568. Loluppataṇhā pahīnāti imassa cittassa paccayabhūtā purimā pavatti dassitā. Idaṃ
analyzed: 🔽loluppa taṇhā pahīnā ati imassa cittassa paccaya bhūtā purimā pavatti dassitā idam
translated: The mind element and the mind-

original: pana cittaṃ vicāraṇapaññārahitanti kevalaṃ somanassamattaṃ uppādentassa hotīti. Evaṃ
analyzed: pana cittam vicāraṇa paññā rahitanti kevalam somanassa mattam uppādentassa hoti iti evam
translated: But when he arouses mere joy, then it is only joy that arises, and the mind is devoid of applied thought and sustained thought.🔽This is how it should be understood in the case of worshipping a shrine, and so on.

original: cetiyapūjādīsupi daṭṭhabbaṃ. Vattaṃ karontoti idaṃ vattaṃ karontassa phoṭṭhabbārammaṇe🔽kāyadvāracittappavattiṃ sandhāya vuttaṃ. Pañcadvārānugataṃ hutvā labbhamānaṃ sandhāya
analyzed: cetiya pūjā ādīsu pi daṭṭhabbam vattam karonto ti idam vattam karontassa phoṭṭhabba ārammaṇe  kāya dvāra citta ppavattim sandhāya vuttam pañca dvāra anugatam hutvā labbhamānam sandhāya
translated: As regards the words “he is glad at the thought ‘I am doing the duties’: ” this is said with reference to the occurrence of consciousness at the mind door in one who is doing the duties, having a tangible as its object.

original: pañcadvāre eva vā loluppataṇhāpahānādipaccavekkhaṇahetubhūtaṃ idameva pavattiṃ sandhāya
analyzed: pañca dvāre eva vā loluppa taṇhā apahāna ādi paccavekkhaṇa hetu bhūtam idam eva pavattim sandhāya
translated: Or it is said with reference to the occurrence of consciousness in the five doors, which is a cause for reviewing the abandoning of greed and craving, which occurs only in the five doors.🔽Herein, the words “he is glad at the thought ‘I am doing the duties’” are said with reference to the occurrence of consciousness in the five doors.

original: tattha tattha “iminā cittena somanassito hotī”ti vuttanti “evaṃ tāva pañcadvāre labbhatī”ti🔽āha. Atītaṃsādīsu appaṭihataṃ ñāṇaṃ vatvā “imehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgatassa buddhassa🔽bhagavato sabbaṃ kāyakammaṃ ñāṇānuparivattī”tiādivacanato “bhagavato idaṃ uppajjatī”ti
analyzed: tattha tattha iminā cittena somanassito hoti iti vuttan ti evam tāva pañca dvāre labbhati iti  āha atīta aṃsa ādīsu appaṭihatam ñāṇam vatvā imehi tīhi dhammehi samannāgatassa buddhassa  bhagavataḥ sabbam kāya kammam ñāṇa anuparivatti iti ādi vacanataḥ bhagavataḥ idam uppajjati iti
translated: This is how it occurs in the five doors, he said.

original: vuttavacanaṃ vicāretabbaṃ. Ahetukassa mūlābhāvena suppatiṭṭhitatā natthīti balabhāvo
analyzed: vutta vacanam vicāretabbam ahetukassa mūla abhāvena suppatiṭṭhita tā natthi iti bala bhāvaḥ
translated: After it was said that his knowledge is unobstructed as to the past, etc., it was said: “The Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possesses three knowledges, of which one is: ‘Knowledge of recollection of past lives.’ The Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possesses three kinds of knowledge, of which one is: ‘Knowledge of faring in accordance with one’s deeds.’ The Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possesses three kinds of knowledge, of which one is: ‘Knowledge of the destruction of the taints.’ The Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possesses three kinds of knowledge, of which one is: ‘Knowledge of the destruction of the taints.’ The Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possesses three kinds of knowledge, of which one is: ‘Knowledge of the destruction of the taints.’ The Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possesses three kinds of knowledge, of which one is: ‘Knowledge of the destruction of the taints.’ The Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possesses three kinds of knowledge, of which one is: ‘Knowledge of the destruction of the taints.’ The Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possesses three kinds of knowledge, of which one is: ‘Knowledge of the destruction of the taints.’ The Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possesses three kinds of knowledge, of which one is: ‘Knowledge of the destruction of the taints.’ The Blessed One, accomplished and fully enlightened, possesses three kinds of knowledge, of which one is: ‘Knowledge of the destruction of the taints.’ The Blessed One, accomplished and

original: aparipuṇṇo, tasmā uddesavāre “samādhibalaṃ hoti, vīriyabalaṃ hotī”ti na vuttaṃ. Tato
analyzed: aparipuṇṇo tasmai uddesa vāre samādhi balam hoti vīriya balam hoti iti na vuttam tatas
translated: since it is incomplete, therefore in the section on the description of the jhāna it is not said that “there is the strength of concentration, there is the strength of energy.”🔽And it is for this very reason that the jhāna factors are not mentioned in the section on the inclusion of the root causes.

original: eva hi ahetukānaṃ saṅgahavāre jhānaṅgāni ca na uddhaṭāni. Teneva imasmimpi ahetukadvaye
analyzed: eva hi ahetukānam saṅgaha vāre ca na uddhaṭāni tena iva imasmin pi ahetuka dvaye
translated: That is why the strengths are not mentioned in the description of the two rootless jhānas.

original: balāni anuddesāsaṅgahitāni. Yasmā pana vīriyassa vijjamānattā sesāhetukehi balavaṃ,
analyzed: balāni anuddesa asaṅgahitāni yasmā pana vīriyassa vijjamāna ttā sesa ahetukehi balavam
translated: But since energy exists, it is stronger than the rest of the rootless jhānas.

original: yasmā ca ettha vitakkādīnaṃ jhānapaccayamattatā viya samādhivīriyānaṃ balamattatā
analyzed: yasmā ca ettha vitakka ādīnam jhāna paccaya matta tā viya samādhi vīriyānam bala matta tā
translated: And since there is strength of concentration and energy here, as there is mere conditionality of the jhāna factors such as applied thought,

original: atthi, tasmā niddesavāre “samādhibalaṃ vīriyabala”nti vatvā ṭhapitaṃ. Yasmā pana
analyzed: atthi tasmai niddesa vāre samādhi balam vīriya balanti vatvā ṭhapitam yasmai pana
translated: therefore in the section on the description of the jhāna it is said that “there is the strength of concentration, there is the strength of energy” and then left at that.

original: neva kusalaṃ nākusalaṃ, tasmā sammāsamādhi micchāsamādhīti, sammāvāyāmo micchāvāyāmoti
analyzed: na iva kusalam na akusalam tasmai sammā samādhi micchā samādhi iti sammā vāyāmaḥ micchā vāyāmaḥ iti
translated: But since it is neither profitable nor unprofitable, the intention is that it is not said that “right concentration” or “wrong concentration” or “right effort” or “wrong effort” exists there.

original: ca na vuttanti adhippāyo. Evaṃ sati mahākiriyacittesu ca etaṃ na vattabbaṃ siyā,
analyzed: ca na vuttanti adhippāyaḥ evam sati mahā kiriya cittesu ca etam na vattabbam siyā
translated: If that were so, it would not be necessary to say that it exists in the five great-sphere consciousnesses,

original: vuttañca, tasmā sammā, micchā vā niyyānikasabhāvābhāvato maggapaccayabhāvaṃ appattā
analyzed: vuttam ca tasmā sammā micchā vā niyyānika sabhāva abhāvataḥ magga paccaya bhāvam a pattā
translated: and yet it is said. So it is not because it is not a path condition that it is not mentioned in the description of the jhāna.

original: samādhivāyāmā idha tathā na vuttāti daṭṭhabbā.🔽574. Indriyaparopariyattaāsayānusayasabbaññutānāvaraṇañāṇāni imassānantaraṃ uppajjamānāni🔽yamakapāṭihāriyamahākaruṇāsamāpattiñāṇāni ca imassa anantaraṃ uppannaparikammānantarāni🔽iminā āvajjitārammaṇeyeva pavattantīti āha “cha…pe… gaṇhantī”ti. Mahāvisayattā mahāgajo🔽viya mahantanti mahāgajaṃ.
analyzed: samādhi vāyāmāḥ idha tathā na vuttā ati daṭṭhabbā  indriya para upari yatta āsaya anusaya sabbaññutā anāvaraṇa ñāṇāni imassa anantaram uppajjamānāni  yamaka pāṭihāriya mahākaruṇā samāpatti ñāṇāni ca imassa anantaram uppanna parikamma anantarāni  iminā āvajjita ārammaṇā iya iva pavattanti iti āha chape gaṇhanti iti mahā visaya ttā mahāgajo  viya mahā gajam
translated: and the wind of concentration are not so called here.

original: Rūpāvacarārūpāvacarakiriyacittavaṇṇanā🔽577. Idāni yāni kiriyāni jātāni, tāni veditabbānīti evaṃ yojanā kātabbā. Attabhāvoti pañcakkhandhā vuccanti.🔽Cittuppādakaṇḍavaṇṇanā niṭṭhitā.🔽2. original: Na hi rūpassa cittuppādena samayavavatthānaṃ sakkā kātuṃ acittasamuṭṭhānasabbhāvato,
analyzed: na hi rūpassa cittuppādena samaya vavatthānam sakkā kātum a citta samuṭṭhāna sabbhāvato
translated: for it is not possible to define matter by the arising of consciousness, because it is not originated by consciousness,

original: cittasamuṭṭhānassa ca anekacittasamuṭṭhānatāya rūpasamuṭṭhāpakacittānañca kesañci
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhānassa ca aneka citta samuṭṭhāna tāya rūpa samuṭṭhāpaka cittānam kesañcid
translated: and because it is not possible to define it since the consciousness that originates it is the origination of many kinds of consciousness and because some consciousnesses that originate matter do not originate it in some places,

original: katthaci asamuṭṭhāpanatāya vavatthānābhāvato, viññattidvayavajjitassa rūpassa acittasahabhubhāvato🔽ca, na ca rūpānaṃ upasampajja viharaṇena samayavavatthānaṃ yujjati mahaggatappamāṇānaṃ
analyzed: katthaci a samuṭṭhāpana tāya vavatthāna abhāvataḥ viññatti dvaya vajjitassa rūpassa a citta sahabhu bhāvataḥ  ca na ca rūpānam upasampajja viharaṇena samaya vavatthānam yujjati mahaggata ppamāṇānam
translated: and because matter other than the two kinds of intimation is not a conascent condition for consciousness,🔽and it is not proper to define matter by “entering upon and abid-ing in” , because matter is not entered upon and abided in like the jhānas of the exalted consciousness,

original: jhānānaṃ viya rūpānaṃ upasampajja vihātabbatābhāvā, upādārūpehi ca na yujjati tesaṃ🔽sahajātādipaccayabhāvena appavattanato, nāpi mahābhūtehi yujjati kesañci mahābhūtānaṃ
analyzed: jhānānam viya rūpānam upasampajja vihātabba tā bhāvāḥ upādā rūpehi ca na yujjati tesam  sahajāta ādi paccaya bhāvena appavattanataḥ na api mahābhūtehi yujjati kesañci mahābhūtānam
translated: and it is not proper to define it by the derived materiality, because the latter does not occur by way of the conascent condition, etc.,

original: kehici upādārūpehi vinā pavattito asamānakālānañca sabbhāvato. Na hi “yasmiṃ samaye
analyzed: kehici upādā rūpehi vinā pavattitaḥ sabbhāvataḥ na hi yasmin samaye
translated: and it is not proper to define it by the primary elements, because some of the primary elements occur without some of the derived materiality, and because they are not of the same time, for it is not possible to say “at whatever time there is earth element there is water element” ,🔽and so on.

original: pathavīdhātu uppannā hoti, tasmiṃ samaye cakkhāyatanaṃ hotī”ti sakkā vattuṃ sotādinissayabhūtāya
analyzed: pathavī dhātu uppannā hoti tasmin samaye cakkha āyatanam hoti iti sakkā vattum sota ādi nissaya bhūtāya
translated: “At the moment of the arising of the earth element, the eye base is present” can be said of the earth element that is the support of the ear, etc.,

original: pathaviyā cittādisamuṭṭhānāya ca saha cakkhāyatanassa abhāvā. Evaṃ sotāyatanādīsupi yojetabbaṃ.
analyzed: pathaviyā citta ādi samuṭṭhānāya ca saha cakkha āyatanassa abhāvā evam sotāyatana ādīsu pi yojetabbam
translated: because the eye base is absent when the earth element is generated by consciousness, etc., and when it is generated together with the eye base. So too should be construed in the case of the ear base, etc.

original: Mahābhūtehi asamānakālāni viññattiupacayādīnipi tasmiṃ samaye hontīti na sakkā vattunti.
analyzed: mahābhūtehi asamāna kālāni viññatti upacaya ādīni pi tasmin samaye honti iti na sakkā vattun ti
translated: And since the intimation, accumulation, etc., which are not of the same time as the primary elements, are also present at that moment, it cannot be said that they are absent.

original: Ekasmiñca kāle anekāni kalāpasahassāni uppajjanti pavattanti ca, na arūpadhammānaṃ🔽viya rūpānaṃ kalāpadvayasahābhāvo atthi. Ekasmiñca kalāpe vattamāne eva aññassa nirodho,
analyzed: ekasmin ca kāle anekāni kalāpa sahassāni uppajjanti pavattanti ca na arūpa dhammānam  rūpānam kalāpa dvaya sahābhāvaḥ atthi ekasmin ca kalāpe vattamāne eva aññassa nirodho
translated: And at one time many thousands of aggregates arise and occur, not two material phenomena together, as in the case of immaterial dhammas.

original: aññassa cuppatti hotīti sabbathā rūpābyākataṃ samayavavatthānaṃ katvā na sakkā vibhajituṃ.
analyzed: aññassa hoti iti sabbathā rūpa abyākatam samaya vavatthānam katvā na sakkā vibhajitum
translated: And while one aggregate is occurring, another ceases and arises. So it is not possible to analyze the materiality that is neutral in every way by way of the divisions of time.

original: Ekakādīhi pana nayehi na hetuādinā sabhāvena vibhajituṃ sakkāti tathā vibhajanatthaṃ
analyzed: ekaka ādīhi pana nayehi na hetu ādinā sabhāvena vibhajitum sakkā ati tathā vibhajana attham
translated: But it is not possible to analyze it by way of cause, etc., by means of the method of the single unit, etc. Therefore,🔽in order to analyze it thus,

original: cittuppādakaṇḍe tāva avibhattaṃ abyākataṃ atthīti dassetuṃ samayavavatthānena vinā
analyzed: cittuppāda kaṇḍe tāva avibhattam abyākatam atthi iti dassetum samaya vavatthānena vinā
translated: In the case of the section on the kinds of consciousness, he said, “What are the states that are indeterminate? There is the profitable …🔽… the unprofitable …🔽… the indeterminate resultants …🔽… the indeterminate functionings …🔽… the immaterial-sphere profitable …🔽… the immaterial-sphere unprofitable …🔽… the immaterial-sphere indeterminate resultants …🔽… the immaterial-sphere indeterminate functionings …🔽… the supramundane …🔽… the unformed element. These are the states that are indeterminate” .🔽For it is not possible to point out a part of the indeterminate by defining it in terms of time, etc., as can be done with the profitable, etc., since it is not classed in any such way.

original: abyākatassa sabhāvatoyeva niddese ekadesaṃ niddisitvā nigamanakaraṇassa anupapattito
analyzed: abyākatassa sabhāvataḥ yā iva niddese eka desam niddisitvā nigamana karaṇassa anupapattito
translated: But when the unclassed is shown as classed, then it is proper to point out a part of it by defining it in terms of time, etc., as can be done with the classed.🔽So he said, “What are the states that are indeterminate? There is the profitable …🔽… the unprofitable …🔽… the indeterminate resultants …🔽… the indeterminate functionings …

original: ca vibhattañca avibhattañca sabbaṃ saṅgaṇhanto āha “katame dhammā abyākatā? Kusalā…pe…
analyzed: ca vibhattam ca a vibhattam ca sabbam saṅgaṇhantaḥ āha katame dhammāḥ abyākatā
translated: … the immaterial-sphere profitable …🔽… the immaterial-sphere unprofitable …🔽… the immaterial-sphere indeterminate resultants …🔽… the immaterial-sphere indeterminate functionings …🔽… the supramundane …

original: asaṅkhatā ca dhātu. Ime dhammā abyākatā”ti. Avibhatte hi vibhajitabbe dassite vibhajanaṃ
analyzed: asaṅkhatā ca dhātu ime dhammā abyākatā ati a vibhatte hi vibhajitabbe dassite vibhajanam
translated: … the unformed element. These are the states that are indeterminate” .

original: yuttaṃ ñātuṃ icchāya uppāditāyāti. Ettha pana vipākakiriyābyākataṃ vibhattattā na🔽vibhajitabbaṃ, asaṅkhatā ca dhātu bhedābhāvato. Yaṃ panettha bhedayuttattā avibhattattā
analyzed: yuttam ñātum icchāya uppāditāya ati ettha pana vipāka kiriyā byākatam na  vibhajitabbam asaṅkhatā ca dhātu bheda abhāvataḥ yam pana ittha bheda yutta ttā a vibhatta ttā
translated: For it is proper to point out a part of the classed when it is classed, and it is proper to point out a part of the unclassed when it is classed.🔽So he said, “What is all materiality? ” and so on. This is the method of interpretation here.

original: ca vibhajitabbaṃ, taṃ vibhajanto āha “tattha katamaṃ sabbaṃ rūpa”ntiādi. Ayamettha pāḷiyojanā.🔽Nayaṃ dassetvāti ettha heṭṭhā gahaṇameva nayadassanaṃ. Taṃ vipākesu katvā viññātattā
analyzed: ca vibhajitabbam tam vibhajantaḥ āha tattha katamam sabbam rūpa ntiādi ayam ettha pāḷiyojanā 🔽nayam dassetvā ti ettha heṭṭhā gahaṇam eva naya dassanam tam vipākesu katvā viññāta ttā
translated: Having shown the method: here the seeing of the method is the taking of it below in the case of the resultants.

original: kiriyābyākatesu nissaṭṭhaṃ. Kāmāvacarādibhāvena vattabbassa kiriyābyākatassa vā dassanaṃ,🔽taṃ katvā kāmāvacarātiādikaṃ gahetvā vuttattā nissaṭṭhaṃ. Pañcavīsati rūpānīti pāḷiyaṃ🔽vuttāni dasāyatanāni pañcadasa ca sukhumarūpāni, upacayasantatiyo vā ekanti katvā
analyzed: kiriyā abyākatesu nissaṭṭham kāmāvacara ādi bhāvena vattabbassa kiriyā abyākatassa vā dassanam  tam katvā kāmāvacara ati ādikam gahetvā vutta ttā nissaṭṭham pañcavīsati rūpāni iti pāḷiyam  vuttāni dasa āyatanāni pañcadasa ca sukhuma rūpāni upacaya santatiyaḥ vā ekanti katvā
translated: and the rest of the material septad is omitted in the case of the rest of the material septad, that is, the rest of the material septad consisting of the rest of the kinds of materiality classed as “in the sense sphere” and so on, and the rest of the kinds of materiality classed as “resultant” and “root-causeless” .

original: hadayavatthuñca. Channavutīti cakkhādidasakā satta utusamuṭṭhānādayo tayo aṭṭhakā🔽utucittajā dve saddā ca. Kalāpabhāvena pavattarūparūpāni “rūpakoṭṭhāsā”ti vuttāni🔽rūpakalāpakoṭṭhāsabhāvato. Koṭṭhāsāti ca aṃsā, avayavāti attho. Koṭṭhanti vā sarīraṃ,🔽tassa aṃsā kesādayo koṭṭhāsāti aññepi avayavā koṭṭhāsā viya koṭṭhāsā. Nibbānaṃ nippadesato🔽gahitanti sopādisesanirupādisesarāgakkhayādiasaṅkhatādivacanīyabhāvena bhinnaṃ nippadesato
analyzed: hadaya vatthum ca channavuti iti cakkha ādi dasakā satta utu samuṭṭhāna ādayo tayo aṭṭhakā 🔽utu citta jāḥ dve ca kalāpa bhāvena pavatta rūpa rūpāni rūpa koṭṭhāsā ti vuttāni 🔽rūpa kalāpa koṭṭhāsa bhāvato koṭṭhāsā ati ca aṃsāḥ avayavā ti attho koṭṭhanti vā sarīram 🔽tassa aṃsā kesa ādayo koṭṭhāsā ti aññe pi avayavā koṭṭhāsāḥ viya koṭṭhāsāḥ nibbānam nippadesato 🔽gahitam ti sa upādi sesa nirupādi sesa rāga kkhaya ādi asaṅkhata ādi vacanīya bhāvena bhinnam nippadesataḥ

original: gahitaṃ. Atthato hi ekāva asaṅkhatā dhātūti.
analyzed: gahitam atthataḥ hi ekā ava asaṅkhatā dhātu uti
translated: and it is taken as that. For in meaning it is the same as the “unformed element.”

original: 584. Sabbanti sakalaṃ cakkavāḷaṃ. Parimaṇḍalaṃ parimaṇḍalasaṇṭhānaṃ, parikkhepato
analyzed: sabbanti sakalam cakkavāḷam parimaṇḍalam parimaṇḍala saṇṭhānam parikkhepato
translated: All: the whole world-sphere. Round: having a round shape. In extent

original: chattiṃsa satasahassāni dasa ceva sahassāni aḍḍhacatutthāni ca yojanasatāni hontīti
analyzed: chattiṃsa sata sahassāni dasa ca iva sahassāni aḍḍha catutthāni ca yojana satāni honti iti
translated: it is thirty-six hundred thousand leagues and ten and a half thousand leagues.

original: attho. Ettha ca vaṭṭaṃ “parimaṇḍala”nti vuttaṃ. Cattāri nahutānīti cattālīsa sahassāni.
analyzed: ettha ca vaṭṭam parimaṇḍalanti vuttam cattāri nahutāni iti cattālīsa sahassāni
translated: This is the meaning. And here the “round” is called “circular.” Four nahutas: forty thousand.

original: Nagavhayāti nagāti avhātabbā nagasaddanāmāti attho.
analyzed: naga vhayā ati nagā ati a vhātabbā naga sadda nāmā ati attho
translated: Gods, demons, etc., are called “gods” and so on because they are called “gods” and so on.

original: Devadānavādīnaṃ tigāvutādisarīravasena mahantāni pātubhūtāni. Tatthāyaṃ vacanattho
analyzed: deva dānava ādīnam tigāvuta ādi sarīra vasena mahantāni pātubhūtāni tattha ayam vacana attho
translated: They are “great beings” because they are manifested with bodies of three gavutas and so on. Herein, this is the word meaning:🔽“Beings” are born, arisen, produced, great, great beings.

original: – bhūtāni jātāni nibbattāni mahantāni mahābhūtānīti. Anekacchariyadassanena anekābhūtavisesadassanavasena
analyzed: bhūtāni jātāni nibbattāni mahantāni mahābhūtāni iti
translated: And because of the manifestation of many kinds of beings, and because of the manifestation of many kinds of beings,

original: ca māyākāro mahanto bhūtoti mahābhūto. Yakkhādayo jātivaseneva mahantā bhūtāti mahābhūtā.
analyzed: ca māyākāraḥ mahantaḥ bhūtaḥ iti mahā bhūtaḥ yakkha ādayaḥ jāti vasena iva mahantā bhūtā ati mahā bhūtā
translated: the magician is a great being, thus he is a “great being” . And ghosts, etc., are great beings by way of species, thus they are “great beings.”

original: Niruḷho vā ayaṃ mahābhūtasaddo tesu daṭṭhabbo. Pathaviyādayo pana mahābhūtā viya
analyzed: niruḷhaḥ vā ayam mahābhūta saddo tesu daṭṭhabbo pathaviya ādayo pana mahābhūtāḥ viya
translated: Or else the word “great” should be taken as a description of the great primaries, as in the expression “great primary of earth” .

original: mahābhūtā. Bhūtasaddassa ubhayaliṅgattā napuṃsakatā katā. Mahāparihāratoti ettha
analyzed: mahābhūtāḥ bhūta saddassa ubhaya liṅga ttā napuṃsaka tā katā mahā parihārato ti ettha
translated: The word “great” is a neuter noun, but the word “primary” is both masculine and neuter,

original: vacanatthaṃ vadanto āha “mahantehi bhūtāni, mahāparihārāni vā bhūtānī”ti. Tattha
analyzed: vacana attham vadantaḥ āha bhūtāni mahā parihārāni vā bhūtāni iti tattha
translated: The meaning of the words “great” and “primary” is explained as follows: “Great” means “having great primaries” or “having great requisites” .

original: pacchimatthe purimapade uttarapadassa parihārasaddassa lopaṃ katvā “mahābhūtānī”ti vuccanti.
analyzed: pacchimatthe purima pade uttara padassa parihāra saddassa lopam katvā mahābhūtāni iti vuccanti
translated: Here the word “primary” is dropped and the word “great” is used in the sense of the last-mentioned meaning.

original: Accimatoti aggissa. Koṭisatasahassaṃ ekaṃ koṭisatasahassekaṃ. Cakkavāḷanti taṃ sabbaṃ🔽āṇākkhettavasena ekaṃ katvā voharanti. Vilīyati khārodakena. Vikīratīti viddhaṃsati.
analyzed: accimataḥ ti aggissa koṭi sata sahassam ekam koṭi sata sahassa ekam cakkavāḷanti tat sabbam  ekam katvā voharanti vilīyati khāra udakena vikīrati iti
translated: “From the flame” means from the fire. “A hundred thousand koṭis” means one hundred thousand koṭis. “The world-sphere” means the whole world-sphere.🔽They call it “one” because it is the sphere of the influence of one single king. “It melts” means it is dissolved by the rain. “It is scattered” means it is destroyed.

original: Upādinnakesu vikāraṃ dassento “patthaddho”tiādimāha. Kaṭṭhamukhena vāti vā-saddo
analyzed: upādinnakesu vikāram dassento patthaddhaḥ ti ādim āha kaṭṭha mukhena vā ati vāsaddaḥ
translated: Showing the change in the clung-to, he says “it is extended” , etc. The word “like” means “similar to.”

original: upamattho. Yathā kaṭṭhamukhasappena daṭṭho patthaddho hoti, evaṃ pathavīdhātuppakopena
analyzed: upamatthaḥ yathā kaṭṭha mukha sappena daṭṭhaḥ patthaddhaḥ hoti evam pathavī dhātu pakopena
translated: Just as a snake bitten by a stick-mouth snake becomes extended, so the earth-element becomes extended by the disturbance of the earth-element.

original: so kāyo kaṭṭhamukheva hoti, kaṭṭhamukhamukhagato viya patthaddho hotīti attho. Atha🔽vā vā-saddo evasaddassatthe. “Pathavīdhātuppakopenā”ti etassa ca parato āharitvā🔽veditabbo. Tatrāyamattho – “kaṭṭhamukhena daṭṭhopi kāyo pathavīdhātuppakopeneva patthaddho
analyzed: so kāyaḥ kaṭṭha mukhā iva hoti kaṭṭha mukha mukha gataḥ viya patthaddhaḥ hoti iti atthaḥ atha  vā vā saddaḥ eva saddassa atthe pathavī dhātu pakopena ati etassa ca paratas āharitvā  veditabbaḥ tatra ayam atthaḥ kaṭṭha mukhena daṭṭhaḥ api kāyaḥ pathavī dhātu pakopena iva patthaddhaḥ
translated: The body is like a mouth-full of food, the meaning is that it is as if it were a mouth-full of food.

original: hoti, tasmā pathavīdhātuyā aviyutto so kāyo sabbadā kaṭṭhamukhamukhagato viya hotī”ti.🔽Atha vā aniyamattho vā-saddo. Tatrāyamattho – “kaṭṭhamukhena daṭṭho kāyo patthaddho🔽hoti vā na vā hoti mantāgadavasena, pathavīdhātuppakopena pana mantāgadarahito so
analyzed: hoti tasmā pathavī dhātuyā a viyuttaḥ so kāyo sabbadā kaṭṭha mukha mukha gataḥ viya hoti iti  atha vā aniyama atthaḥ vāsaddaḥ tatra ayam atthaḥ kaṭṭha mukhena daṭṭhaḥ kāyaḥ patthaddho  hoti vā na vā hoti mantāgada vasena pathavī dhātu pakopena pana mantāgada rahito so
translated: Or the word vā is in the sense of eva . “By disturbance of the earth element” should be brought in after this. The meaning there is this. The body is as if it were a mouth-full of food, because it is disturbed by disturbance of the earth element. Therefore the body is never free from the earth element, and so it is as if it were a mouth-full of food.

original: kāyo kaṭṭhamukhamukhagato viya hoti ekantapatthaddho”ti. Pūtiyoti kuthito. Mahāvikārāni
analyzed: kāyo kaṭṭha mukha mukha gataḥ viya hoti ekanta patthaddho ti kuthitaḥ mahā vikārāni
translated: Or the word vā is in the sense of aniyama . The meaning there is this. The body may or may not be disturbed by a mouth-full of food, according to whether there is indigestion or not. But the body, which is without indigestion, by disturbance of the earth element, is as if it were a mouth-full of food, and is entirely disturbed.

original: bhūtānīti mahāvikārāni jātāni, vijjamānānīti vā attho. Ettha ca purimapade uttarapadassa
analyzed: bhūtāni iti mahā vikārāni jātāni vijjamānāni iti vā atthaḥ ettha ca purima pade uttara padassa
translated: Rotten means decayed. The great disturbances have arisen, or the meaning is that they exist. And here the word eva in the first line is to be construed with the word eva in the second line, and the word vā in the second line is to be construed with the word vā in the third line.

original: vikārasaddassa lopaṃ katvā “mahābhūtānī”ti vuttāni.
analyzed: vikāra saddassa lopam katvā mahābhūtāni iti vuttāni
translated: and the word “great” is used by dropping the vowel i of the word vikāra .

original: Pathavītiādinā sabbalokassa pākaṭānipi vipallāsaṃ muñcitvā yathāsabhāvato pariggayhamānāni
analyzed: pathavī iti ādinā sabba lokassa vipallāsam muñcitvā yathā sabhāvato pariggayhamānāni
translated: Earth, etc., are obvious to all the world, but they are not discerned as they are in reality unless they are freed from misapprehension.

original: mahantena vāyāmena vinā na pariggayhantīti pākaṭānipi duviññeyyasabhāvattā “mahantānī”ti
analyzed: mahantena vā āyāmena vinā na pariggayhanti iti pākaṭāni pi du viññeyya sabhāva ttā mahantāni iti
translated: And they are not discerned without great effort. So they are called “great” because they are difficult to discern, though they are obvious.🔽For when one stands by thinking that they are easy to discern and not great,

original: vuccanti. Tāni hi suviññeyyāni amahantānīti gahetvā ṭhito tesaṃ duppariggahitataṃ
analyzed: vuccanti tāni hi su viññeyyāni amahantāni iti gahetvā ṭhitaḥ tesam duppariggahita tam
translated: he sees that they are difficult to discern,🔽and he understands that they are great.

original: disvā “aho mahantāni etānī”ti pajānāti. Upādāyāti etena viññāyamānā pacchimakālakiriyā🔽pavattīti katvā “pavattarūpa”nti vuttaṃ. Evañhi “upādāyā”ti etena paṭiccasamuppannatā
analyzed: disvā aho mahantāni etāni iti pajānāti upādāya ati etena viññāyamānā pacchima kālakiriyā  pavattī iti katvā pavatta rūpan ti vuttam evam hi upādāya ati etena paṭiccasamuppanna tā
translated: By “derived” is meant the occurrence of the last-moment materiality that is discerned.🔽For it is said thus: “Derived is that which is derived by conditions. ”

original: vuttā hotīti. Atha vā upādāyati nissayatīti upādāyaṃ, upādāyameva rūpaṃ upādāyarūpaṃ,
analyzed: vuttā hoti iti atha vā upādāyati nissayati iti upādāyam upādāyam eva rūpam upādāya rūpam
translated: Or alternatively, the meaning can be treated according to the method of the Abhidhamma Vibhāvinī, namely, that it is derived by clinging, thus it is derived; the materiality that is derived is derived materiality.🔽This is a term for materiality that is dependent on another, which is exclusively dependent.

original: aññanissayassa ekantanissitassa rūpassetaṃ adhivacanaṃ. Taṃ pana na sattassa, nāpi
analyzed: añña nissayassa ekanta nissitassa rūpassa itam adhivacanam tam pana na sattassa na api
translated: But that is not the being’s, nor is it the being’s

original: vedanādino tadabhāvepi bhāvatoti dassetuṃ “catunnaṃ mahābhūtāna”ntiādimāha. Bhavati
analyzed: vedanā ādino tad abhāve pi bhāvato ti dassetum catunnam mahābhūtānanti ādim āha bhavati
translated: and the other aggregates, feeling, etc., are present even when materiality is absent.

original: hi nissayarūpānaṃ sāmibhāvoti.
analyzed: hi nissaya rūpānam sāmi bhāvaḥ ti
translated: The words “in dependence on the four great primaries” are stated to show that the derived materiality has the great primaries as its owner.

original: Tividharūpasaṅgahavaṇṇanā🔽585. Pakiṇṇakadukesu ajjhattikadukaṃ muñcitvā añño sabbadukehi tikavasena yojanaṃ
analyzed: tividha rūpa saṅgaha vaṇṇanā  pakiṇṇaka dukesu ajjhattika dukam muñcitvā sabba dukehi tika vasena yojanam
translated: The exposition of the three-aggregate-inclusive materiality🔽. Except for the internal-external-things-duka, there is no other duka that can be yoked with all the remaining dukas in the way that the three-aggregate-inclusive materiality is yoked with all the remaining dukas.

original: gacchanto natthi, viññattiduko ca yojanaṃ na gacchatīti sabbadukayogīsu ādibhūtaṃ
analyzed: gacchantaḥ natthi viññatti duko ca yojanam na gacchati iti sabba duka yogīsu ādi bhūtam
translated: And the intimation-duka cannot be yoked with all the remaining dukas.

original: ajjhattikadukameva gahetvā sesehi sabbadukehi yojetvā tikā vuttā. Sakkā hi etena
analyzed: ajjhattika dukam eva gahetvā sesehi sabba dukehi yojetvā tikā vuttā sakkā hi etena
translated: Therefore, only the internal-external-things-duka, which is the first of all the dukas, is taken and yoked with the remaining dukas to form the triads.

original: nayena aññesampi dukānaṃ dukantarehi labbhamānā tikayojanā viññātunti.
analyzed: nayena aññesam pi dukānam duka antarehi labbhamānā tika yojanā viññātunti
translated: For it is possible to understand the yoking of the other dukas with the remaining dukas in the way that the internal-external-things-duka is yoked with them.

original: Catubbidhādirūpasaṅgahavaṇṇanā🔽586. Catukkesu ekantacittasamuṭṭhānassa viññattidvayabhāvato viññattidukādīhi samānagatiko
analyzed: catubbidha ādi rūpa saṅgaha vaṇṇanā  catukkesu ekanta citta samuṭṭhānassa viññatti dvaya bhāvataḥ viññatti duka ādīhi samāna gatikaḥ
translated: The exposition of the four-aggregate-inclusive materiality, etc.

original: cittasamuṭṭhānadukoti tena saha upādādukassa yojanāya labbhamānopi catukko na vutto,
analyzed: citta samuṭṭhāna duko ti tena saha upādā dukassa yojanāya labbhamānaḥ api catukkaḥ na vuttaḥ
translated: In the case of the four-aggregate-inclusive materiality, the intimation-duka is not mentioned as a four-aggregate-inclusive materiality because it is included in the consciousness-originated-materiality-duka, which is included in the four aggregates, and because it is included in the intimation-duka, which is included in the three aggregates.

original: tathā sanidassanadukādīnaṃ tena tassa ca oḷārikadūradukehi yojanāya labbhamānā na
analyzed: tathā sani dassana duka ādīnam tena tassa ca oḷārika dūra dukehi yojanāya labbhamānā na
translated: So too, the visible-data base, etc., and the visible-data jhana, etc., are not mentioned as being similar to the gross-to-the-distant jhana, etc., because they are similar to them.

original: vuttā, dhammānaṃ vā sabhāvakiccāni bodhetabbākārañca yāthāvato jānantena bhagavatā
analyzed: vuttā dhammānam vā sabhāva kiccāni bodhetabba ākāram ca yāthāvataḥ jānantena bhagavatā
translated: Or alternatively, since the Exalted One, who knows the true nature of dhammas, has not stated that any other jhana is similar to that jhana,

original: tena aññesaṃ tassa ca aññehi yojanā na katāti kiṃ ettha kāraṇapariyesanāya, addhā🔽sā yojanā na kātabbā, yato bhagavatā na katāti veditabbā. Aññe pana pakiṇṇakadukā🔽aññehi pakiṇṇakadukehi yojetuṃ yuttā, tehi yojitā eva. Vatthudukādīsu pana sotasamphassārammaṇadukādayo
analyzed: tena aññesam tassa ca aññehi yojanā na katā ati kim ettha kāraṇa pariyesanāya addhā  sā yojanā na kātabbā yatas bhagavatā na katā ati veditabbā aññe pana  aññehi pakiṇṇaka dukehi yojetum yuttā tehi yojitā eva vatthu duka ādīsu pana sota samphassa ārammaṇa duka ādayo
translated: why seek a reason for it? It must be that it is not to be so stated.🔽But other jhanas that are called “mixed” are similar to other mixed jhanas and are so stated.

original: vajjetvā aññehi ārammaṇabāhirāyatanādilabbhamānadukehi upādinnakadukassa upādinnupādāniyadukassa
analyzed: vajjetvā aññehi ārammaṇa bāhira āyatana ādi labbhamāna dukehi upādinna ka dukassa upādinna upādāniya dukassa
translated: But in the case of the bases beginning with the eye, the eye-contact-as-object jhana, etc., are not mentioned as being similar to the other jhanas that occur with visible-data objects, etc., as their object.🔽The jhana of the clung-to and the jhana of what is clung to and clung to are mentioned as being similar to the jhana of the four elements,

original: ca yojanāya catukkā labbhanti, cittasamuṭṭhānadukassa ca sabbārammaṇabāhirāyatanādilabbhamānadukehi.
analyzed: ca yojanāya catukkāḥ labbhanti citta samuṭṭhāna dukassa ca sabba ārammaṇa bāhira āyatana ādi labbhamāna dukehi
